story:
For ordering info, visit us at our official website: http://www.wahprods.com

Pre-order now, ships in September!

Following up successful campaigns for the P. Craig Russell Sketchbook Archives, the Virtuoso Adult Coloring Book and P. Craig Russell's Jungle Book and Other Stories Fine Art Edition, we are proud to present this campaign to fund the publication of a second Fine Art Edition—this time for P. Craig Russell's Salome and Other Stories!

The Ultimate Format For Lovers Of Fine Comic Art

This beautiful 12"X17" oversized hardcover features complete stories scanned from P. Craig Russell's stunning original art. While appearing to be in black & white, each page has been scanned in color to recreate as closely as possible the experience of viewing the actual originals—including blue pencils, notes, art corrections and more. Pages are reproduced at original size on heavy paper stock to provide fans, aficionados and collectors with the best possible reproductions. 

The book includes the following complete stories:

  • Salome (32 pages)
  • The Clowns (34 pages)
  • The Godfather's Code (33 pages)
  • Unto this World (3 pages)
  • Eine Heldentraum (6 pages)
  • Between Two Worlds (3 pages)

In addition to these stories, this special Fine Art Edition includes artist's notes with background info on each story as well as a Bonus Gallery with additional art and preliminary drawings that relate to the complete stories. The book's final page count is 132 pages.



About The Artist

A graduate of the University of Cincinnati with a degree in painting, P. Craig Russell has run the gamut in comics. After establishing a name for himself at Marvel on Killraven and Dr. Strange, he went on to become one of the pioneers who opened new vistas for this underestimated field with, among other works, adaptations of operas by Mozart (The Magic Flute), Strauss (Salome) and Wagner (The Ring of the Nibelung). Russell is also known for his Fairy Tales of Oscar Wilde series as well as his graphic novel adaptations of Neil Gaiman’s The Sandman: The Dream Hunters, Coraline, Murder Mysteries and American Gods.


Sample Pages


 

Misc. Info

Because of their size and weight, our Fine Art Editions must ship via Priority Mail International to all non-US customers, which is a bit expensive. Keep in mind that we lose a substantial percentage of what customers pay for shipping before we even see those funds due to Kickstarter and PayPal fees. Plus, there are additional costs for heavy-duty outer boxes, bubble wrap, shipping peanuts, etc. Because of this, we are actually partially subsiding foreign shipping ourselves because we have to make up the difference in what is lost due to those fees and the costs of shipping supplies.

That said, we greatly appreciate our foreign backers and we hope that you will understand why the international shipping is so expensive. Especially in the case of the 7+ pound Fine Art Editions, Priority Mail International is pretty much our only option to get the books to you safely and securely.

Also, orders shipped outside of the United States will almost always be charged customs fees when they arrive. These fees may include taxes, duties, processing fees, brokerage fees, etc. We have no control over the amount or assessment of these fees. If you are not familiar with the customs laws and fees in your country, please check with your local customs office for more information.

It is possible that the delivery of your order could be delayed due to customs processing. If your order does not arrive in a reasonable amount of time, you should check with your local customs office to see if they are holding the package for payment of fees.

story:
My name is Matt 'DrDubz' Warwick, freelance illustrator and  FERAL is an ongoing labour of love I have worked on for the past 6 years, spanning 3 books and around 400+ pages of bone crunching action and heart wrenching character moments. It's been revered as a breath of fresh air in regards to anthropomorphic comics and is still going strong with three successful funding campaigns under its belt.

If you are interested in catching up, you can purchase the book in PDF form by clicking here. Paperback volumes will be available at a later date.

To quote the last campaign's description, which doesn't need changing honestly: "FERAL is the story of a proficient fighter and hustler named Hayley Rosa, who in previous two books has made huge leaps within the fighting circuit 'FERAL' in an incredibly short time, quickly breaking into the top tier. Despite this however, events unfold that take a toll on her confidence, and awaken her dangerous nature."

Book number four is where the story slows down a little. After her rage tips her over a line she never imagined she would cross, Hayley finds herself ostracized by members of the circuit, leading her to question what she's even doing in Alta to begin with, as well as where she could possibly go from there. A surprise visit on a lonely rooftop triggers something within Hayley, something that allows her to finally face the things she suppressed all these years. It will be poignant and eye opening, and also incredibly important for the story as a whole.

My ultimate goal with this series is to create a story that can be enjoyed by furries and non furs alike. Whether you're in it for the martial arts or the character development, you'd get something good and mature out of it. I've been drawing all my life, and have degrees in moving image media and digital animation, which are good foundations for my narrative and comic art. I'm also a martial arts film appreciator and practitioner, and it all combines to create my hard hitting style. Three books in, the trials of pro street fighter Hayley Rosa are followed by all kinds of people who've been patiently waiting for my year hiatus to end so her story can continue. As promised, this book will finally delve into why our protagonist is who she is.

Ever since my Aussie housemate paid for the first Feral prototypes to be printed, this series has been kept afloat by wonderful people who believe in the project enough to invest in it each campaign. It's been successful every year since then. The money goes towards printing costs for the various perks and of course the book itself, of which I usually print off in runs of 100, which provide enough for both contributors and random purchases online and at the Confuzzled convention in May, incidentally the deadline to complete this volume.

I'll be aiming for £1500, which is a perfect amount to get the printing and products done, as well as commission artists to assist in shading and inking. By January next year the majority of the book will be done, leaving final touch ups. Anything beyond that will be used for living expenses so I can concentrate on the comic itself and not really need to supplement myself with commissions that will eat into valuable comic production time. It will also allow me to continue employing artists to get more done so I can complete the perks quicker and generally relieve a lot of stress.

The base amount will be closer to about £1200 after Paypal takes it's cut. I'll be chipping in some of my own funds to help the general costs, but at least the bulk of it will be covered by your contributions. To break down approximate costs -

  • 100x A5 books @ 160+ pages  - £250 - £300
  • Extra copies of older books (around 100 total) - £250 - £300
  • Paid help - £100 - £120 (possibly more depending on total amount)
  • Misc (other perk rewards) - £150 - £250*
  • Postage - £300+ (world-wide shipping can be expensive when books are involved.)

For your contributions, I've gathered a list of rewards that fans can appreciate greatly. I'm focusing on more physical rewards this year, as the book's contents won't have space or opportunities for crowd cameo appearances this time around. Perks include:

  • Digital and physical copies of the fourth book, signed by the author.
  • Badge commissions, that will be printed on awesome stainless steel dog tags courtesy of Paw Printing.
  • Large commissions, featuring your character facing off against one of the cast of the comic, a staple favourite of the campaigns so far.
  • A plethora of other Feral goodies, including postcards and stickers.

Last campaign raised a whopping $4,350 ($3945 after fees, also yes, I worked in dollars last campaigns) which was just shy of the $4500 milestone to get Feral sold at Eurofurrence. This year however, I'm not really making stretch goals, as I want to be solely focused  on the comic and the perks. That said, the more money I make, the more books I can ultimately print out and more months I can pay up to reduce commissions time. Whatever you can spare is always appreciated, so thank you in advance!

The risks have not changed much from previous campaigns, and I've managed to battle through no matter what. Thankfully I'm super passionate about this project, and have certainly become more proficient with the programs I use over the years. Of course there are other risks:

  • My computer explodes!.. Or any of my equipment honestly. Thankfully my tablet is cheap enough to replace, and I have options and backup computers, albeit slower and clunkier. Some of the funds will be allocated to fix technical issues regardless, so my progress will be slowed to a crawl rather than stopped outright
  • Not enough moneyyyy!.. Which is a minor problem all things considered, because the comic is happening regardless of whether the final amount is made or not. If I don't get extra funds, I will have to compensate by doing commissions/ getting a part time day job, which again slows the progress immensely and may cause me to miss the May deadline. We comic artists are only human after all and I hope to create a quality product without needless stress butchering my creativity.
  • My arm falls off... Or I just get very ill. Thankfully it's not too hard to  sit at a desk and draw, but again the project will be slowed. Thankfully with my paid help, the shading and type can be made if I am incapacitated for a while.

I am at the moment also experimenting with various on demand print companies so I can create the books easier and allow you all to get physical copies easier and direct from printers. This will include the A4 deluxe editions promised from the last campaign, which will be two books in one, parts one + two and three+ four respectively.

Spreading the word is just as appreciated as throwing dollar bills in my face. Knowing I can afford the end products and all that is awesome, but nothing beats knowing people are hyping up the masses for your passion project.

The easiest and quickest way is to simply share this page on social media, or even just lend people your books and let them make up their own minds!

Of course, if that's not an option, maybe fund my other small projects, such as my Redbubble shop or contribute to my personal Patreon to help monthly with a small amount to buy food.

You can also follow me on Twitter to keep up with my shenanigans and current projects, along with the official Feral comic Facebook page.

Tell your friends, tell your family. The more people that know this campaign exists, the greater the success, thus creating a greater product all round. Regardless, I thank you in advance for your faith, support and love for the story so far. I'm glad you're all on board, whether recent or from the start, because without you this comic would not exist. Here's to an eventual incredible conclusion to Hayley's journey, and as always...

story:
Hello Potential IndieGoGo Backers! Welcome to the campaign to fund EMOJI LEAGUE: Issue #1

Emoji League is a superhero-style team-up adventure that imagines "what would it be like if people had emojis as faces?" And what started out as a meme has become a comic book where superpowered heroes save the day! And don't we all need heroes these days?
The plot of issue #1 follows 5 people who live normal lives by day, but at night they defend the earth from giant spider-frog-tentacle robots with cannons for arms, and an army of aliens in flying saucers from Jupiter.
The next issue contains the diabolical story of a mad scientist who wants to enslave the world with his experimental internet gas!
They save the world but can they save themselves?
This is an action-packed comic with heart and humor, that is fun for everyone in the family.
The best way to describe it is if you took 1950's SciFi movies, Super Friends, and the 90's X-Men Cartoons, put them in a blender, and hit the smoothy button. It's a little campy and self-aware but in a good way. I promise it's in a good way ;) 

What's Going To Happen?

I plan to release a graphic novel that is made up of a 3 part series of floppies that will be collected and sold as a 64-page graphic novel.

To get the ball rolling we are releasing Issue #1 as a 21-page floppy, we already have ALL of the pages drawn and inked as of June 20th. And it is going into fulfillment in August.

PERKS!

  • When you back Issue #1 you get an 8-page coloring book for your kids, wife, girlfriend, yourself, whatever you want.
  • When you back Issue #1 you will receive a code to get a discount on your future purchase of the 64-page Graphic Novel.
  • And we have the perks of two beautiful posters as add-ons.
  • We have 5 shirts with sayings and emoji faces on them to choose from.
  • Since the trade paperback is actually 3 individual floppies collected into one book, when the Graphic Novel goes into funding we're including an option to get the three parts as individual floppies along with the Graphic Novel, two posters, and variant covers.
  • I'm also creating stretch goals so that if we exceed certain levels every backer will get additional perks at no cost to them, we haven't figured out what just yet, but think bookmarks, posters, extra books, or additional coloring books.

No-Risk Guarantee

We already have the money set aside to print the first wave of fulfillment, and that is because I'm lucky to work with several authors, and so we already have the printer lined up. And that's thanks to the help of people the award-winning author of the #EmojiBibleProject John Stahl. So I we can guarantee that even if we do not hit the funding goal that the book will be printed and all backers will receive their books even if it is at our own expense. So, if we do not hit the goal I will use what we raised to pay the artists and I'll pay the printer myself. The most important thing is making sure everyone who backs the campaign gets their book, poster, or shirt.

It's really important to me to make a comic that all parents can feel comfortable giving to their kids.

The average age of a comic book reader is somewhere in their mid-40s, and many of them are even walking away from comics because of the poor quality and crappy stories. We need to engage the next generation of comic book fans and we do that by making a solid comic that has all the things we loved about comics for the last 80 years and make sure it is suitable for all audiences. That means heroes that are actually good, characters that are relatable, high-quality stories, men and women who look like men and women, and I promise no fuchsia-colored lighting schemes!

Why Emojis? Because they express emotion.

Here's a video where The Christian Nomad, who is doing most of the layouts and inks, explains a little more about why we want to do this comic and how we are using the concept of emojis to bring this idea to life.

https://vimeo.com/410794439

Whether You Back Us or Not There Are Many Ways You Can Help

I know times are tough for many, many people out there, so if you just cannot back us financially but you still like the idea:
Go ahead and share this on your social media,
or send a link to someone who you think might be interested or who has children that might enjoy a super hero comic.
They make great gifts or even stocking stuffers, so maybe you don't read comics but have kids, or nieces and nephews, this would make a wonderful present.

And no matter what you decide I want you to wish you good luck, good health, and God Bless!

story:
"Immortality means never being able to live down your mistakes." - Doctor Twilight

If you suddenly found yourself to be immortal, how would you react? Would you be ecstatic with the glee of a youthful teenager? Would you begin to plot and scheme about how you can begin an empire you can rule for all eternity? Would you welcome the chance to experience lifetimes of new things? Alternatively, what if you made a mistake and had to live the rest of your immortal life paying a debt that can never be settled.

In 1596 Doctor Twilight made one of the greatest mistakes of his life when he and other practicioners of magic met for an event called "The Crossing." Set in Baguio, Philippines, Doctor Twilight (Natanael de Velazquez) and 14 other pracitioners of magic attempted to crossover into the first level of hell: the dream realm. However, during the spell something goes awry and everyone in attendance is sent sprawling across time and space. Those who return, do so with newfound immortality. Since his failure, de Velazquez has attempted to find his friends so they can redo the spell and undo his horrible mistake, one that continues to threaten the barriers of reality. But more importantly, more than anything, he wants to find his daughter, Angelita...

Who We Are

Crystal Fractal Comics is a Toronto-based comic publishing company founded by Publisher Derrek Lennox in 2007. Over six years the company has worked with some very talented people and are proud of the work we've done on our titles.

The Crystal Fractal Universe (CFU) itself is a mystical world fuelled by magic but ruled by deception. We've aimed to focus on providing the unexpected to readers, because we feel that's part of what makes a good story.

The Project

Doctor Twilight is Crystal Fractal Comics' flagship title and centrepiece to our upcoming short film, Natanael. The first issue of the Doctor Twilight comic series was released in 2010 and since then CFC Publisher Derrek Lennox, Senior Editor Andrew Ardizzi and series writer Jeff Haas have worked to complete the second issue of the two-part arc. The great news is that we finished the script, art, lettering and editing some time ago. The bad news is that we haven't released it yet simply due to the market conditions for independent serial comics.

And so Crystal Fractal Comics shifted philosophies.

The Heart of Vitthar graphic novel will collect Doctor Twilight number 1 (released in 2010) along with the unpublished Doctor Twilight number 2, and two unpublished short stories featuring Velvet Angel and Magus Rex that tie directly into the Heart of Vitthar storyline. "The Crossing" (from CFU #0) will also be included in order to give background to readers who may be unfamiliar with the history of the Crystal Fractal Universe. Altogether the collected edition will include:

CFU #0: The Crossing (7 pages - Writer: Derrek Lennox & Jeff Haas; Art: Jian Yi)

Dr. Twilight #1 (Writer: Jeff Haas; Art: Alisson Borges)

Dr. Twilight #2 (Writer: Jeff Haas; Art: Gemma Magno & Marlon Ilagan - Cover by Alisson Borges and Caleb)

Magus Rex Special (Writer: Jack Kovac; Art: JianYi)  

Velvet Angel Interlude (Writer: Derrek Lennox & Jack Kovac; Art: Thony Sillas)

The collected edition will also include character designs, artwork, and creator interviews. Altogether Dr. Twilight: The Heart of Vitthar will be 80 pages in total, with no shortage of treats for our supporters, our friends.

How will your contributions help?

Much of the work has already been done. The published stories featured in Dr. Twilight #1 and CFU #0 are complete. Dr. Twilight #2 is completed, while the other stories that tie into the The Heart of Vitthar story are in progress. Your contributions will first help us finish the artwork, but in the grander scheme help us collect, arrange and publish these stories for our loyal fans as a full 80-page graphic novel, sprinkled with all the extras you deserve.

Your contributions will also help shoot the CFC/Smiling Ninja co-production NATANAEL based on Doctor Twilight. Casting and filming will begin in August in Toronto. 


Finally, thank you!

If you checked out this page, thank you. If you contribute, thank you. If you share, retweet or support us in any way, thank you. We won't forget the people who helped us along the way, so whether you share our campaign page or toss in a couple of dollars towards the projects, we truly appreciate each of you.

Thank you.

Kieron O'Gorman, Dino Caruso, Jack Kovac, Shawn Ritcher, Derrek Lennox, Andrew Uys, Andrew Ardizzi 

"Immortality means a lifetime's worth of opportunities to find redemption." - Doctor Twilight

Please note that shipping and handing is not included and we will arrange to give you your perks in person where possible! If you do require shipping, we can discuss that when it is time!  Thanks again for your support!
story_txt:
"Immortality means never being able to live down your mistakes." - Doctor Twilight

If you suddenly found yourself to be immortal, how would you react? Would you be ecstatic with the glee of a youthful teenager? Would you begin to plot and scheme about how you can begin an empire you can rule for all eternity? Would you welcome the chance to experience lifetimes of new things? Alternatively, what if you made a mistake and had to live the rest of your immortal life paying a debt that can never be settled.
In 1596 Doctor Twilight made one of the greatest mistakes of his life when he and other practicioners of magic met for an event called "The Crossing." Set in Baguio, Philippines, Doctor Twilight (Natanael de Velazquez) and 14 other pracitioners of magic attempted to crossover into the first level of hell: the dream realm. However, during the spell something goes awry and everyone in attendance is sent sprawling across time and space. Those who return, do so with newfound immortality. Since his failure, de Velazquez has attempted to find his friends so they can redo the spell and undo his horrible mistake, one that continues to threaten the barriers of reality. But more importantly, more than anything, he wants to find his daughter, Angelita...
Who We Are
Crystal Fractal Comics is a Toronto-based comic publishing company founded by Publisher Derrek Lennox in 2007. Over six years the company has worked with some very talented people and are proud of the work we've done on our titles.
The Crystal Fractal Universe (CFU) itself is a mystical world fuelled by magic but ruled by deception. We've aimed to focus on providing the unexpected to readers, because we feel that's part of what makes a good story.

story:
∆†∆

Negative Pleasure Publications (negativepleasure.storenvy.com, jeanscomics.tumblr.com) is a Brooklyn-based comics and media publisher.  Currently, we publish the yearly anthology Jeans, the first two issues of which have featured worked by Benjamin Marra, Alabaster Pizzo, Alex Degen, Zach Hazard Vaupen, Pete Toms, Karissa Sakumoto, Claire Donner, Harris Smith, Stephanie Davidson, Amy Searles, Laurie Pina, Olivia Fox, Leah Wishnia, Laura Perez-Harris, Anthony Meloro, Madeleine Bliss, Jessica Hansen, Garret Young, Wiley Wiggins and others.

In 2014, we are looking to expand our publishing from 1 or 2 comics a year to 6, as well as a second printing of Jeans #2.  These will include:

-Felony Comics- A full color anthology of crime stories by Alex Degen,
Lale Westvind, Pete Toms and Benjamin Urkowitz, with a cover by
Benjamin Marra and pinups by Karissa Sakumoto and others (out in
April)

-Revulsion Comics- A b&w anthology of horror stories by Amy Searles,
Josh Freydkis, Garrett Young, Anthony Meloro and Laurie Pina, with
pinups by G.W. Duncanson and others (out in April)

-Night Burgers (working title)- A comic designed to be viewed under
blacklight, by Amy Searles and others.  Comes with stereoscopic
glasses for psychedelic 3-D effect (out this fall).

-Monster Mash- A photo/art zine by me and Glitterguts, featuring my
monster self-portraits and her texture photography (out this fall).

-JEANS 3- Creators TBD (out in November)

-A comic focusing on the work of one specific artist.  This is in the
works but I don't want to jinx it by saying who.  (out in late
2014/early 2015).

Contributions will go towards printing costs.  We are looking to improve the quality of our books and the quantity we are able to produce.

∆‡∆

Each of the smaller comics we produce this year will cost about 600 dollars for a run of 500 books, Jeans #3 will cost about a thousand dollars.  The more money we are able to raise, the more copies we will be able to print!
All other money raised will go towards paying the artists and towards future publishing projects.
All perks will be shipped with extras including bonus comics, mixtapes, toys and more...

∆€∆

Negative Pleasure publications is dedicated to presenting narrative works for independent and underground comics artists with an emphasis on traditional comics genres- crime, horror, science-fiction, funny animals, romance and more.  That said, we are always on the lookout for new voices and new talents and promote diversity and equality among artists from different backgrounds and levels of experience.  In Jeans 1 and 2 there are creators who have done work for companies like Marvel and Image next to first time cartoonists still in college, art comics up and comers next to people who have never made a comic before, professionalism and primitivism, side by side and hand in hand.  Preferably hand in hand.  Our goal is not to create the next big thing but to introduce you to the artist who's going to make the next big thing.  And, of course, we just want to make comics, lots and lots of good comics that are both thoughtful and fun to read.  Negative Pleasure Publications is a place to see things you just aren't going to see anywhere else.

story:
This, the project, the comic, are a culmination of a lifetime of creativity. This is my personal life boat to a brave new world I've thirsted for as long as I can remember. If funded, I'll be able to pay an artist and publishing costs for issue #1 in a planned four issue mini-series. The book is "Endless", a fun-filled, hilarious, high-octane, heart-breaking action/adventure/dramedy about the intertwined destinies of a smart ass 800 year old immortal in a 20 year old's body (William) and a nerdy, unsure 20-something wasting his potential, spending his days reading comic books and building space ships (Charlie). Charlie finds out his bloodline has secretly been protecting Wlliam for 800 years and with his estranged mother's death, he's the latest in the long line of protectors tasked with assisting William from being captured by any and every organization you can name, while getting his entire world twisted upside down. What happens when a chubby geek who's only seen guns in video games is suddenly thrust into a world of car chases, rapid fire bullets, and weird magic? Great things...great things.

With your help, not only will I be able to self-publish this important first issue, but I'll be able to get copies in the hands of some of the biggest independent comic publishers in the world with the hopes they'll like it enough to finance and distribute the series. You're funding a career, a dream, and a comic.

This comic WILL be action packed. You WILL laugh. You WILL NOT be bored.

I still need an artist for this project, so if you are a professional level artist looking to get published (or already are published and want to work on something cool!) Email me at c_cress08@yahoo.com and we can talk!

story:
Summary

I want to tell a story about the challenges of getting things done in developing country governments.  Using my experiences as a development economist, I have written a story that highlights the major bottlenecks to delivering basic services in low-income settings.  In collaboration with Nigeria's foremost comic artist, Albert Ohams, I aim to turn this narrative into a graphic novel that will be distributed cost-free to schools, universities, and development organisations.


Our Story

Have you ever wondered why developing countries can't provide basic services to their people?  Why is it so difficult to implement government projects in the developing world?  Is it just down to a lack of money, to bad politics, or to corruption?  Or is the answer more complex?


In 'Water Get Enemy: The Story of Delivering Public Services in the Developing World', I've drawn out a few answers to those questions. The story, set in the fictional country Banglageria, sketches the passage of a public project through a developing country government.  You can read the story, or listen to me read it, at www.danrogger.com/teaching.html#borehole.


Now I have teamed up with Nigeria's foremost cartoonist, Albert Ohams, to turn this story into a graphic novel.  We want to make a book that will open a window into the governments of the developing world, and provide insights into the problems there.


The Impact

The piece brings together my experiences working in and with governments in the developing world, and messages from my discussions with civil servants, politicians, and technical assistants there.  Albert's graphics will take the reader into the heart of government, and help them see and experience the problems as they occur.


The graphic novel will be a learning tool.  I will use it in my own lectures on development (I teach at a university), and create a revolving exhibition for schools, universities, and businesses in the UK.  In collaboration with University College London, we will hold a conference on Nigerian governance with the exhibition as the centrepiece and workshops on each of the subjects with academics and Nigerian diaspora.  We will make the novel a useful resource for development partners' training initiatives.


What We Need & What You Get

We need money to pay for Albert's time.  The graphic novel will take a month or so of work.  That's where 90% of the funds we raise are going.  The rest will pay for turning it into a useful online resource, and for printing a set of exhibition prints that will travel around the UK.


Any funds additional to this will be invested in methods of publicising the graphic novel once it's published.  For example, one idea is for the novel to have its own web site, with biographies of the major characters and further resources on the subjects addressed in the story.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for your donations.  There are other ways you can help.  If you read the story and have comments to improve it, please let me have them.  If you can help me with ideas to promote the graphic novel once it's published, these would be warmly welcome.  Of course, once it is published, the more people who help publicise it, the more useful it will be.

story:
Our Story

My name is Martin John, creator, writer and letterer of Foreign Matter. Two years ago I decided to chase my dreams and start writing for real. A script that I wrote for an idea that my brother and I came up with thirteen years ago has shaped up in a way that I had never thought it would. I thought I would pitch it, aiming for an indie publisher, and decided to hire an artist in order to make that pitch a reality. I would have five pages of artwork based on my script. I went to digital webbing and out of all the applicants there was one wonderful artist named German Ponce that replied in a prompt and efficient manner. German did all the character designs for Foreign Matter in no time whatsoever, we had started our comic adventures together. 


Through research into the industry and having my brain rattled by talking to professionals on message boards I was told that no one would want to buy my superhero comic book, as Marvel and DC comics were doing the genre and doing it better than I ever would. I was also told that my comic would never see print, would never get on a comic stand, and it would be better to find a way to present in online. Cue, http://www.foreignmattercomic.com, and me hiring German on a regular basis in order to finish the twelve issues of our comic.


We have found a publisher in What The Flux Comics. We have produced four full issues of comic and are into the beginning of the fifth. You can help fund our dream and make great comics with us. Or you can spread the word about our cause to others in order to help. We are the little indie that could, Foreign Matter.


The Impact

Funding will allow me (Martin John) to climb out of the debt I have accrued and pay my art team an appropriate amount of money for their services for the first six issues. As the creator and writer of this project I take the financial responsibility for it.


What We Need & What You Get

In the end I will have spent over $25000 on this project, and that goes directly to German (an artist in Argentina) and Dave (an artist in the United States). This pays for their page rate. I am asking for one fifth of this in order to feel more comfortable in that fact that I will not go bankrupt while making the first half of this comic. Any money you pay towards Foreign Matter's Indie Go-Go goes to supporting artists. The money I have paid German so far has gone towards dental work, medical work, and rent as he attempts to get notice. Your dollars will be well spent. 


Prizes include pdf copies, eternal gratitude, advance pdfs that no one has ever seen (you get the first look at issue three), copies of the comics, limited hardcover journals with autographs,  limited prints of amazing pinup art from three different artists and limited to twenty-five copies each, and one lucky person gets to be eviscerated in the pages of our comic (yay).


Other Ways You Can Help

If this project sounds like something you'd like to support, please spread the word about it. Our first two issues are online and have been online for free for quite some time at http://www.foreignmattercomic.com The more people that read and know what we are doing and the quality of work and time invested in this project, the better chance that people will feel compelled to help us achieve our goals in creating a comic and realizing our dreams. Thank you so much for the chance to create.

story:
To Everyone that may have missed our Wonderful Tokyo Wonderland Graphic Novel we are offering you a chance to get it here on IndieGogo - The book is halfway done already so all perk rewards are Guaranteed to ship!!

 

For starters ALL $20 pledgers will recieve The Tokyo Wonderland PDF and OST (Original Soundtrack)...All pledgers $35 or more now receive the Physical  Graphic Novel and sketch of any character of your choosing!!!...All pledgers $75 or more will receive their Graphic Novel in Hardcover form!!!...All pledgers $90 or more will recieve the Hardcover & a original page!!!

The Story:

Alice is having a very strange day. As a student residing in Tokyo, Japan, she's plagued by odd dreams of Wonderland. On this day she's bullied, teased, and embarrased by her classmates. But worse yet, it all happens in front of the boy every girl in school has a crush on. When her pet bunny's safety is at risk Alice is left with no choice but to follow the white rabbit to the surreal & topsy-turvy world of Wonderland. It's there that Alice must slay Dragons, best ninjas, confront Samurai, & kung fu with Deadly Demons. But in all this madness can Alice find the strength to accept her destiny & go vs the mad reign of The Red Ruler of Wonderland? Based upon the eternal works of Lewis Carrol's "Alice In Wonderland". Our Alice's Adventures in Tokyo Wonderland are ready to begin.

(Tweedle) Dum & Dee vs. Alice!!!

 


 

Help Cheshire Take Over Teh Wurld!!!

Or Stop Cheshire's Evil Plot!!!

The World's fate is up to YOU!!!!

The (Mad) Hatter

 

The White Rabbit

 

The Caterpillar

 

Alice and the Vorpal Blade

 

The Knight and his Vorpal Sword

 

Alice by http://quiss.deviantart.com/

The Jabberwocky

The Story:
Alice is having a very strange day. As a student residing in Tokyo, Japan, she's plagued by odd dreams of Wonderland. On this day she's bullied, teased, and embarrased by her classmates. But worse yet, it all happens in front of the boy every girl in school has a crush on. When her pet bunny's safety is at risk Alice is left with no choice but to follow the white rabbit to the surreal & topsy-turvy world of Wonderland. It's there that Alice must slay Dragons, best ninjas, confront Samurai, & kung fu with Deadly Demons. But in all this madness can Alice find the strength to accept her destiny & go vs the mad reign of The Red Ruler of Wonderland? Based upon the eternal works of Lewis Carrol's "Alice In Wonderland". Our Alice's Adventures in Tokyo Wonderland are ready to begin.
(Tweedle) Dum & Dee vs. Alice!!!

 

 


Help Cheshire Take Over Teh Wurld!!!

Or Stop Cheshire's Evil Plot!!!

The World's fate is up to YOU!!!!

The (Mad) Hatter

 
The White Rabbit

 
The Caterpillar

 
Alice and the Vorpal Blade

 
The Knight and his Vorpal Sword

 
Alice by http://quiss.deviantart.com/

The Jabberwocky

story:
Pop-Up Concertina

Do you like cheap art that you can spread out on your mantelpiece OR tuck away on a bookshelf? 

Do you like illustrations with tiny details and hidden stories, with new things to discover each time you look at them?

Do you like pop-ups? (What am I saying, EVERYBODY likes pop-ups!)

My name is Shelby Arnold, I have been a designer in Robert Sabuda's studio for about five years. If you know his work, it's needless to say that I know pop-ups pretty well. I've been working on this project for about six months on my own time, and I'm excited to see it get printed up for people to enjoy! 

I'm raising money to pay for 1,000 copies to get printed by a local printer here in Brooklyn where I live. Right now I'm hoping to go with Rolling Press - an eco-friendly printer in Park Slope. They have been really helpful and detail oriented in the process of putting a quote together for this strange project - qualities you want from a good printer! All the money I raise will go towards the printing - I'm doing the cutting and folding by hand (on an on-demand basis).

So, what is it?
The Pop-Up Concertina is an accordion-folded booklet with pop-ups, covered on both sides with drawings I made using a bunch of .005 micron pens over the course of several months. I then scanned the drawings and assembled them into a digital file that will be sent to the printer. There are tons of little scenes and pictures, but no words. You can look at it page by page like a book (which never ends, it just turns over and continues in a loop), or you can spread it out and look at it all as one (double-sided) piece. Every way you look at it reveals new connections and interactions - the cut-outs and folds allow the pages and illustrations to change and connect to each other in different configurations.

What size is it?
The flattened piece will be 38 inches long by about 6 inches tall. Folded, it is about 4 inches wide by 6 inches tall, with ten panels/pages on each side. There are seven pop-ups in the piece, they have art on both sides as well.

 

 

Some things you may be asking yourself when you look at this piece:

Why are you self-publishing it? 
This piece is more of an art book for the likes of indie comic book stores and art festivals. I'd rather be able to get it out on a table and sell it myself than be shopping around to publishers, trying to convince them why my oddly-formatted, some-assembly-required piece would be worth it for them to produce.

How are the pop-ups assembled?
I'm publishing this thing myself, so after I get it back from the printer, I'm doing all the cutting and folding by hand. I knew from the beginning that I wanted to keep the assembly as simple as possible, so the pop-ups are all designed to be quick cuts off the folds, rather than separate pieces that need to be cut out and glued together indivudually.

Simple construction doesn't mean the pop-ups are less interesting! In fact, because they are cut right out of the page, there are some really fun interactions from one page to another as cut-outs appear and disappear when you turn the pages.

Why is the deadline so soon?
I have some table space reserved at MOCCA Fest 2013 on April 6th and 7th. My goal is to have printed copies of the pop-up concertina on my table at MOCCA Fest, assembled and ready to sell! This means I need enough time before the festival to get everything printed up and a few copies assembled. HOWEVER, the sooner the deadline, the sooner you get your copies, too! Also, if you support this project and you live in the New York area, you can come by my table at MOCCA Fest to pick up your reward!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
About the comic

Hello everyone, my name is Mason Cook. I am a artist based in Brisbane, Australia. 

Dwarf and Gnome is a story set in a sword and sorcery fantasy environment of an unlikely duo who are thrust together on an epic adventure to save their world. A great evil has arisen to destroy the already tenuous ties of unity the Council has forged in a land rife with conflict and hate.

For the last few months I have been hard at work on this project, all the pages have been completed. Pencils, inks, colours and letters, the book is ready to go! All I need now is a little help from you all to get it printed.

All the money raised with your generosity will go towards the printing costs of the comic and a small advertising campaign to help garner interest.

If we aren't successful is reaching the target goal then all money raised will still go towards printing of the comic. It will just mean a smaller print run. Everyone who has contributed will still receive the rewards offered. 

Please have a look at masoncook.com for a further look at the Dwarf and Gnome comic as well as more of my artwork.


Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from your generous monetary contributions, your help in spreading the word about Dwarf and Gnome would be greatly appreciated. Please spread the word to your friends and loved ones, accost random people in the street, scream it from the rooftops. Or with a quick click, linking this page to twitter and facebook would be wonderful.


Thank you for your support and generosity


Mason Cook

story:
THE SERIES

This comic book series tells a story about real people doing impossible things in a fictional world. You can meet them in the flesh, and even join them in their adventures, if you are part of the LudoSport network (http://ludosport.net). Or you can just enjoy the journey and follow Jake and his friends discover the truth about the gym where they practice with Polaris: something more than just a simple sporting tool!

Questa serie a fumetti racconta la storia di persone reali che compiono azioni impossibili in un mondo immaginario. Puoi incontrarle per strada e persino unirti a loro e vivere le loro stesse avventure se entri nella rete di LudoSport (http://ludosport.net). Oppure puoi semplicemente goderti il viaggio e seguire Jack e i suoi amici scoprire la verità che si cela dietro la palestra in cui si allenano con le spade Polaris: qualcosa di più che un semplice strumento sportivo! 

 

A META-DIMENSIONAL COMIC

“A Story of Light: Polaris” is a meta-dimensional comic as it allows you to know (and recognise) the protagonists and places where Light Saber Combat is fought in the real world.

“A Story of Light: Polaris” è un fumetto metadimensionale in quanto permette di conoscere (e riconoscere) i protagonisti e i luoghi in cui si pratica il Light Saber Combat nel mondo reale. 

 

THE STORY

Jake is a young man who loves music, his friends, his Vespa and his favourite sport. In the gym he goes to in Milan, he will discover something that he would never have imagined: his Masters are not who he thought they were, and more importantly, the weapon he uses for Light Saber Combat can actually be activated, turning into a lethal weapon. Which of his course mates knows the secret of Polaris? But above all, what do the Masters and their most loyal followers have in mind? Together with his friends, Jake will go on a journey to discover the truth, meeting adversaries and allies, and will discover that it is not always easy to know the difference between them.

Jake è un giovane che scrive e disegna fumetti. Ama la musica, gli amici, la sua Vespa ed è alle prime armi con il suo sport preferito. Proprio nella palestra che frequenta a Milano, scoprirà qualcosa che non avrebbe mai immaginato: i suoi Maestri non sono chi credeva che fossero, e soprattutto l'arma che utilizza per praticare il Light Saber Combat può essere attivata tramutandosi in uno strumento letale. Chi tra i suoi compagni di corso conosce il segreto di Polaris? Ma soprattutto cosa hanno in mente i Maestri e i loro seguaci più fidati? Assieme ai suoi amici, Jake si ritroverò coinvolto in una pericolosa e sanguinaria avventura mozzafiato che lo porterà a scoprire che lui non è la persona che ha sempre creduto di essere. 

 

YOU CAN BE A PROTAGONIST TOO!

ANCHE TU PUOI DIVENTARE PROTAGONISTA!

 

Choose the "STAR" and "SUPERSTAR" perks and become one of the protagonists of the series!

Scegli i premi “STAR” E “SUPERSTAR” e diventa uno dei protagonisti della serie. 

 

THE SERIES

Title: A Story of Light

Comic Book: Polaris

Season: 1

#Episodes 1/2/3 of 6 

Format: comic book 

Pages: 22+4

Languages: Italian and American English

LA SERIE

Serie: A Story of Light

Comic Book: Polaris

Prima stagione

#Episodi 1/2/3 of 6 

Formato: comic book

Pagine: 22+4

Lingua: Italiano e Inglese

 

THE COMIC WITHIN THE COMIC

“A Story of Light: Polaris” contains a “special feature”: each issue hosts a single lightsaber combat technique developed by the LudoSport Masters and practised within the network. A special illustrated insert by the artist Anna Diaz will describe the technique in detail to satisfy the curiosity of even the most careful.

IL FUMETTO NEL FUMETTO 

“A Story of Light: Polaris” contiene una “special feature”: ogni numero ospita una singola tecnica di light saber combat sportivo sviluppata dai Maestri LudoSport e praticata all’interno del network. Uno speciale inserto illustrato dall’artista Anna Diaz descriverà nel dettaglio la tecnica per soddisfare la curiosità dei più attenti.

THE AUTHORS

Giovanni Gualdoni, Valeria Favoccia, Daniele Rudoni, Simone Spreafico and Gianluca Longo.

ORIGINAL PROJECT

Gianluca Longo, Simone Spreafico

The LudoSport Founder Masters developed the heart of a story years ago when the real and imaginary planes merge, where real people could move from one plane to the other via sports competition.

I Maestri Fondatori LudoSport svilupparono anni fa il nucleo di una storia in cui il piano reale e quello immaginario si intrecciassero, dove persone vere potessero passare da uno all’altro attraverso la competizione sportiva.

SHOWRUNNER, SCRIPT AND SCREENPLAY

Giovanni Gualdoni

One of the leading comic authors in Italy, Giovanni has worked for years at Sergio Bonelli Editore where he developed stories for Dylan Dog, Martin Mystère and many others. After several experiences as producer of comic series, he contributed to the creation of the “A Story of Light: Polaris” universe, together with Gianluca and Simone, who have also collaborated with him as consultants for combat scenes.

Tra i migliori autori di fumetto in Italia, Giovanni lavora da anni in Sergio Bonelli Editore dove ha sviluppato storie per Dylan Dog, Martin Mystère e tanti altri. Dopo numerose esperienze come produttore di serie a fumetti ha contribuito alla creazione dell’universo di “A Story of Light: Polaris” assieme a Gianluca e Simone, che hanno collaborato con lui anche come consulenti per le scene di combattimento.

ILLUSTRATIONS

Valeria Favoccia

With her great talent of dynamic portrayal and in creating combat scenes, Valeria was recruited by the “Assassin’s Creed” franchise to visually develop the comic book “Assassin’s Creed: Reflections”. She then joined this project and helped the authors to materialise the world that they had imagined and made it unique and fascinating.

Con il suo grande talento nella raffigurazione dinamica e nella realizzazione di scene di combattimento, Valeria è stata reclutata dal franchise “Assassin’s Creed” per sviluppare visivamente il fumetto “Assassin’s Creed: Reflections”. Si è quindi unita a questo progetto e ha aiutato molto gli autori a materializzare il mondo da loro immaginato e a renderlo unico e affascinante.

COLOURS

Alessandro Musumeci, Daniele Rudoni

With long-standing experience as a professional colourist, Daniele and his team have coloured for the big names: Marvel, DC comics, Image, Penguin, Devil’s Due, Sergio Bonelli, Soléil and several others. Their careful, vivid touch further embellishes each storyboard of “A Story of Light: Polaris”.

Con una grande esperienza come colorist professionista, Daniele e il suo team hanno colorato per le grandi: Marvel, DC comics, Image, Penguin, Devil’s Due, Sergio Bonelli, Soléil e tante altre. Il loro tocco accurato e vivido arricchisce ulteriormente ogni singola tavola di “A Story of Light: Polaris”.

Risks & Challenges

We believe that we can say there is really no risk for the supporters.

Crediamo di poter dire che non esiste davvero nessun rischio da parte dei sostenitori.

story:
THE STORY

The year is 1943, war rages across the globe.

Captain Steven Reynolds and the crew of the B-17 “Bombing Betty” are tasked with a secret mission to bomb Hitler at his hidden base. After busting his bunker and sending him into oblivion their victory is short lived when they are shot down by an experimental enemy fighter, and crash-land in the middle ages.

Losing one of their own to the evil Infinite Reich, our crew finds allies in unexpected places. Using a new found technology, they must do what they can to survive, and more importantly, find their way back home!

Medieval knights, a crazed monster, a mad scientist and alien Nazi tech come together to tell the story of Flying Fortress.

This is a comic eight years in the making. Originally launched in 2011, Flying Fortress spans eight issues created over six years. This was our first, real comic creation and you'll see the growth of writing and art through each chapter. Flying Fortress REMASTERED aims to combine all eight of those chapters in one book. 

 


Art by Tedd Lehman - Colors Prasad Patanik (Pressy)

The Impact

Flying Fortress REMASTERED is only possible with your support. Thankfully, the art is finished and after a few minor changes and updated lettering throughout the book, it will be ready to ship. We want this book in your hands ASAP.

The Team

Flying Fortress was created, written, and self-published between 2011-2017. Art and writing by Eric Weathers, & Andy Moore, with story help in the initial couple of issues by Andrew Walker.

Eric Weathers has helped bring to life many indie comics including Jawbreakers, Graveyard Shift, Red Rooster, Earthworm Jim, Downcast, Brutas the Badass, Doomkicker, Gunship Thunder Punch, The Good Knight, Ravage Kill All Men, Off Worlder, and many, many more!
story_txt: THE STORYThe year is 1943, war rages across the globe.Captain Steven Reynolds and the crew of the B-17 “Bombing Betty” are tasked with a secret mission to bomb Hitler at his hidden base. After busting his bunker and sending him into oblivion their victory is short lived when they are shot down by an experimental enemy fighter, and crash-land in the middle ages.Losing one of their own to the evil Infinite Reich, our crew finds allies in unexpected places. Using a new found technology, they must do what they can to survive, and more importantly, find their way back home!Medieval knights, a crazed monster, a mad scientist and alien Nazi tech come together to tell the story of Flying Fortress.This is a comic eight years in the making. Originally launched in 2011, Flying Fortress spans eight issues created over six years. This was our first, real comic creation and you'll see the growth of writing and art through each chapter. Flying Fortress REMASTERED aims to combine all eight of those chapters in one book.  Art by Tedd Lehman - Colors Prasad Patanik (Pressy)The ImpactFlying Fortress REMASTERED is only possible with your support. Thankfully, the art is finished and after a few minor changes and updated lettering throughout the book, it will be ready to ship. We want this book in your hands ASAP.The TeamFlying Fortress was created, written, and self-published between 2011-2017. Art and writing by Eric Weathers, & Andy Moore, with story help in the initial couple of issues by Andrew Walker.Eric Weathers has helped bring to life many indie comics including Jawbreakers, Graveyard Shift, Red Rooster, Earthworm Jim, Downcast, Brutas the Badass, Doomkicker, Gunship Thunder Punch, The Good Knight, Ravage Kill All Men, Off Worlder, and many, many more!

story:
Hi, my name is Dale O'Flaherty and I'm a student from Ireland. I've been making comics on and off for the past couple of years now but I think it's finally the time that I got serious about them. I really want to go to TCAF to hand out mini comics but Toronto is very far from me and plane tickets are expensive. If you help me get to TCAF, I will be able to give out minicomics for free! It'll also be my first convention overseas. This will give me the chance to finally meet people who I've been friends with on-line for *years*. It would mean the world to me to get to see them all. Please help me make it happen!
 
If you donate enough, I will draw something cute and fun for you. 
 
If you can't afford to give to the campaign that's ok! You can spread the word on tumblr, or twitter instead!
 
Even if you donate nothing but I make my goal, you can still get a free mini from me at TCAF! 
 
Check out my tumblr at http://daleof.tumblr.com !!!
 
This was my friend Geneva Hodgson's idea, you can blame her. Consider contributing to her campaign as well!! http://www.indiegogo.com/tcaf4laffs?a=550553
 
THANK YOU VERY MUCH! = 3 =
 
NOTE:
 
I chose $800 to cover the cost of airfare. If I go over, you'll be helping me to pay for things that I would've had to have paid for myself like printing and travel expenses. Thank you again!

story:
VOLUNTARYIST –No. 2

IT’S TIME FOR THE SECOND ISSUE!

FAST ACTION! SUPER POWER! AMAZING LIBERTY!

www.volcomic.com

STORY: “Voluntaryist” is the story about a superhero who finds himself pitted against the government as the government tries to enslave humanity once and for all.  He is a young man with extraordinary powers created through a chance encounter with cosmic radiation. His personal mission is to rescue his parents from government agents, but that objective is often frustrated with the likes of giant monsters, super-villains, and even the U.S. armed forces.

The purpose of this comic is to give a sense of what is going on in America and, in addition, to offer the reader inspiration that something can be done to stop the coming dystopian future. It also promotes Voluntaryist values in the narrative. (If you don’t know what that is, simply google the “Non-aggression principle.”)

The second issue will either be a continuation of the first issue or a special short depending on the funds raised.

CREATOR: The idea for the comic was created by Voluntaryist fanatic and costumer Jaime Sherman, whose passion for liberty is only matched by his passion for dressing in spandex super-suits. He began the long process of creating the series while trudging through his legal studies in school.

GOAL:  To get the second issue released in .pdf and print to share with you, and, eventually, the world. 

We will produce as much of the comic as we can get funded for. In the event of a shortfall, we may produce a mini-comic outside the chronological timeline.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $5000 to get this comic fully going, but we set our goal at $4000 to absorb more of the funds.

The expenses are largely for the cost of hiring an artist to produce the comic and the expenses associated with putting the comic into digital format. 

You can support us by making a contribution on the right-hand side by Credit Card/Debit Card or Paypal.

In addition, you can redeem perks for your support such as:

--->$2– A personal “thank-you” will be made by having your name read among others in a Youtube video. (Aliases are permitted but must be specifically stated and PG rated.)

--->$5 – A Voluntaryist sticker mailed to you. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address to receive this.

--->$10 – The comic in .pdf format. - Make sure you provide your correct e-mail to receive this.

--->$14 Sticker + Comic in .pdf format - A Voluntaryist sticker mailed to you + the Comin in .pdf format. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

---> $20 - DOUBLE FEATURE- Get, Beyond the Government-Haunted World: A Comic Guide to Voluntaryism, Free Markets, and the Non-Aggression Principle by Zander Mars + the comic in .pdf format. Make sure you provide your correct e-mail to receive this.

--->$25 – A Voluntaryist character page print on 8 1/2 x 11 paper signed by Jaime Sherman + comic in .pdf format- Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$35 – Signed PRINT COPY of the comic. - Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$60 – DOUBLE FEATURE– Receive Time Samplers Issue #1 Signed by Paranoid American + a signed print copy of Voluntaryist #2. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

 



 

--->$50 – SHINYBADGES Voluntaryist Pin by Davi Barker + PRINTED COPY of the comic. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

 

--->$70 – A Voluntaryist t-shirt . (See images for details) Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this, as well as your preferred shirt size and color (white, red, or black).

--->$250 – VOLUNTARYIST ACTION FIGURE by The Official Sinister Customs. Get your unique Voluntaryist action figure made by the talented Nathan Essex of Sinister Customs. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$300 – ½ page Ad Sponsor - Get an advertisement (PG rated) for half a comic page. (Limited to 2 Sponsors for each page and 2 pages).

--->$400 - Website Ad Right Bar, Top Position – Receive an ad on the Voluntaryist Website to last for 6 months. Approximately 200 pixels x 300 pixels 72 dpi - template to be sent to purchaser. (Must send your ad to be placed. PG rated.)

--->$500 BE DRAWN INTO A SUPERHERO. Have you ever wanted to be made into a superhero? Get turned into a comic character and be presented on a supporters’ page inside the comic! You will also receive the digital file of your character. (Due to time constraints, Jaime will have final say as to the character’s final design implementation, but will make best efforts to accommodate the design.) Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

IF we do not reach our goal by (but we will thanks to you!), we will produce as many pages of the comic as we can afford and still send those out to the people who supported to receive the comic in .pdf format/printed format if short by $1000 or less. If short by more than $1000, we may produce a mini-comic outside the chronological order.

Production

The second issue will be produced primarily after the campaign is over, so the comic will be sent to you a few months after the 50 days are up.

However, we will give you teasers, sketches, and tidbits on our Website, http://volcomic.com so you can learn more about the backstory in anticipation of the comic's release.

YOUR Impact

While the comic is a fun relief from reality, our hope is that the comic is something beyond its entertainment value. We would like the comic to get into the hands of people who are unfamiliar with Voluntaryism and the current state of affairs. We want to wake people up to Voluntaryism and truly-free living using the comic medium because it communicates without being pretentious.

PUBLIC RELEASE:

We will be releasing the comic for you to download for free (whatever we can find that will allow us to post it for free)…but those who paid to get the comic e-mailed or printed will receive it FIRST and will receive the comic about a month AHEAD of everyone else.

SO, with that in mind, don’t be shy about supporting at the $2 or $5 levels because EVERY dollar counts to making the comic come into existence. That we need you to be our hero for!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have pocket change to spare, you can still help us get the message out by sharing our campaign and sharing our videos on YouTube.

Use the indiegogo.com share tools to let others know and visit our pages here:

FACEBOOK:
http://www.facebook.com/sire.voluntary

YOUTUBE:
http://youtube.com/thevoluntaryists

WEBSITE:
http://volcomic.com

ALSO! Please make sure you give us your proper address for whatever perk you redeem. If you have any questions, please direct them to Sire V (Jaime) at mr.voluntary@gmail.com. 

READ THE FIRST ISSUE FOR FREE:  http://voluntaryists.wordpress.com/free-comic-download/

And that’s all there is to it. ( :

story:
***AND MORE! All funders $20 or over now get exclusive Hairy Steve bottle opener keyrings too! (more details in the 'updates' tab***

***JUST ADDED! All funders $20 or over now get stickers and badges too! (more details in the 'updates' tab***


THE COMIC

 

“They say he was created by darkness itself, a manifest of the shadows he now confines himself to. The Monstrum of our town. The Hunter. Where he walks, darkness follows. Where darkness lays, death comes upon.

 

That’s what I heard anyway. Or it might have been a movie.”

 

Hairy Steve is a dark brooding beast, a freakish hairy hero just trying to keep himself to himself. Hiding away in the dark. Bothering no one. An outsider trying to ignore the world, but constantly being dragged back into it.

 

Steve finds humans annoying, despite spending his days pulling them from the jaws of danger. See, humans don’t understand Steve, and he thinks they’re idiots, but one thing he hates more than humans is injustice. So if someone’s in danger or there is a crime afoot, Steve reluctantly emerges from his hiding to help.

 

Tonight, however, events are about to spiral rapidly out of control and drag him right down with them. As Steve accidentally crunches a zombie’s skull, the city begins to fill with the walking undead. And an elderly Nazi socialite, buxom nurse and seemingly random crime increase all have something to do with it. As we crash, smash and explode our way to the finale, Steve might just have to save everyone in this godforsaken town, or die trying.

 

'Hairy Steve vs. The Zombie Army' is a 24-page black and white comic book, written by Jamie Smart and illustrated by Steve Bright. It's both hilarious and brutal, featuring lashings of swearing, violence, and other glorious wrongdoings.

 


THE STORY OF HAIRY STEVE, AND HOW YOU CAN HELP

(by Jamie Smart)

 

Here's the rub. I worked alongside Steve Bright quite a few years ago on a popular UK children's comic and was always blown away by his artwork. I'd been writing a more grown-up comic book called Hairy Steve, but didn't feel like it was something I could draw myself. It needed real OOMPH in the art, and Steve's style would be perfect for it, so I took him the idea and was chuffed when he agreed to have a crack at it. As the first few pages of finished artwork came back I was convinced this could really be something, the partnership between us produced work I'm incredibly proud of. However, after only completing four pages, time and circumstance conspired to leave Hairy Steve behind and we both returned to doing paid work instead.


I often yearned to see Hairy Steve fully realised, and poked mister Bright about it a few times over the years. But although Steve enjoyed the idea of completing this comic as much as me, realistically he couldn't afford to take such a huge chunk of time out to devote to it. So this year, I suggested the idea of funding this project online. It seemed absolutely ideal, with your help this goes from being a whimsical side-project to a paying gig for Steve (who is as hard a working self-employed illustrator as anyone), meaning he can spend the time on it that it deserves. I get to see my idea made (hairy) flesh, and you get a cracking comic book out of it. Everyone wins!

 

Our goal was set at $2,000. A small chunk of this will pay for the limited-run printing of the Hairy Steve comic, and all that's left will go to the artist Steve Bright. I will take no profit from this, I want to see if this system works and if the incredible work Steve's putting into our comic will reap reward.


********************* UPDATE!***********************


We reached, and passed, our goal in just the first three days of our campaign! Thank you so much to everyone for your support and goodwill, needless to say we really appreciate it. Oh and as of tonight, Indiegogo had us on their frontpage as a featured campaign!


The campaign is still open for the rest of its run, to see just how far we can take this. We were bowled over by the response, so anyone who still wants a copy of the comic, or the original sketches or other perks, are very welcome to still help the fund. It all goes to keeping Hairy Steve going!


We said that when we reached a quarter of our goal, we'd start putting Hairy Steve online as a webcomic. Since we long since passed that, the webcomic is now live at http://www.hairysteve.com come and have a read (a new page every week)! We believe free comics to read on the internet are a wonderful thing, as such we're happy to showcase what we're working on, in the hope people will enjoy it, spread the word, and may be inspired to contribute.


 ****************************************************



WHAT YOU GET FOR HELPING US

 

a) You have brought Hairy Steve online as a webcomic quicker.

b) You receive a variety of benefits (listed on the right), including a copy of the exclusive printed comic (which will include extra material such as development art)

c) You ensure this model works. And if this model works, it means comic book artists struggling to find a balance between webcomics and paid comics find a middle-ground where it works for everyone. From our point of view, we'd love to further the adventures of Hairy Steve, and are hoping this campaign will allow us to consider it!

  

And if you can't contribute, please help us spread the word, everytime you tell someone or share it online it really helps our campaign! And check back for news of when the webcomic version goes live, along with previews and extra bonus incentives added as we go along!


You can contribute via paypal or by card (using paypal - you don't need an account!)

Note – all rewards for contributions will be sent out as soon as we can, once the total is reached and we know what is going where. Please allow time to produce sketches, get the comic printed, etc.

story:
Our Story

Grace is a graphic novella written by my brother Cedric and illustrated by moi, Madeline Richards. After many moons our our tall tale is on the verge of completion. In the style of Rumpelstiltskin and The Emperor's New Clothes our story cautions its reader on the perils of falling pray to the vanities in life.

I'm a Montreal based artist currently illustrating this fable ... it has become an all consuming passion. I would love to raise enough money to do a short print run and to pay for some final supplies and expenses. Grace is 47 pages, full colour and, I think, a very unique story.

This story has coarse language, it's not a children's story.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for 5 000$ as my goal.
I'm hoping to do a high quality print run, and as my book is full colour I believe this will be pretty costly. I have an estimate starting at 3 000$ for printing. I'm hoping to make enough for the initial distribution, supplies, and expenses while I finish.

For every donation I will return the favor with my thanks and artwork:

1$ or more - I will mail you a signed post card.
10$ or more - I will send you a package containing: A signed post card, as well as some blank ones for you to send out. + some stickers bookmarks and buttons.
20$ or more - A printed comic (signed) + a post card.
30$ or more - A printed comic (signed), post cards, stickers bookmarks and buttons.
75$ or more - A printed comic (signed) and an art print (archival + signed)
100$ or more - A printed comic (signed), art print (archival + signed) and a copy of the original script with commentary. + everything else. :)

If you donate 200$ or more I will send you one of each variant art prints (3 total) (archival + signed). A printed comic (signed), a copy of the script, postcards, stickers and buttons.

I will be making PDF versions at some point. I don't know when. It could be some time down the road. But anyone who donates anything will one day receive a PDF version of my comic. :)

Sneak Preview Event

I would like to invite anyone who is interested to a Sneak Preview Event!

The show runs from August 8th- August 26th
at Gallery Nota Bene*
3416 ave du Parc, Montréal, Québec. H2X 2H5

Join me and my brother at the Vernissage/ Opening Night,
August 11 from 6-8 PM

I will have some of the original artwork displayed and I will be selling art prints.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign!
story_txt:
Our Story
Grace is a graphic novella written by my brother Cedric and illustrated by moi, Madeline Richards. After many moons our our tall tale is on the verge of completion. In the style of Rumpelstiltskin and The Emperor's New Clothes our story cautions its reader on the perils of falling pray to the vanities in life. I'm a Montreal based artist currently illustrating this fable ... it has become an all consuming passion. I would love to raise enough money to do a short print run and to pay for some final supplies and expenses. Grace is 47 pages, full colour and, I think, a very unique story.This story has coarse language, it's not a children's story. 

What We Need & What You GetI'm asking for 5 000$ as my goal. I'm hoping to do a high quality print run, and as my book is full colour I believe this will be pretty costly. I have an estimate starting at 3 000$ for printing. I'm hoping to make enough for the initial distribution, supplies, and expenses while I finish.For every donation I will return the favor with my thanks and artwork:1$ or more - I will mail you a signed post card. 10$ or more - I will send you a package containing: A signed post card, as well as some blank ones for you to send out. + some stickers bookmarks and buttons. 20$ or more - A printed comic (signed) + a post card.30$ or more - A printed comic (signed), post cards, stickers bookmarks and buttons. 75$ or more - A printed comic (signed) and an art print (archival + signed)100$ or more - A printed comic (signed), art print (archival + signed) and a copy of the original script with commentary. + everything else. :)If you donate 200$ or more I will send you one of each variant art prints (3 total) (archival + signed). A printed comic (signed), a copy of the script, postcards, stickers and buttons. I will be making PDF versions at some point. I don't know when. It could be some time down the road. But anyone who donates anything will one day receive a PDF version of my comic. :)Sneak Preview Event

story:
Our Story

What The Flux Comics is looking for funding to push forward our Ongoing series of Red Angel featuring the likeness of Actress & Model Amy Vitale. Since the Mini Series Roll Out in March of 2011 Red Angel has Sold 500 copies across the US and we need your help to take it to the next level.
Company info can be found at http://whatthefluxcomics.com


The Impact

If we achieve our goal we will be able to push our product into Diamond Distribution (Previews Magazine) and truly reach a national audience. This goal will help us maintain our staff and produce the best product possible, without it our budget is restricted and rather than being able to produce a monthly series we will have to down scale to every other month or quarterly.

Issue #2 is complete in our mini series and Issue #3 has begun production. Issue #4 is scheduled for a December completion/release date.


What We Need & What You Get

What we need to keep the engines rolling along...our production cost per book is 750.00 and we are looking to move this forward for at least 10 books/issues. As we do pre-orders, sell through our web store and will be utilizing Diamonds Catalog we will not need to cover printing costs as that will be fulfilled prior to shipping any units.

As an example of what you get for your donation to the cause - Issue #2 (still available for pre-order and schedule for a Late August Release) is going to have a limited edition of collectors cards that will be sequentially numbered and limited as it stands right now to 80 sets. these are free to those whom have ordered Red Angel #2 via the web store.


Our plans for those whom donate via IndieGoGo and help us achieve our goal will be given a characters in the ongoing series to forever immortalize themselves in comic books. Here's what we have in mind; you will receive 2 copies signed and numbered from the series creators (Erin A Pyne, Larry Jarrell, Russ Leach and Amy Vitale), and original art created by Larry Jarrell or Russ Leach from the Red Angel series of Characters (valued at 30.00 per illustration).

* Donate 25.00 - receive 2 Copies of Issue #1 & #2 that will be Signed and Numbered

* Donate 50.00 - receive 2 Copies of Issue #1, #2, & #3 Signed and Numbered

* Donate 100.00 - receive 2 Copies of Issue #1, #2, #3 & #4 Signed and Numbered, Original Art from Larry Jarrell or Russ Leach

* Donate 150.00 - receive 2 Copies of Issue #1, #2, #3 & #4 Signed and Numbered, Original Art from Larry Jarrell or Russ Leach and have a character of your very own developed for the ongoing series that you helped fund.


Every dollar donated to the cause goes solely to the furthering of our comic series. Our progress will be charted on both our Facebook page and company Blog (this is our news feed on our website) as well as the Red Angel Comic Series on Facebook.


Other Ways You Can Help

if you are fans of Steam punk you should share this with anyone that enjoys the genre as well. We will be taking pre orders for Issue #2 until August 15th on our web site and we will be shring our project via Facebook.
