story:
And the campaign is now over! Thank you everyone for supporting the campaign, making the second book a reality. I'm going to be super busy with the amount of extra contents that will be in the book. This includes a special short story, a special comic, many guest arts and more! But, for now, let's celebrate! 

Thank you all!

Hello everyone! I'm gonna be busy from now on, managing the file of the book, because Wuffle the Big Nice Wolf Year 2 is going to be printed! We’ve reached the goal! Hooray!

Thank you so much everyone! There are still more than 50 days to contribute and get some rewards before the campaign ends, but for now, guys, LET'S START WUFFLIN'!

Our editor, Guts, has something to say to all the readers, too:

"Our campaign for printing Wuffle book 2 just reached the goal today! Thanks everyone for your contribution, be it monetarily or helping us spread the word. 

It's amazing to see that this project got funded within a few days. Did you know that it took us one whole month for last year's campaign to reach the goal? 

Hopefully Wuffle will be an example to show that you don't need copyright to make money from your work. If you do the best you can and care about those who like your work, your fans will care about you and support you in return.

We still have many weeks left and I'd love to see the campaign reach the stretch goal. Let's see how far we can go this time!

Anyway, just a friendly reminder that our comics are in the public domain and free for anyone to use. You can even print them and sell them if you want to!"

Stretch goals update!


It's been 2 years since I began drawing Wuffle comics, and now it's time to print the second volume! Let's make it happen!

This will be a Fixed Funding campaign like last time, meaning that if this campaign doesn't reach the goal, you will get a refund, and the book won't be printed. But I will still continue drawing Wuffle for you, and hopefully I can try again in the future.

You can read Wuffle Year 2 comics here: Official Website, Tumblr or Facebook
Or download and read at once: Download

Wuffle Year 1 is also available for free download as a PDF via Gumroad.
Why free? Read here: Wuffle is in the public domain.

The funding goal is higher this time because the book will be thicker than the first volume. The comic itself has many more pages than volume 1, with longer stories. This means that the printing costs will be higher too.

Book Features:

  • All of the comics from the second year (14th Febuary 2013 - 28th February 2014) will be included.
  • All comics will be proofread by a professional proofreader, and any errors from the webcomic version will be corrected.
  • Special illustrations will be made for the book by me and several guest artists.
These will be printed in a hard-cover A5-size full color 150-180 page book format.


See the bigger version of book cover: click

  • I will improve some comics that included mistakes when they were first released. This will include some new scenes, new drawings, and extended stories.
  • Shipping times will be faster; instead of 2 months after the finished print run, books will ship within 2 weeks after the books are printed! The print run should be finished around 2 months after the campaign ends.

You'll get a print of the book, you can have your name on the book as one of the sponsors, a signed copy of the book, and many more rewards! Here are the pictures for more details :

$6500 REACHED! : "There's Something About Foxxo" A special short story written by our proofreader and story adviser, Leonard Kirke, and approved by me. This short tale is about Foxxo's first big business deal, though it might not turn out the way he planned. I will do special illustrations for this short story.

============================

$7000 REACHED! - $8000 REACHED!  : A special comic for book 2. There is one story that I've wanted to draw for a while, but I hadn't found the right time and place for it until now. It's called ROBIN WUFF.

A parody comic of Disney's version of Robin Hood, but in Wuffle style!

I want this to be the first episode in an occasional mini-series chronicling the adventures of Robin Wuff. Since the characters are so perfectly matched, I don't want it to end with just one comic.

So let's make it happen! If we reach $7000 , then I'll draw the comic, but in black and white. If it reaches $8000, then the comic will be in color!

::::::::::::::::::::::

UPDATE : We've just reached the comic in GLORIOUS TECHNICOLOR! Thank you everyone! ;_;

============================

$15000 : I don't have a definite plan for further stretch goals yet. But I always wanted to do some short animation of Wuffle, based on one of the early 4 panel comics. So it'll be a very, very short animation with music but no dialogue (since we don't know who to cast and voice Wuffle XD).

The style will be classic 2D animation like back in the old days, from the Golden Age of Animation (just like the dancing Wuffle that you see on this page). I'm very passionate about 2D animation, so if we can reach this goal, I won't be able to say thank you enough! Making a short animation like this is one of my dreams, and I'll be very grateful if you help me make it come true!

Other short animations I've made years ago.

            

The animation might take some time to finish, so if we can reach this goal, I will ship all the books to you first and then I'll keep updating on the animation until it's done! ^^

============================

And that's all folks! We still have plenty of time before the campaign ends on May 15, 2014. Share the campaign, show it to your friends, and help make this project go further together!


Not everyone can support the campaign directly, but you can help me by spreading the news about the campaign, sharing the comic for free with your friends, your family, aliens from another dimension, everyone! You can also spread the love of Wuffle by creating your own Wuffle fan works, like art, fiction, music, whatever you want!

story:
The St Andrews Revue heads to the Fringe!

Following a successful year of laughs, St Andrews' only sketch comedy group (AKA us) will be heading down to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in the hopes of spreading their unique brand of whimsy outside the confines of the Kingdom of Fife. We will be performing at Paradise in The Vault, two streets over from the Royal Mile, on the 4th-10th of August from 15:00-15:50.

We've been to Fringe twice before (http://www.broadwaybaby.com/shows/the-st-andrew... and http://www.broadwaybaby.com/shows/the-st-andrews-revue/31738) and are hoping to have this third time charmer prove as our best work yet! The Fringe serves not only as a showcase of our writing and acting abilities but also provides us with very important networking opportunities with other comedians, sketch writers, and our audience outside of St Andrews. Unfortunately, since our student budgets are not exactly full of excess cash, funding is very difficult to come by - which is where all of you lovely people come in!

What We Need:

After having the honor of receiving a Rectors' Scholarship from the University of St Andrews' Rectors' Fund, we only need £500 in order to perform. 

The money made from indiegogo will primarily be used in order to cover our venue fee and public liability insurance as well as our publicity for the show (posters, flyers, media and press kits, stickers, etc.)

Who Are the St Andrews Revue Anyway?

The St Andrews Revue meets up every week when the University of St Andrews is in session to hash out sketches that are 100% original writing in the hopes of making their fellow students (and any other innocent bystanders that happen to get caught in the hurricane of fun) laugh till they cannot laugh any more.

We typically put on two shows a year (one in first semester and one in second), while occasionally releasing silly videos as well as hosting a variety of events around town. We are all extremely passionate about comedy and many of us hope to continue to write and perform after university!

If you're unable to donate we would love to see you at the Fringe! In case you forgot (or were too lazy to scroll back up), we will be performing at Paradise in The Vault, two streets over from the Royal Mile, on the 4th-10th of August from 15:00-15:50.

Feel free to get in touch with us at our e-mail address: thestandrewsrevue@gmail.com

Or check out our fancy website at:

https://standrewsrevue.squarespace.com/

story:
ALL BOOKS WILL BE SIGNED. This is a 132-page GRAPHIC NOVEL!

****INSTRUCTIONS FOR FREE COPY DOWN BELOW****

 

 

 

 

STRETCH GOALS!!

$10,000 STRETCH GOAL: Digital Wall Paper of the Velvet Viper for Desktop, Phones & Tablets.

$15,000 STRETCH GOAL: "ALL" Backers Will Have Their Name Inserted in a Credit Section of the Book, and backers from the $10 to Highest Tier Will Receive a Jack Hollow Super Villain Bookmark and the Antihero Cinder Trading Card!

$20,000 STRETCH GOAL: 17 CHARACTER SPLASH Pages With Bio’s Will Be ADDED to the book!! EXCLUSIVE GIVEAWAY!!!

*PHYSICAL COPY PURCHASERS* of DETECTIVE DEAD WILL BE ENTERED IN A GIVEAWAY FOR ORIGINAL PENCILED PAGE ART FROM THE BOOK!!

DRAWING ON CHRISTMAS DAY!! AT 2PM EST. (Limited Amount of Pages)

$25,000 STRETCH GOAL:  Digital Ashcan for all Perks, Jack Hollow Trading Card!

$30,000 STRETCH GOAL: ALL BACKERS will receive a DETECTIVE DEAD vs BIG FOOT BILL 15-page DIGITAL SHORT STORY!!!

 

Creative Team:

Penciler: Rod Luper 

Inker: Carlos Eduardo 

Colorist: Kamui Ayami

 

Other Ways You Can Help: (FREE COPY)

If you cannot support Detective Dead financially, it's alright! This is what you can do to earn a FREE COPY! Share this Indiegogo with your friends and family. Once 3 copies are sold to your friends or family, you earn yourself a signed free copy of Detective Dead (can only be claimed once). All you have to do is ask your friends or family to provide you with the proof of their purchase and send it to the email below. I will compare the purchaser names with the backers at the end of the campaign and once confirmed, I will write your name on a word doc assuring that you will get your copy. 

 

Free Copy Email: ScornComiX@gmail.com

You can also follow me on Twitter at: https://twitter.com/@ScornComiX

Thank you for your support, you have my sincerest gratitude.

story:
Synopsis of Art of Unlearning

Gituma, son of the dictator King Ego, discovers his father's role in a notorious genocide. He is unable to outrun his traumatic past and realize his creative potential until he is challenged by three wise teachers who hold the keys to unchain his mind from the past.     

[Signup to read the Introduction for FREE]

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Art of Unlearning was illustrated for over 18 months by Chief Nyamweya on a remote farm in the Rift Valley. Not a single digital device was used in its creation. Only pens, brushes and ink were applied in creating this emotionally compelling graphic novel.

Yet completing the manuscript was only the beginning. We need your help in order to be able to print and distribute this already finished work to you.

  • The book has already been completed! Therefore, your entire contribution shall go directly toward the scanning, printing and distribution of Art of Unlearning.
  • Art of Unlearning is a guide to creativity. A masterfully illustrated manual for any innovator who wishes to go beyond the resistance of their culture, and the limitations of their mind and body, in order to realize their innate potential. Through its young protagonist Gituma, the graphic novel explores how to overcome fear. He discovers creativity is the key to freedom and freedom is the key to creativity. 
  • Art of Unlearning is a 9”x 12” 130 page, ink illustrated book in both soft cover and Limited Edition hard cover. 
  • Art of Unlearning was written and illustrated by Kenyan graphic novelist Chief Nyamweya. 
  • We hope to print an initial run of 250 copies (or more if we achieve our stretch goals), and have it shipped out to backers in December 2018 ahead of the Holiday Season. 
  •  

This is what printed copies of Art of Unlearning will look like:

We are extremely serious about quality. This has already been demonstrated in the quality of the manuscript itself, and we would like to maintain this standard in quality delivery, which means that the final print we want to make for you is not going to be cheap to produce.

FORTUNATELY! Unlike most projects submitted for crowdfunding that are yet to build their final product, we have already made the painstaking investment needed to have a complete market-ready product. We just need your help to cover the last mile. Let's make it happen!

 

Cost Breakdown

Printing & Shipping: $8,000 -This covers the printing and worldwide shipping of the books. As we are based in Kenya, we’ll be using an Indiegogo approved perk-fulfillment agency to make sure backers get their swag on time, and in mint-condition! 

Scanning and Editing: $500 

Fees and contingencies: $1,500 (16%) This will cover Indiegogo and Amazon fees, international credit-card fees and contingencies for perk fulfillment.

TOTAL: $10,000

 

 

Timelienes

  • November 2018: Scanning and Editing
  • November - December 2018: Printing. 
  • December - January 2018: Packing and Shipping.

 

Your Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • My primary goal with this book is to transform lives and provide young readers with a map of the changing world around them so that they might know themselves and navigate a future of exponential technology and fluid social configurations. We have been aware of the need to shift culture, but there's been no map of how to do this... UNTIL NOW!
  • Art of Unlearning is my tenth graphic novel overall, and the second to publish in print. I understand my medium thoroughly, and most importantly I love and respect my audience since without them, this creative journey would be incomplete.
  • A percentage of all books produced shall be donated for free to deserving creative communities in Nairobi where Chief began his career as a graphic novelist.

 

About the Author

The idea for Art of Unlearning hatched when Chief graduated from Singularity University's Global Solutions program. It explores the polarity between the abundance mindset of technological utopianists and the cynical zero-sum realpolitik of current geopolitics.

Art of Unlearning is Chief's blueprint for a Creative School which would focus on facilitating students’ discovery of innate passion rather than standardized testing. Chief's work has been related to "Afrofuturism", or a movement of young Africans determined to create alternative narratives by leveraging technology and overhauling education.

He was born on October 6th, 1985 and spent much of his early life in Eldoret, Kenya and later in the Kenyan capital Nairobi where he graduated from the University of Nairobi’s Faculty of Law in 2008 and simultaneously became an affiliate of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA). Following the 2008 election violence in Kenya, political gridlock and the resulting economic stagnation, Chief left the legal profession to pursue a new career as a digital storyteller.

In a 2012 speech at the TED talent search, Chief made a compelling case for the deployment of storytelling and comics in particular in education, having already used animation and comics widely as a creative educational tool. This includes workshops at events such as the Storymoja Hay Festival, the Festival of Arts in Antananarivo, Madagascar and the World Entrepreneurship forum in Lyon, France.

In 2015, Chief was named curator of the Goethe Institute Exhibition Ink & Pixels: The Wild and Wondrous Tale of Kenyan Comics, which showcased Kenya’s most well known editorial cartoonists, comic book writers and artists. The Ink and Pixels exhibition has since been published as a book by Contact Zones and travelled in various German cities.

 

Risks & Challenges

Getting the graphic novel to you is our number one priority!

We understand that you, the backers, are putting a lot of faith in to us and this project, and therefore we will be extremely transparent with everything that goes into the delivery of this book by posting frequent and timely updates, and being quick to notify backers of any setbacks such as delays.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make some noise!!! Use the Indiegogo share tools to reach out to your friends about Art of Unlearning.
story_txt:
Synopsis of Art of Unlearning

Gituma, son of the dictator King Ego, discovers his father's role in a notorious genocide. He is unable to outrun his traumatic past and realize his creative potential until he is challenged by three wise teachers who hold the keys to unchain his mind from the past.     
[Signup to read the Introduction for FREE]
 







 
What We Need & What You Get

Art of Unlearning was illustrated for over 18 months by Chief Nyamweya on a remote farm in the Rift Valley. Not a single digital device was used in its creation. Only pens, brushes and ink were applied in creating this emotionally compelling graphic novel.
Yet completing the manuscript was only the beginning. We need your help in order to be able to print and distribute this already finished work to you.


The book has already been completed! Therefore, your entire contribution shall go directly toward the scanning, printing and distribution of Art of Unlearning.

Art of Unlearning is a guide to creativity. A masterfully illustrated manual for any innovator who wishes to go beyond the resistance of their culture, and the limitations of their mind and body, in order to realize their innate potential. Art of Unlearning was written and illustrated by Kenyan graphic novelist Chief Nyamweya.

story:
BENEATH THE SEAS COMIC

It was around April 2016 that I came up with a underwater creature feature idea for a B-Movie I wanted to write. Something really fun and gory. I pitched the idea to Ben (the artist) and he liked the idea and began sketching possible creature designs. 

Instantly Ben created something original, fresh, and frickin kool. I told him let's do a one-shot comic first and see where it takes us. He agreed and jumped onboard. 

So here we are now, a year later. I wrote the script, Ben did the art, and the next step is getting it colored by our Mr. Marvel, Dono. 

This comic was a lot of fun to work on with Ben. Seeing his imagination take this from the written word and to illustrations was pretty damn sweet. 

Anything you guys and gals can invest would be greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance!

 

THE TEAM

Rolando Joseph Herrera - The Writer

Rolo has been writing for 20 years. Short films, commercials, TV scripts, film scripts, and short stories. He loves to write and tell a fun story. This is Rolo’s second comic book script. He’s having a blast teaming up with his good buddy Ben and can’t wait to get Beneath The Seas to you.

 

Benjamin Langham - The Artist

Local San Diego Artist Ben has been writing since he was a little kid. Inspired by comics and monsters growing up, Ben had no problem bringing Rolo’s script to life. When Ben isn’t drawing he’s hanging with his two cats.

 

Dono Sanchez-Almara - The Colorist

Currently working on Marvel’s Venom run, Dono’s awesome coloring skills are pretty epic. Dono is a huge fan of horror stories, so he’s excited to be onboard to put the soul into Ben’s illustrations.

 

BREAK DOWN of the FUNDS NEEDED

The Colorist Fee   $2,150

Print Costs for Contributors   $500

Publication Fees (Online Publishing Set Up Fees)   $100

IndieGoGo Fees $250

Total Estimate   $3,000

 

THANK YOU!

We really appreciate you even just for checking out our campaign. It means a lot to us! It really does! Like we said in the video, if you are not able to contribute any money right now, that’s okay.

If you know anyone that would love to be part of this project, please spread the word. Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools.

 

THE CONCEPT

CONCEPT ART

Thumbprint Sketching of a Page

 

Inked Test Page 

 

Inked Cover Page

 

Colored Cover Page

story:
Synopsis: SKULL KIDS

Born of parents connected through a forbidden love. Twin siblings Ellien and Andre are raised by the Archangel Malakh after the demise of their parents. Trained as mere children to be members of the Death Whisperers, a team of merciless warriors for the side of heaven, by order of Gabrielle highest ranked of the Archangels. As centuries pass, the war for the Holy Kingdom and the souls of humans grows more intense. The siblings become more skilled, and dangerous in the eyes of Gabrielle who, in the apparent absence of the Most High, has taken rank and has decided the loyalty of the children is questionable.  After sabotaging the children in a battle against the demon guard of the Dark Prince, Gabrielle offers the children a chance to save and protect each others souls. He reasons, that by committing to the side of heaven, he can guarantee that upon completion of his given task in his given time, they will be freed to live eternity in the Vast, a hidden sanctuary thought to have been created by the Most High for the souls of the most honorable to rest in.  To receive this “pardon”, the children must fight upon request and eliminate high ranking generals and lords under the Prince of Darkness. If they complete the list, it weakens the ranks of Hell giving the Heavens the upper hand in this war, and allows them peace after centuries of fighting.  However, failing to complete the list in the time given, means damnation, and failure to do the only thing that has ever mattered to them both, protecting each other…. 

Skull Kids. 75 pages, Color, and all out coolness!!

Why This Story wOlly?

I'm happy you asked. Being independent means I get to offer stories that don't fit the norm. I love the spandex heroes and villains greatly. Because of them, I got deeply into comics like most, but as a creator, that lane is pretty full. That doesn't mean I will never create or work on anything in that lane, as a freelance illustrator I work on those type stories and pieces all the time, it just means that I can explore other stories. Create things based in other worlds, timelines, realities, subjects, and creatures. This in itself is a challenge, but still a chance to explore comics and graphic novel stories in a different. The Skull Kids are our main characters, but they aren't your typical heroes. They dwell in a world of angels and demons, gods and devils. But at the core, it is a story of family, bonds, fighting the right path, and fighting for what you believe in and love. This story just does it in a very wild way at times!! Having a boy and girl myself, my thought became, what is that bond that siblings share? How deep is it? What, if anything, can stand in between it? Making them twins in a world of spiritual beings just ups the ante, and having them be kids just makes it cooler when you see them in action against creatures who walked the earth before man existed. This story has been in my head for over 10 years, below is the first piece I ever did on them.....

How you can help, where that help goes, and what you get!!

So, this isn't my first rodeo in the world of self publishing. To date, I have completely self published about 9 projects. Meaning projects that I gathered all the funding for without a fund raiser. These were years back when I was learning about the world of comics and figuring it all out (still am in some ways, due to the constant change of the world and how things are consumed). After those projects, I produced and published about 4 art books, 4 issues of a personal project, and two trade paper backs (graphic novels). One project, Legend of the Black Pandas, was partially funded here on indiegogo, and another Fairy Tale Knights 122 pgs, reached it's goal here on indiegogo, and continues to sale well today. These past projects have taught me a ton about putting a book together, shipping and the issues that come with it, and just staying in touch with those that support. This book will be my third project seeking help with funding, but of course you get something in return!! I have perks like the book itself in various forms, an option for all 3 of my graphic novels in print or digital format, original artwork, bookmarks, prints, your image in the book as a than you, vinyl figures, and more!!  I also want to make sure that I stress to everyone, money is a GREAT!! form of support, BUT!!  Word of mouth is also. Every time you share this page, a piece of art for the campaign,  tell someone about it, like it, anything! That brings new eyes to the project, which helps it grow. Review sites, news and media outlets, social media, comic shops, friends, family, enemies!! All are needed to make this happen, and I am thankful and grateful!!

 

The Impact

The big thing here for me is just continuing to prove it can be done. Showing that different art styles, stories, and subjects are needed, wanted, and supported. This matters, not just for me, but to others who see these moments and are inspired to do their own stories, or encourage kids to create, or support things beyond the normal. I am not expecting to open new doors over night, but I believe supporting cool projects like these help the bigger companies to see there is support out there. In some cases it makes the more open to seeing what else is there, and possible stand behind it. The other side is, indie creators can stand with the people even if the companies don't support. The reality is, you the people, are what makes all of this work. No support from you, and even the mighty big 3 have to change things up. You have the power (he-man voice).

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is getting the word out. I stepped past the hurdle of self doubts, fears, concerns, by making this a reality in this form at all. That doesn't mean I am not still biting my nails as this launches, lol, but I have stepped past one of the biggest challenges. Our own doubts.  So now, I have to work hard to get this in front of others who may dig the art, the story, me as a person, or all the above. The risk is, I may not reach everyone. I want to spread this and my past projects to all possible, so your help with that counts on a major scale!! But even if I don't hit the goal, I will still push to make this book a reality. The funds raised, will simply help to get the project regardless. My goal isn't set at a place that pays me a wage to do the book, it is set to cover cost to print books, book marks, prints, cover shipping, and whatever else goes into the perks. Plus of course the fees for indiegogo, and paypal, and whoever else has hands in the pot. One day I hope to be in a place where my creator owned projects can raise that type of funding, but in the meantime, I just want to keep putting out solid books!! So please, help me to surpass the risk and challenges and make this happen!!

THANK YOU.

 

If you read all this, I thank you, if you didn't, I thank you. Whatever the case, thank you!!

Perks.

(some anyway)

Digital Books for phones, tablets, and computers

Physical Books, Tee Shirts, Bookmarks, Posters!!

 

 

 

 


 

Promo art (completed and uncompleted)

story:
… in life … sometimes things are not always black and white, in those shades of grey, the hard choices are made …

Decisions: A Minor Variation is a full color one-shot comic book featuring THREE stories written by Martin T Pierro. This is the fourth Decisions one-shot from Cosmic Times and marks the first time that Martin has written a comic in nearly a decade.

The first story is “I Hear the Train a Comin” featuring art by Fredson Oliveira. It finds John, a man literally at a crossroads, he has lost all hope, he is giving up on his dreams and his very life. With time running out an etherial guide visits John to try to turn him down a different path … is there enough time or will darkness rule the day?

The second story “My Brother's Keeper” features artwork from Michael Dorman. The story begins at a funeral, we find Quinton grieving the loss of his younger brother. In anger Quinton and others blame another boy - Dante for leading his brother down a path that brought him to the grave. Two etherial guides arrive and take Quinton on a journey through is past that will change his perception and will force him to face a hard truth.

The third and final story "Policy of Truth" is very socially relevant and dark in tone. It follows a young police officer faced with a dark future or a painful truth. This story features the artistic talents of original Decisions artist Zach Bassett. 

The Covers 

You have four different cover to chose from, including Cover D the "Chase Variant" - limited to 100 units and not offered in the original Kickstarter. 

Cover A by Oscar Pinto

Cover B by Fredson Oliveira / Colors by Daniele Caramanico

Cover C by Michael Dorman / Colors by Anthony D Lee - Limited to 500

Cover D by Zach Bassett - "Chase Variant" - Limited 100

Why Support Decisions?

From the beginning Decisions has been a series of one-shots that tackles hard issues and deals with them directly, no metaphors, no hidden meanings - just hard realities. This new offering continues to do the same, it’s not flashy, there is no gimmick just quality storytelling with artwork to match. The three stories contained in A Minor Variation are written by Martin Pierro, his first time solo writing in nearly a decade. These are challenging tales that deal with very hard, very personal issues. While Decisions is story focused, we still are attempting to cater to collectors by offering variant covers by the artists that created the interior pages.

With time running out an etherial guide visits John to try to turn him down a different path … is there enough time or will darkness rule the day?
The second story “My Brother's Keeper” features artwork from Michael Dorman. The story begins at a funeral, we find Quinton grieving the loss of his younger brother. In anger Quinton and others blame another boy - Dante for leading his brother down a path that brought him to the grave. Two etherial guides arrive and take Quinton on a journey through is past that will change his perception and will force him to face a hard truth.
The third and final story "Policy of Truth" is very socially relevant and dark in tone. It follows a young police officer faced with a dark future or a painful truth. This story features the artistic talents of original Decisions artist Zach Bassett. 
The Covers 
You have four different cover to chose from, including Cover D the "Chase Variant" - limited to 100 units and not offered in the original Kickstarter. 

Cover A by Oscar Pinto

Cover B by Fredson Oliveira / Colors by Daniele Caramanico

Cover C by Michael Dorman / Colors by Anthony D Lee - Limited to 500

Cover D by Zach Bassett - "Chase Variant" - Limited 100
Why Support Decisions?
From the beginning Decisions has been a series of one-shots that tackles hard issues and deals with them directly, no metaphors, no hidden meanings - just hard realities. This new offering continues to do the same, it’s not flashy, there is no gimmick just quality storytelling with artwork to match. The three stories contained in A Minor Variation are written by Martin Pierro, his first time solo writing in nearly a decade. These are challenging tales that deal with very hard, very personal issues. While Decisions is story focused, we still are attempting to cater to collectors by offering variant covers by the artists that created the interior pages.

story:
CELEBRATE MAY 4TH WITH DYNAMIC FORCES!

Dynamic Forces (the collectible division of Dynamite Comics) and the rest of the industry's comic publishers have had their new comics halted when distribution went on hiatus a few weeks ago. Some comic shops are still open and selling some items, but most shops are not, and that means it's harder for any fan to get their weekly "comic fix".

This is the destination for fans who are looking for a great "quarantine deal" on rare editions of STAR WARS comics that are hard to find, even in comic shops! With all titles already available in-stock, fulfillment will be quick!

THE MANY STAR WARS TITLES AVAILABLE RIGHT NOW IN VERY LIMITED QUANTITIES...

EVERY book offered includes a signed certificate of authenticity from Dynamic Forces!

Quantities shown on this campaign are all that's left of these rare titles so get them while you can!

WHAT'S GOING ON IN COMICS DURING THE PANDEMIC?

The COVID-19 pandemic has affected the entire world in a variety of ways and the comics industry is a market that's suffering greatly right now. With comic shops forced to close their doors for safety, and their main source of distribution on hiatus, publishers and creators are feeling the strain. The passion of comic readers has always been a driving force for the comics business, but direct, online support from fans is now essential to the current state of the business. If the comic industry is going to survive this pandemic, the fans will be the ones keeping creators and publishers in business!

"This is an unprecedented era in the comics industry and community," said Nick Barrucci, Dynamite CEO and Publisher. "Companies recognize how important it is to maintain the treasured relationships that collectors and fans have with the comics industry, and so we’re doing all we can to keep comic products available and accessible. This Indiegogo option allows us to support fans with great deals and vice versa, keeping everyone excited to read more and ready to return to their Local Comic Shop once this pandemic is over. Comics will come out on the other side of this stronger than before." - Nick Barrucci CEO of Dynamic Forces & Dynamite Entertainment

RISK & CHALLENGES

This campaign was designed to provide fans with quick fulfillment on books that are already available and ready to ship as soon as orders are processed at Indiegogo. With no printers involved, delays in fulfillment should be unlikely unless they were due to potential issues with mail services at the time.

story:
WHAT IS THE FINAL PRODUCT?

Brimstone is a cinematic novel that tells a contemporary coming-of-age tale set in a treacherous realm that exists beneath our world. It’s the story of a gifted girl thrust into a wilderness of wonder and terror, where she’s forced to face her deepest fears and grapple with the dangers that lurk within and around her. We've teamed up with Hollywood screenwriter Will Simmons to create an epic dark fantasy universe.

Brimstone - The Demon Within is the first of a planned trilogy following Mary and her journey through Brimstone. Each volume will have it’s own closed storyline.

The book will be 150 pages, with each spread containing a part of the story and full page colour illustration. We’ll make sure you get a high quality print to showcase all the cool artwork. 

ABOUT WILL SIMMONS

Brimstone is a collaboration between established Hollywood screenwriter Will Simmons and MOOD. When Will approached us with a story about a young girl finding her way into a magical world, there was no question for us. We love our joint vision and we hope you will too! 

Will has written for major movie studios: Warner Brothers and Universal, and his crime thriller script, Murder City featured on the 2012 edition of Hollywood’s Black List (an annual poll of Hollywoods most popular screenplays).

He's extremely passionate about telling epic stories and creating unforgettable characters. And as we say in Scandinavia - he works like a horse!

CINEMATIC NOVELS - A MOOD VISION

At MOOD we simply love entertainment: Movies, books, graphic novels, comics.  Everyday we tell the cool stories of our clients, but we’ve also passionately dreamt about sharing our own.

As we made our first book, Fall of Gods, we found we were really on to something. A cool crossover between written novel and gorgeous concept art from movies. We got so excited about this, that we established MOOD Publishing to bring more Cinematic Novels to you.

We want to give you the feeling of a motion picture but in book form. When visualising our novels, we imagine being there, on set, like a cameraman.  We want you to feel the characters and pull you into an extraordinary world and give you a unique cinematic experience.

ABOUT MOOD 

MOOD is an entertainment Design Agency, located in Copenhagen, Denmark. 
Everyday at MOOD we design universes and help studios like Square Enix, LEGO, and Lionsgate evolve their brands. We are also passionate storytellers and we work hard to develop and share our original stories. We have a great team and we’re all very excited about Brimstone. The artwork is completed by all of us, so this project is very much a team effort.

Fall of Gods was our first Cinematic Novel and we had such an awesome experience, doing it as at Kickstarter campaign with all of you. You made it happen! We fell so in love with the mix of cinematic visuals and story that we couldn’t wait to show you guys something new.

Website

SHIPPING

To US, Canada and all other countries. We are shipping from US, which may imply national customs and taxes upon receiving outside US, which unfortunately is out of our control.

Help us spread the word: Thanks for watching, we hope you'll help us share Brimstone. 

Teaser video

Brimstone Facebook

FALL OF GODS UPDATE

Thanks again to all of our Fall of God backers - we couldn't have done it without your immense support. In case you missed it Stuart Beattie (Pirates of the Caribbean, Collateral, 30 Days of Night and many more) has been brought on to write the screenplay for 20th Century Fox, and Wes Ball (Maze runner, Scorch Trials) attached to direct. We are so excited!

Vali will be returning next year, when we launch Fall of Gods volume 2.

Keep an eye on the Fall of Gods page.

USEFUL LINKS

Brimstone Facebook page

MOOD Homepage

MOOD facebook page

Risks and challenges

Printing and shipping is quite a challenge. Luckily we've done this once before. We learned the hardships of shipping internationally and we have a new revised strategy for getting you the best possible result.

The story is written and all the creative work is completed. We have our printing and shipping partners lined up, so basically we're ready to print. 

We expect thing's to run smoothly however If there's some hiccups along the way, we will be in touch with all of you, making sure you know what's going on.

Note that we are shipping from US, which may imply national customs and taxes upon receiving, which unfortunately is out of our control.

Thank you again for your support!

story:
Short Summary

12 Children is an intimate look into the life of a family of thirteen before and after they were forced to leave Egypt in the 1960s. Nonna is a widow, alone in purgatory watching over a family who is divided without her. Through this separation, she learns not only have her children always needed her, but she has always needed them. They find their way back to each other in this illustrated novel.

My name is Dominique Agri and 12 Children is a fictionalized story of my mother's family. My mother moved to Brooklyn, NY in 1961 after the dictator Nassar exiled all non-Arabic peoples from Egypt. They arrived with no money, no other family and with no knowledge of the language or culture. The younger children were forced to assimilate while the older children clung to a past that no longer existed. My grandfather died of cancer shortly after their arrival and my grandmother was left alone.

This story is important because it holds the history and culture not of merely one family, but an entire people. The Sephardic Jewish community needs stories of their people so we never forget where we came from.?

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for donations so I may self-publish a 150-page graphic novel. I must pay my artist ($75 per page) as well as a colorist and a letterer. On top of that are printing costs (approximately $0.50 per page). After this, the costs remain pretty low. The book will feature in the Diamond Catalogue and as I have ties to several comic book stores in NYC, they will add the book to their retail list. Also, the book will be sold via my personal comic book website, www.ComicsPeriod.com.

The Impact

Personal stories of family, hardship and perseverance are what teach many of us how to cope with our own struggles. They inspire us toward growth and understanding of one another. These kinds of stories are realatively new to the graphic genre but they are rapidly becoming a staple within the comic book community.

The addition of images to words in a novel of this nature is not only thought provoking but emotionally provacative. 

Essex County by Jeff Lemire or Fun Home by Alison Bechdel are excellent examples of this.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this sounds interesting to you, please feel free to talk about it with your friends. Perhaps if you have the time you might choose to add a link to this campaign to your facebook or twitter accounts. Anything and everything is extremely appreciated!

story:
All about pitching Doomsday TV:

My name is Arlo Billings, the co-creator of this enterprise. If you're reading this, firstly, thank you for picking this project out of many to possibly contribute your hard-earned money. With that said, why should you fund our latest venture, Doomsday TV? Simple: it has something to say. 

Music, movies, television, and books often share a unique message reflective of the times in which they are created. Godzilla’s success was a product of the fear of nuclear bombs. Zombies represent an entwined human fear and serve as analogies for topics like racial sublimation, mass contagion, communism, and globalism. 

Comic books are no different. MAUS was an analogy of the fear of the Nazi regime. The X-Men paralleled racism and segregation. Even Captain America's first-issue cover featured the red, white, and blue hero landing a solid punch on Hitler's face. 

With Doomsday TV, we have a book where we capture the fears we deal with in our modern society. The story itself is simple: a catastrophic event that, while first ignored by those governments we are supposed to trust, comes to public light, resulting in mass containment, societal chaos, hoarding and rioting, and loved ones being separated. Sounds familiar?

With that said, this project has been in development for a long time. In fact, we started this book five years ago. However, the changes to our world within the last few months have made these stories hit much closer to home. While we face a pandemic across the world, there is also a pandemic happening within these pages. The attempt was made to contain it, but instead, this led to people fear-shopping, mass suicides, the world’s economy collapsing, and people looting and rebelling against the system. Just like the parallels in those other works, we have 250 pages of content here that parallel our world.

Initially, we will start with the first three issues of already completed work, some of which you can see throughout the campaign pages -- that's only a small sampling of what you'll find within these books!

Our goals with this campaign are to help get these books printed and out to the readers and hopefully be able to finance the next several issues as well. That is where you, the Indiegogo contributors, come in.

Once again, we thank you for your consideration and hope that you can make these last five years of development a reality for us.

The Books are 24 pages each in full color but that may change based on your contributions. we will add more pages with stretch goals.
 

We are adding prints to the campaign, pick 3 prints from this link: https://www.pinterest.com/OzzyLongoria/prints/, they have numbers below each image. there are many to chose from.

Also, we added a Doomsday TV T-shirt design, the same sizes as the other one(see below), but unfortunately, we only offer white color Tshirt.

 

 

 

CREATORS

MIKE BARON: Double Eisner Award-winning writer, the creator of BADGER and co-creator of NEXUS and Q-Ball, writer of DC’s THE FLASH and Marvel's THE PUNISHER.

TOM LEVEEN: Writer and author who has written books such as Party and Zero through Random House and Image Comics’ SPAWN.

ARLO BILLINGS:  Co-Owner of Gemini Comics, editor, writer, letterer, penciler and inker whos credits include: MONSTERS AND GODS,  PROJECT: NOAH'S ARK and NATHANIEL DEMON.

OZZY LONGORIA: Co-editor, writer, penciler and inker whos credits include: IF-X, SAILS OF BLOOD, ETA: A SAMURAI STORY and NATHANIEL DEMON, DISTORTIONS UNLIMITED.

CRISMAN STRUNK: Writer of tittles such as ELEMENTAL FORCES, DISTORTIONS UNLIMITED, SAILS OF BLOOD, IF-X, DARK HORROR.

JASON SNYDER: Writer and editor who has worked on IF ANTHOLOGY, THE  GATHERING, HORNTOAD SAM, and THE AFTER ARCADIA.

CHRIS LYONS who have lettered projects such as DOOMSDAY TV, MONSTERS AND GODS

EDGAR TAVITAS: Colorist of projects such as CODICES INFINITOS, CURSED LAND, DEVIL X 3 and MONSTERS, AND GODS.

JOVANNA PLATA ALMEIDA: Illustrator and concept artist, colorist of PROJECT NOAH"S ARK and MONSTERS, AND GODS.

OMAIK NEIV Artist

JD SANTIBAÑEZ Artist

MARK STANISLAWSKI writer

ANWAR KARIM Artist

KEVIN PHILLIPS Artist

BLANK COVER LIST

 

 

 

Most of the creators for this Doomsday TV books already have been paid for and all the profits are for the next Monsters and Gods volume 2 or other. 

The book will be printed in nostalgic newsprint paper, just like the old times, I always liked the feel and smell of those old-timey comics and I'm sure as comics get more and more expensive newsprint will make a comeback. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get these books printed and shipped, we would need at least $1,000. Any additional will also go toward future issues. The books will be printed in nostalgic newsprint paper. There is always something special about the feel and smell of those old-timey comics, and right now, a bit of nostalgia is probably needed by all during these difficult times. 

The Impact

The impact is simple: you will make our dreams come true to finally see these stories in print. It's been a long road, and anything you can do to help us reward these hard-working creators would be appreciated.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk with this type of campaign is funding a book that may never be completed or can take months/years to produce. In our case, the book has already been finished, meaning it has a lower risk. The biggest obstacle now is to get the book printed and shipped to you. Any funds raised will be used to print and ship the books to your door, as well as fund the production of the next book. The minimum needed to accomplish our goal is $1,000.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the book, please share the campaign across your various social media platforms to help us reach our goal.

story:
Stretch Goals!

$10,000 STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED!

  • EVERY backer gets an "Alterna Ambassador" pin!

$12,000 STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED!

  • We'll now be ready and able to pitch our comics to several grocery store chains. We'll also donate 500 all ages comics to local libraries in the New England area. EVERY backer gets an Alterna Comics tote bag! 

$18,000 STRETCH GOAL

  • We'll be able to pay for guaranteed promotional placement in at least two chains as well as purchase an additional four years of membership from RangeMe so that we can continue to expand our comics distribution for years to come. We'll also donate 500 all ages comics to Shriners Hospitals for Children. EVERY backer will get a 4"x4" die-cut bumper sticker that says "I SUPPORT MY LOCAL COMIC SHOP!"

$25,000 STRETCH GOAL

  • We can begin production on marketing materials, promotional items, displays and signage for comic shops that carry Alterna. We'll also send 500 comics to Books for Troops. EVERY backer will get a commemorative 8x10 AlternaWeen print signed by Peter Simeti!

??? = more will be announced if we reach the $25,000 mark

 

AlternaWeen!

For thousands of children this Halloween, it's going to be a fun and interesting day thanks to YOU! By using our all ages and teen appropriate comics as trick or treats, you'll be able to help grow a new generation of comic book readers and creators.  The funds that we raise will go towards expanding our product line into a variety of stores: independent newsstands and convenience stores, grocery stores, dollar stores, and more!

Distribution expansion is an intensive process and can be costly depending on how much product is needed after a store accepts a pitch for product placement. We'll be partnering up with RangeMe to pitch our products to dozens of interested retailers across the world. We already have a few that are interested and the funds we raise will allow us to take the necessary next steps. 

More comics in more places

For those that don't know, Alterna has been around since 2006. We primarily published graphic novels in the first ten years of our existence and in May 2017 we launched a single issue line that featured interiors printed on newsprint. The newsprint is what allows us to have such affordable cover prices while still turning a profit for ourselves and our creators.

Part of our newsprint initiative started in 2017, was to also get comics back on newsstands. We make comics for everyone at Alterna but the sad truth is that comic books aren't as readily available as they used to be.  Over the past year, we've taken steps to become one of the only publishing companies with newsstand distribution along with traditional comic shop distribution. We're also working with several dozen comic shop retailers directly to get our comics into their stores on a more consistent basis.

In the holiday season of 2017, we brokered a deal with Toys "R" Us which put our comics into their top 200 busiest stores. The chain's days may have been numbered, but the distribution into these stores proved that comics, especially fun and affordable ones, were greatly missed by consumers of all ages. By having our comics in Toys "R" Us, several thousand readers became aware of our company and our comics.

Besides things like shipping and reward creation and fulfillment, our $8000 goal will go towards printing the additional comics that we'll need for finalizing our expanded distribution with a few retailers that we've been talking to, as well as pay for a 1 year membership fee for RangeMe. We'll also have stretch goals in place that will help us secure promotional product placements in a variety of stores, enable us to print more comics for more distribution, and will go towards all of the additional supplies that are needed for such an undertaking.

Alterna Comics is run, 99% of the time, by me: Peter Simeti. As the founder, publisher, site designer, merchandise designer, shipping department, graphic designer, prepress department, editor-in-chief, social media manager, marketing and promotions coordinator, president of sales, company accountant, and sometimes the writer, artist, colorist, inker, and letterer on a few books -- I've got a lot going on. SO if we raise enough funds and expand into enough stores, we'll hopefully be able to start hiring employees to help in 2019!

The Comics

The Rewards

We've got a few rewards available here, with the focus being on using our comics for trick or treats (or maybe even gifts if you want to start thinking in advance for the upcoming holiday season) -- if you want to purchase specific issue/titles/etc. please visit OrderAlterna.com to do so OR visit Your Local Comic Shop or Newsstand.

We'll also have these rewards available:

  • Shirts
  • Mugs
  • Hats & Beanies
  • Comic Treat Bags with stickers, a pencil, and silly putty
  • Horror Bundles for comic shop retailers (arrives in time for Halloween ComicFest)

Risks & Challenges

We're roughly new to Indiegogo BUT I've run over a dozen successful Kickstarter projects and have helped out over two dozen other projects on KS and IGG.  Alterna has been around since 2006, so we're definitely not a new company either. The boxes of AlternaWeen comic "treats" will absolutely arrive to you in time for Halloween (October 31st) or we'll give you your money back.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word on social media if you can and make sure to use the hash tag #AlternaWeen -- thank you!

Take a Look at Some of the Comics!

story:
Samurai And Dinosaurs tells the story of an elite group of samurai dispatched to investigate a downed meteorite and claims of monsters terrorizing the countryside. What they discover is reality breaking down all around them, and Jurassic beasts displaced in time!

 

Chibi Comics would love to build an invested audience who love great stories, great art, and trust in us to deliver epic comics and graphic novels to them for years to come. Samurai And Dinosaurs is the starting point for us as a company- we hope you'll join us for the journey!

 

Below is the opening 11 pages. We hope they give you a sense of what you'll be investing in. Content warning- strong language and violence...

 

Stretch Goals:

 

$8,000- Custom Bookmark depicting Ren's terrible loss from the start of the story. Artwork will be by Francisco Narde, artist of The Good Knight!!!

 

$12,000- Pin-up Gallery! Featuring the work of Keung Lee (Battle Maiden Knuckle Bomb), Narwhal (Earthbound), Vince Rush (Theo), Kristian Rossi (Alterna's Trespasser), Celina Hernandez (Chibi Comics, For Hire), Karl O'Rowe (Death Sworn), Francisco Narde (The Good Knight), and possibly more artists to be announced asap!

 

$15,000- The Cabin, Samurai And Dinosaur's prequel ashcan comic (5.5x8.5) written and drawn by Mike Murphy, is expanded from 16 to 24 pages, and goes full-size (6.625x10.25)!

 

$18,000- Samurai And Dinosaurs Trading Card! This will be done in the style of retro "gross-out" storytelling card series like Mars Attacks and Dinosaurs Attack.

 

$20,000- ????????

 

$25,000- ????????

story:
What? Who?

Hi-yah! I'm Fer Galicia "semi-pro" Comic Artist and Musician Wannabe, I'm also Father, Husband and unemployed.  Botella is the name of this Comic Book I started developing back in high school when I first started my dream of becoming a professional Comic Book Artist. The dream is been sabotaged quite a few times until now: The Moment of the Truth.


Botella is the story a group of young adventurers lost in another world trying to find themselves. When I started writing this story I was an angry teenager looking for answers to the frustration of my young life in the "post-grunge" era... lol now that I'm old-er I kinda see the world in a different way so I think can help this group of kids to find some closure. The story is a mix of Sci-fi and Fantasy, a mix of the look for the truth and love. A lot of the characters are based on good friends that I have met during my life, people that brought the spice of life on my way. Botella is ride on a park where you are not sure you are leaving alive. Be warned that this is not you classical "at the end of the day everything went back to normal".

The Plan is this create a Comic Book and a Soundtrack CD at any costs! (preferably low cost).
I will use this 60 days to work in the development of both items, it is plenty of time since I will be only doing this. 
The approximated timeline will be something like this:
Day 1 to day 45 develop (drawing and recording) of Comic and CD
Day 45 the finished comic will be submitted to Previews for distribution
Day 60 the digital part of the perks is send to you
Day 75 Comic and CD are manufactured
Day 90 the physical part of the perks are shipped to you

Is This Really Necessary?

Yes the success Botella Comic Book is the culmination of many things and the beginning of others.
I have been working for many years on improving as storyteller and learning many techniques while doing other unrelated day jobs I been a long almost unproductive journey in relation to the comic books world and with this publication I will try to create a platform for new creators to with a similar path as mine .

The goal to finance the printing an approximate of 3,000 copies of the Comic in full color and the up to 1,500 copies of the Cd in digipacks plus manufacturing some of the perks is a total of $6,000.
If the goal is not reached I'm gonna have to step down a little and print the Comic book on Black and White and maybe 1,000 or less CD copies and perhaps a less fancy packaging.
In the worse scenario I will just print on demand the copies to pay my debts to you friends and offer the finished "product" to a publisher house...

In the other hand if we go over the goal the remaining funds will help to print issue #2 and other projects as well as Comic Conventions attending as exhibitor and so on.

And What's On There For Me (You)?

I have be giving a lot of thought to make a nice set of rewards for all of you friends and I made a set of 12 Super Pack, every Super Pack Includes all the rewards Inside it and all the prior Pack, for example: Super Pack 1 includes only the items in Super Pack, but  Super Pack 4 also Includes everything from Super Pack 1,2 and 3.

(Important Note: None of the art shown is final)

(Reassuring Note: None of the art shown is final)


 

One of the greatest Ways To Help

Is sharing! (Like in Christmas) A great way to support this project is by passing it along. In this technological informative times there's a whole lot of ways to spread the word all over the world. If you are interested in this project help me get to other you will always be a part of the beginning of this and that will never change. There's a lot of share tools that can help to make this long time dream to see the light. Please post a link to this project in blog or network site and I will send you a postcard to your home address.

Go to Botella's facebook site and click like http://www.facebook.com/pages/Botella-Project/1...


Thanks for your attention and lets get this party started!!!

story:
Our Story

I am seeking a total of one-thousand dollars ($1000) to take my self-published* comic, "Dreadful" to Long Bean Comicon in October, 2011.

*In association with fellow artist, Lance Sawyer.


The Impact

All money raised will go towards helping to pay for my air-fare to and from California. Any money left over after air-fare is paid for will go towards helping to print issue 2 of Dreadful.


What We Need & What You Get

For "PERK" specifics, please see the rest of this campaign.

Please note that the "number available" for each perk refers specifically to the TOTAL number available of each product - ie: "135" available includes all 90 cards; 20 copies of Dreadful issue 1, and 25 copies of Dreadful issue 2.

Issue 2 of Dreadful will not be available until mid-August, 2011.
A total of twenty (20) copies of issue 1 will be available; twenty-five (25) of issue 2.


All products will be sent out regular mail; all cards will be mailed out in a protective plastic sheath.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, please kindly pass the word along - TELL YOUR FRIENDS! =)

story:
Our Story

Perhaps we've met already? I've spent the last year touring the UK's comic shows, including:

Online:

joshclarke.bigcartel.com

twitter.com/JoshClarkeDraws

fb.com/JoshClarkeDraws

JoshClarkeDraws.tumblr.com

joshclarke.artworkfolio.com

The Impact

If this campaign gets fulfilled, all the products I'm currently unable to list, print or create will be a reality, and you'll get to wear sweet tees and hang sweet art on your wall, and who doesn't want that?


It's all me, remember.  There's no writer/artist duo.  No promoter, no manager, no "website guy" - it's just Josh.


Currently in the works:

Personal webcomic / portfolio websites

The Elemals: Birth [Vol 2] & [Vol 3]

@JoshClarkeDraws Years One & Two

A larger bigcartel store, with a fleet of tshirt designs (until Topatoco wise up and take me on)


What I need


Okay, serious?  I need... a heck of a lot more than $1999.  That's just being optimistic.  You don't really need to think about it, but if you're curious: here's where the moneys you contribute will go:


Printing costs.  
Tshirts, Prints, Comics... they need printers.  Printers need paying.  In 2012 I'd like to ramp up my book production speed... 2 released in 2011, I want one new comic out every three months, if not quicker. Contributing will help toward that.  With new equipment, I can work faster.

Maintenance costs
Website hosting fees, bigcartel subscription, phone line, broadband, ink, photo paper, shipping tubes, postage stickers and other such supplies... they all mount up.

New equipment
I am in dire need of a new computer for digital art.  Creating comics and designs requires working at very high resolutions, and a new computer is perhaps the biggest obstacle to productivity right now.  It's not a joke that I can sometimes wander off and make a cup of tea while I wait for my current machine to do something!

Appearances 
I hope to be at 2012's Comic Conventions including London, Birmingham and Manchester MCM Expo, Kapow! Comic Con, London Super Comic Con, Leeds Thought Bubble and others.  Comic Conventions appearance require admission, transport, equipment, accommodation.  Again, stuff you don't immediately consider.  If the funds are there I can look to visiting conventions further from home I may not otherwise get to attend, so if you'd like me to show in YOUR area, contribute accordingly.  :)

What You Get
Of course, every perk gets you a cut of what you're helping to create - see table to the right

Other Ways You Can Help

Whatever loose change you have rattling around in your Paypal, send it over to joshclarke@me.com


Tell your friends about this campaign - share it on Facebook, twitter, tumblr, at your workplace.  Tell them there is this awesome artist you know practically giving away personalised artwork at low low prices.  


Thanks everyone.  Let's see how it goes...

story:
Capitalism Must Die! How to Kill Capitalism before it Kills Us will be a short (approximately 124 pages), simple book (with text, comics and illustrations) explaining capitalism: how it works, why it’s evil, and how to crush it. It’s very basic and accessible theory for the beginning revolutionary.

The book will be printed in black and white, as cheaply as possible so more people can get it and use it. There will also be an ebook in full color.

With the funds I raise here, I’ll be able to focus for the next few months on producing this book, without needing to do additional freelance work. If I don't make my goal, I will still take partial funding and produce the book no matter what (and you will still get your rewards). If I receive extra funding, I have more books planned (two books on general revolutionary concepts, and one on essential principles & practices for effective revolutionaries) and any extra funds will help me produce those too!

As an organizer, I often need materials that will help clarify basic concepts, to assist myself and others in understanding this nightmare of a system, as well as to introduce the theories – the guidelines – that could help us end it. We need to fashion our own tools to build a revolutionary movement. I haven't been able to find all materials I need, so I decided to make some myself. If I need them, others might need them too.

For this book, I will combine my skills as a long-time organizer, writer, and award-winning cartoonist (RFK Journalism Award 2012, Society of Professional Journalists' Sigma Delta Chi 2010, Adbusters Creative Resistance Award, among others). I've learned through my 20-year career as a cartoonist (published in hundreds of venues including the Los Angeles Times, South Florida Sun-Sentinel, Daily Beast, Z Magazine and the Occupied Wall Street Journal) that editorial cartoons must be sharp, to-the-point, and easy to understand. Revolutionary theory can be all those things as well.

Topics to be included:

  • What capitalism is, and what it is not
  • How capitalism functions: its economic mechanisms and social dynamics
  • Why capitalism is inherently expansionist
  • Why war, ecocide and poverty are inevitable effects of capitalism
  • Why no one – even capitalists themselves-- has the power to make the system more humane or less destructive
  • What must be done to destroy capitalism
  • Who is in a position to damage and destroy it, and who are their allies in that struggle
  • What is the difference between profit and surplus value, and why that is important
  • Why attacking capitalism’s awful effects is not a viable strategy
  • What are the structural weaknesses and vulnerabilities in the system

This book is an expanded version of a talk and slide show I gave last year at a day-long event called Earth at Risk, at the University of California at Berkeley, organized by Derrick Jensen, with Arundhati Roy and several other speakers. Many people approached me afterward to ask if I would make the talk widely available. This book is the result.

Here’s some recent reader feedback:

“I like what you’re doing with this series of graphic presentations. Very educational, while still remaining fun to look at.”
 – Sean Michael Dodd

“I look forward to the new cartoons. Sometimes they are revelatory and I perceive a new insight into something I thought I already had a full understanding of. You are able to encapsulate big concepts in succinct and thoughtful ways.”
 – Duccio

"Yours is an especially tough message to hustle -- that all these feel good recycling type things individuals are doing mean nothing if we dont shift systemically. We collectively dont actually want to hear this message, we are trying to dodge it. But then your clever cartoons come along. And we like cartoons and we read them, and we are shaken up and we can't just go back to pretending."
- Paxus Calta-Star

Please spread the word about this campaign to your friends and contacts.

Thanks in advance to everyone who donates! And to Indiegogo for providing the platform, and to Ted Rall for his very nice narration.

See more of my work at stephaniemcmillan.org. See the work of One Struggle at onestruggle.net.

CONTACT: I’d be happy to answer any and all questions from potential backers. Please email me at steph@minimumsecurity.net

***

For anyone who has the impulse to say: "Isn't it hypocritical to be raising money when you're against capitalism?!?", I would like to point out that as long as we do live under capitalism, there is still rent to pay, food to buy, printers to pay, etc. I'm seeking subsistence and production costs only, and there's little danger of me using the money to open a book sweatshop where I put desperate writers and cartoonists to work on my assembly line, while I lie around sipping mojitos... Hm... wait a minute....can I do that?

***
UPDATE 2/6: FULLY FUNDED!!

Thank you everyone!! This will allow me to work on the book for the next few months and get it printed. I'm very excited to complete it and distribute it widely! You made it possible.

10 days left: what happens if the book receives more than the goal?

STRETCH GOAL: $7000

If funding goes over by $1000, then every contributor (even if you contributed earlier) will receive 3 buttons. A photo is in the "Updates" section. You can choose between the "Bunnista Collection" and the "Victoria Collection."

STRETCH GOAL: $7500

If funding goes over the goal by $1500, then every contributor gets all six buttons (photo in the "Updates" section).

STRETCH GOAL: $8000

If funding goes $2000 over the goal, then I’ll send 25 free copies to libraries, colleges and universities -- spreading the anti-capitalist message! If you’d like to add one to the list, please forward this to your favorite librarian, professor or teacher, and have them email me their mailing address (steph (at) minimumsecurity (dot) net), or contact me here in the comments section.
story_txt:
Capitalism Must Die! How to Kill Capitalism before it Kills Us will be a short (approximately 124 pages), simple book (with text, comics and illustrations) explaining capitalism: how it works, why it’s evil, and how to crush it. It’s very basic and accessible theory for the beginning revolutionary. The book will be printed in black and white, as cheaply as possible so more people can get it and use it. There will also be an ebook in full color.With the funds I raise here, I’ll be able to focus for the next few months on producing this book, without needing to do additional freelance work. If I don't make my goal, I will still take partial funding and produce the book no matter what (and you will still get your rewards). If I receive extra funding, I have more books planned (two books on general revolutionary concepts, and one on essential principles & practices for effective revolutionaries) and any extra funds will help me produce those too!As an organizer, I often need materials that will help clarify basic concepts, to assist myself and others in understanding this nightmare of a system, as well as to introduce the theories – the guidelines – that could help us end it. We need to fashion our own tools to build a revolutionary movement. I haven't been able to find all materials I need, so I decided to make some myself. If I need them, others might need them too.
For this book, I will combine my skills as a long-time organizer, writer, and award-winning cartoonist (RFK Journalism Award 2012, Society of Professional Journalists' Sigma Delta Chi 2010, Adbusters Creative Resistance Award, among others). I've learned through my 20-year career as a cartoonist (published in hundreds of venues including the Los Angeles Times, South Florida Sun-Sentinel, Daily Beast, Z Magazine and the Occupied Wall Street Journal) that editorial cartoons must be sharp, to-the-point, and easy to understand. Revolutionary theory can be all those things as well. Topics to be included:

What capitalism is, and what it is not
How capitalism functions: its economic mechanisms and social dynamics
Why capitalism is inherently expansionist
Why war, ecocide and poverty are inevitable effects of capitalism
Why no one – even capitalists themselves-- has the power to make the system more humane or less destructive
What must be done to destroy capitalism
Who is in a position to damage and destroy it, and who are their allies in that struggle
What is the difference between profit and surplus value, and why that is important
Why attacking capitalism’s awful effects is not a viable strategy
What are the structural weaknesses and vulnerabilities in the system
This book is an expanded version of a talk and slide show I gave last year at a day-long event called Earth at Risk, at the University of California at Berkeley, organized by Derrick Jensen, with Arundhati Roy and several other speakers. Many people approached me afterward to ask if I would make the talk widely available. This book is the result.Here’s some recent reader feedback:“I like what you’re doing with this series of graphic presentations. Very educational, while still remaining fun to look at.” – Sean Michael Dodd“I look forward to the new cartoons. Sometimes they are revelatory and I perceive a new insight into something I thought I already had a full understanding of. You are able to encapsulate big concepts in succinct and thoughtful ways.”  – Duccio
"Yours is an especially tough message to hustle -- that all these feel good recycling type things individuals are doing mean nothing if we dont shift systemically. We collectively dont actually want to hear this message, we are trying to dodge it. But then your clever cartoons come along. And we like cartoons and we read them, and we are shaken up and we can't just go back to pretending."- Paxus Calta-Star
Please spread the word about this campaign to your friends and contacts.
Thanks in advance to everyone who donates! And to Indiegogo for providing the platform, and to Ted Rall for his very nice narration.See more of my work at stephaniemcmillan.org. See the work of One Struggle at onestruggle.net.CONTACT: I’d be happy to answer any and all questions from potential backers. Please email me at steph@minimumsecurity.net
***
For anyone who has the impulse to say: "Isn't it hypocritical to be raising money when you're against capitalism?!?", I would like to point out that as long as we do live under capitalism, there is still rent to pay, food to buy, printers to pay, etc. I'm seeking subsistence and production costs only, and there's little danger of me using the money to open a book sweatshop where I put desperate writers and cartoonists to work on my assembly line, while I lie around sipping mojitos... Hm... wait a minute....can I do that?

story:
Story:

Blake is a high school girl on the track team. In her downtime, she likes to write a novel she is currently working on and she enjoys going on long runs or jogs around the neighborhood. Her best friends are Johnny and Craig. Johnny is quiet but is an excellent student. Craig is friends with everyone, he's loud and likes to make people laugh.
On her jog one day, Blake runs into a strange setting where she encounters the magical being Mim, who is a descendant of the Mysticae, protectors of the Royal Bloodline. She has with her a key around her neck that possesses certain powers. She tells all these things to Blake, who immediately jumps on the chance to go on a magical adventure, but when she confides in her friends, they aren't so sure this is a good idea.

Why Donate?

Hi,

I just graduated with my BA from GMU.

I am currently waitressing to make money and my second job doesn't start until the end of August.

Blake is a story I am passionate about and now I finally have time to work on it (sort of!) I plan to use this webcomic as a portfolio builder so I can do comics and illustrations professionally someday.

I am raising money to help pay for Blake's own website, rent, and to host my current portfolio website, bexfx.com so that I have more time to dedicate to my art and less time waiting tables. I also need money for business cards!


If I raise even more, the money will help pay for printing hard copies. If you want to help more, you can pay for commissions, or simply spread my name around!

If you want to know more about me and my art, please check out my website.

www.bexfx.com

Thank you for thinking of the starving artist!

Keep up!
7/12 - Cover of issue 1 "The Witch's Key" is being colored, storyboards for pages 1-3 are being sketched in.


7/14 - Page 1 outlined!


7-24 Finished Ryan's self-portrait for his $25 Perk!

Lookin' spiffy there Ryan.

Your money also goes to getting these printed :)

story:
My Story

I grew up reading comic books at my local library starting with Essential Spider-man and my love for stories grew with old science fiction radio shows like X-Minus One. A few years ago I started writing my own story with characters I had created as a kid and with a lot of time, effort, and my own funds I created the first issue and funded the second which is almost complete. I was lucky to find an amazing artist, Katherine Campbell, and obtained a website to host my comic free to read.

Where Donations Go:

All of the donations will go into a business account and aside from what will be used to grant Perks, such as the cost to print and ship an issue to the supporter that ordered it, The funds will go to pay my artist for each new issue. Issue 2 has already been funded so The funds and perks such as cameos will be in issue 3 and on.

story:
KreeKraw and Kris are two Alien creatures with a rare gift for stumbling into trouble .
Lost in the void with no friends and a galaxy of hostile strangers.
They must rely on each other and extreme and sustained ultra violence to solve there problems.

With any luck they'll find home before there enemies catch up with them.

After visiting an Aquatic planet ,Kris is framed for murder .

He and his squiddy friend must stage a prison break ,fight off an army of police officers

and infiltrate the conspirator's lair to expose their evil schemes.

24 Pages of violence ,mayhem and sex,all a young lad needs to further his education.

 

If funding allows the second story below will also be included in the comic

otherwise it will be included in the second comic book

When there stolen mining ship ,the Saucy Susan, is damaged in a battle with the Ultra Bastard    our dirty duo must set down to make repairs ,but can only find a colonised asteroid filled with "ladies of negotiable affection".

A gang war is brewing between the various leaders of each  "Pleasure Palace" and kreekraw and kris must find a way through the madness without getting shot ,stabbed,lasered or vaporised.

12 Bonus Pages of Violence and whores ?what more could you ask for?

 

One of my earliest memories is reading one of 2000AD's science fiction stories about  a serial killer aboard a space freighter.The Twist ending  blew my tiny 6 year old mind .

I've loved comics my entire life ,from making my own at age seven

(they were somewhat derivative) to now ,when I require a few lorries to move my collection from house to house.

 

As for the campaign I would like to get full funding for the artist ,printing and shipping costs       and more importantly establish a relationship with similar minded fans who might like to read the future adventures of a Cowboy Space Squid and his tubby Human friend as they kick ass across a hostile universe.

                    

Shipping all over the world can be epensive even for a small package

Printing will be done abroad in china to save as much money as possible for my people.

As a contingency for failing to reach the funding goal I will prioritise the art and self fund completion and send every backer a PDF.

 

Kris (pictured Below)Considers Not using violence for once

I have 8 stories written ,Hopefully Spread  Across 4 books.I dont intend to go on for decades with the same characters .There will be a definitive ending and a fleshed out back story for how these people came to be emotionally damaged Anarchists.I do want to spend the rest of my life making fun comics for everyone.

 

If money is tight in this crazy work-a-day world please consider giving me a boost on social media twitter,youtube  etc

god bless

Mike.A Swan

 

Other Sources

blog

https://creatingcomicsatlast.blogspot.com/

youtube channel

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIz35mA3mdzXrk...

Twitter

@comicsgatekeep1

Credits

Cover & Promo Art :JustSomeGuy

Interior art :Daniel Morris

Colours: Rodrigo Ybañez
