story:
THE MARS CITY VICE WORLD:

Mars circa 2089, humans live and play alongside various extraterrestrial races. Several planets in our solar system have been colonized for many years. The Moon has sprawling slums, while Mars has become a popular and exclusive theme park based on a super stylized version of 80's Miami. Two unlikely police detectives, a human Maxwell 'Moony' Boone, and his new alien partner Tykar 'Ty' Baths try and overcome their differences, as they work undercover in a fake 1980's Miami investigating a mysterious kingpin that is threatening to corrupt the solar system with a new drug made from a rare alien blood.

WELCOME TO MARS VICE:

Thanks for checking out our campaign to raise funds for Part One of Mars City Vice! We plan to release a part one and part two. The first release being 42 pages and the follow up being 66 pages to complete the series. The first 21 pages is completely inked and nearly colored. We are doing this Indiegogo to raise enough funds to finish the colors  and complete  volume one. We are almost there!

THE MARS CITY VICE  TEAM:

Writers & Creators

Craig E. Sawyer and Chris Webb are the 80's obsessed nerds behind the idea of Mars City Vice. Craig is owner of the board game company Sentient Cow Games and has written for comics and film. Chris has over twenty years of experience producing television commercials and interactive content for www.chriswebb.tv. Chris has successfully helmed a broad range of live action and CG animation productions featuring celebrities ranging from Dwyane Wayde to Jerry Seinfeld. Chris came to producing via art school having attended both the Savannah College of Art and Design, and The Art Institute of Ft. Lauderdale. Craig and Chris were brought together over their love for Miami Vice, sci-fi, and Dungeons & Dragons.

Penciler:

Deivid Deon's action packed pencils are perfect for our sci-fi world of Mar's City Vice. He is also great at drawing weird aliens! Deivid is a fresh new talent on the professional scene having cut his teeth with indie publishers such as Top Secret press and Meraki. He has always killed deadlines with turning out strong pages on a daily basis.

Inker:

Sandro Ribeiro's debut happened at Marvel, where he inked some editions of the title Marvel Adventure The Avengers, then went to DC Comics and did work on Teen Titans, Action Comics, Justice League, Green lantern Blackest Night, Red Tornado, Final Crisis Aftermath and others. He has also worked in publishers such as Top Cow, Avatar, valiant and others

Colorist:

James Brown has spent 25 years in the comics industry. Deadlines met. No excuses. Always in communication with editors and creators. He has worked with such staples of the industry as IDW on their books Transformers and GI Joe A real American Hero. He has also worked with Marvel Comics on the titles Fantastic Four: A Death in the Family and Thunderbolts.

Letterer:

Ed Dukeshire is a Harvey-nominated letterer working in the biz since 2001. He has lettered comics from mainstream to creator-owned favorites including Hulk, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, and Shadow Hawk for publishers like Marvel, Boom! Studios, Image and DC Comics.

Why an Indiegogo?

We want to keep the goals simple and straight forward.  We are using a Flex goal to raise funds meaning all money donated to this campaign will go forward to finishing the remaining 44 pages of Vice Part One. These funds will be for the art team, so they will be able to focus on the book full time. Any funds that go beyond it's completion will be applied to overhead and the production of Mars City Vice part two. The first 21 of the 44 pgs for Part One are completely inked and nearly colored and lettered.

Risks & Challenges

Times are indeed strange for the larger mainstream comic book industry. Diamond Distribution has halted print distribution indefinitely, and comic shops have closed for now. However, that is not affecting self funding indies like us. We already have 21 pages of Vice Part 1 fully inked and just need funds to pay artists to finish the rest. I know the ins and outs of running a transparent and successful social fundraiser. I recently ran a very successful campaign for my board game Secret Unknown Stuff: Escape from Dulce on Kickstarter. I feel that Indiegogo is still the superior platform for books and comics.

Other Ways You Can Help

Mars City Vice will succeed, but it will do even better if you spread the word to friends on social media. So, please remember that Indiegogo has a sharing tool to do specifically that. Dealing with the recent quarantines and job issues have affected everyone. We have used this time to create and bring you some solid comic book entertainment. It is a great time for indie creators and none of this would be possible without lovers of the medium such as yourself.

story:
RED EYES 1 is done and fulfilled, if you are interested in knowing more, check out our issue 2, on IndieGogo. Link right here:

RED EYES 2

OVERVIEW

Episode One is a 48 page full color graphic novel of action, fantasy and a story of redemption.

Faerin Fair, son of the General has a led a privileged live until his ambitions cost him a death sentence. Facing death for his sins he is drafted into a mission of penance. Faerin, will learn and come back victorious, or find a hero's death for the glory of the insurrection!

story:
The Jump-off

First up if you're new to the world of Scrimshaw please continue below. If you're already acquainted with Hans and the rest of the crew and the octopus please scroll down to Issue #3.

 

The Story

The polar ice caps melted and the oceans rose. Nations were swept away in the deluge. World governments were fractured by war. Corporations filled the void. Millions died. Resources dwindled and flight became a thing of the past. Mankind was nearly destroyed. But life was clawed back through science and blood.

The story is a genre-mixing tale of old and new. It is a science and swordplay adventure on the high seas. It’s the story of a loose confederation of characters from the far-flung corners of the world who have come together as a family in order to find their way. With members hailing from Japan, Mexico, New Zealand, Norway, and American Samoa, the crew of the Runaway Horse has a colorful past and an uncertain future.

Follow Hans and the crew of the Runaway Horse as they make their way in the New Pacific, a world of ruthless business, uneasy truces, and shifting alliances. A world abided by steel, marked by mutation, and at the mercy of the violent sea.

Meet The Crew

Our Intrepid Captain - Hans Tanaka

His Mutant Valet - Saigo

 

The First Mate - Mariposa Zanabria

The Captains Wife - Katsuko Tanaka

Your Ordnance Technician – Ngaire Te Piki Kotuku Solomon

Deckhand Extraordinaire – Tapuitea “Herman” Mafulele

THE TEAM

Eric Borden - Creator/Writer

Eric Borden is a screenwriter whose preferred genres are drama, horror, and anything that will hold an edge. He is the author of many shorts, a few features, a couple comics (Dead West, Blood Game), and one book. One of those features, Fever is currently in development with Blanc-Biehn Productions. He lives and works in Las Vegas, Nevada.

Dave Mims - Artist

Dave Mims is a graphic artist with over ten years experience. Dave has attended both the Art Institute of Pittsburgh and the Academy of Design. He's the lead artist on the comic books, The Infected (Hartman) and All Hallow's Eve (Luckman). He lives and works in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. 

 

Mark Quist - Story Consultant/Comic Con Salesman Extraordinaire

Mark has thoroughly Immersed himself in the production of sci-fi/horror themed comics as well as movie media production. He transplanted from the southeast to the Las Vegas valley ten years ago in order to slow down.

 

Rashad Tabeb - Story Consultant/The Relationship Guy

Rashad Tabeb is a firm believer in the willful suspension of disbelief, and that there is not much better than a great story. A lover of nature, manga, anime, knives, gear, and of course beer. He lives in Las Vegas with his wife and two children.

Issue #3

Scrimshaw currently has a  distribution deal with Alterna Comics. This is great because it will open up the potential for  expanding the audience of a project we're very passionate about. Our deal with Alterna begins with digital distribution in October 2016. Every third issue in the series will be published in print as a collected graphic novel and will be available through Diamond Comic Distributors and IPG.  Naturally that means we'll be on comic shop shelves, which is Everest for any aspiring comic creator. Since this issue is magic number 3, that means we're nearly at the summit.   

That's where you, the readers who helped us get this thing off the ground, as well as the ones joining us right now, come in. 

Before we get to the nuts and bolts, here's a sneak peek at The Cover and 1st Page of Issue #3

 We know you want some more of that. 

Where Does the Money Go?

We're launching this campaign for just one reason. So that we can print Issue #3.  You might notice that our goal is the same as Issue #2. We established the $4400 goal for a couple of reasons. 

Reason #1 - $4400 allows us to print enough comics that we can fulfill our Issue #2 promise to our awesome readers and still have enough to sell at our next Comic Con and maybe make some coin to pay for being attending the Con. These sales also help us go to work on Issue #4. 

Reason #2 - $4400 is in the ballpark of what our first printed distribution run with Alterna might cost and we want to show them we can hit that number. Our goal is to get Scrimshaw on those comic store shelves for everyone to read.

(I say ballpark because Indiegogo does take a small % for facilitating our mission.) 

Now this is where the beauty of Indiegogo becomes clear. Since this is a flexible funding campaign even if we don't hit our goal, we're going to put what we do raise to work, which means you will get Issue #3 in your hands regardless. That's the point of our whole campaign, to get the book to readers and be able to continue telling the story. Plain and Simple, right?

What Do We Get?  

Since this campaign is essentially a pre-sale for Issue #3, we're offering perks to get Scrimshaw in as many hands as possible and help put you in touch with the world and the characters. 

The Impact

Still with us? Great because this is the most important part of Scrimshaw, the message. Scrimshaw is about the where our world could be headed.  It tells the story of a possible future. One in which the world has been affected by the effects of global warming, genetic and agricultural manipulation, and all-out war between the so-called superpowers.  While it’s a fantasy adventure with a diverse cast of characters, it is also firmly rooted in the real. Issues like global warming, overfishing of the oceans, corporate exploitation, political over-reach, and race relations are tackled head-on. The story also revolves around one of the oldest and most maligned traits that mankind possesses, our ability to make war. Scrimshaw imagines a future that could become very real given the current state of affairs in our world. 

It's our hope that this little story might spark in someone the wish to ask why? And that maybe in asking the question the answer brings them to a place where they can aid the change that the world so desperately needs. 

 

Risks and Challenges

Luckily this isn't the first comic book for any of us. We've been up the mountain before and we're contractually obligated to go up the mountain for the next two years.  Still there are challenges with bringing any artistic endeavor into being. We're confident that barring any unforeseen circumstances or swift and mighty deathblows to the team, we can  deliver Scrimshaw Issue #3 in all it's glory in October 2016. Not coincidentally that's when we plan on going to Stan Lee's Comikaze in Los Angeles, so the book better be finished.
story_txt: The Jump-offFirst up if you're new to the world of Scrimshaw please continue below. If you're already acquainted with Hans and the rest of the crew and the octopus please scroll down to Issue #3. The StoryThe polar ice caps melted and the oceans rose. Nations were swept away in the deluge. World governments were fractured by war. Corporations filled the void. Millions died. Resources dwindled and flight became a thing of the past. Mankind was nearly destroyed. But life was clawed back through science and blood.The story is a genre-mixing tale of old and new. It is a science and swordplay adventure on the high seas. It’s the story of a loose confederation of characters from the far-flung corners of the world who have come together as a family in order to find their way. With members hailing from Japan, Mexico, New Zealand, Norway, and American Samoa, the crew of the Runaway Horse has a colorful past and an uncertain future.Follow Hans and the crew of the Runaway Horse as they make their way in the New Pacific, a world of ruthless business, uneasy truces, and shifting alliances. A world abided by steel, marked by mutation, and at the mercy of the violent sea.Meet The CrewOur Intrepid Captain - Hans TanakaHis Mutant Valet - Saigo The First Mate - Mariposa ZanabriaThe Captains Wife - Katsuko TanakaYour Ordnance Technician – Ngaire Te Piki Kotuku SolomonDeckhand Extraordinaire – Tapuitea “Herman” MafuleleTHE TEAMEric Borden - Creator/WriterEric Borden is a screenwriter whose preferred genres are drama, horror, and anything that will hold an edge. story:
Hello Friends,

My name is Felix Quinonez Jr. and I've been avid reader of comics for most of my life. Even at a young age I understood that the medium was more than just disposable entertainment for kids. And as I've gotten older I began realizing what a great instrument of self expression comics can be. Which brings me to Love's for Suckas.

Like all high school seniors, Eric has it all figured out...until his long-suffering girlfriend decides she's had enough of his shit and breaks up with him. 

With his world turned upside down, Eric decides to win her back because he's changed...seriously for real this time. 

Love's for Suckas follows one guy's quest to understand this crazy thing called love. And along the way, with help from friends, he learns that even though it's tempting to hold on to the past, sometimes you have to let go. And maybe, just maybe he gets what he's after...even if it's not what he thought it would be. 

Although this is generally a very down to earth, grounded in reality story it also contains some fantasy/sci-fi elements peppered throughout. I think this is a fun way to visually represent what the characters are feelings and can set "Love’s for Suckas" apart from other stories of its kind.


Ok, so Why am I here? After having worked on Love's for Suckas for over a year and a half, I've finally finished it. I don't mean I finished the outline or the script or even laying down the pencils. I mean the book is complete. All six chapters, 170 pages have been drawn, ink, lettered, formatted and printed.I sent out the files to the printer and got back my test batch of a few copies and I am very happy with the result. 

And that's where you come in. Now that I have the book in my hand I want to share it with the world. All writers want their work read. All artists want people to see their work. And you can help me achieve this goal. By helping me fund the print run you give me the opportunity to put my book in the hands of the readers. You will also help me get the book into stores. (Physical and digital) But more importantly you will help me reach the culmination of my goal. You will make the last year and a half of barely sleeping and having no social life be completely worth it. 

How You Can Help and What You'll Get

Love's for Suckas was never imagined as a vehicle for financial gain. It was simply a story I wanted to tell, something I needed to get out of my system and so I did. I completed the book on my own time so you won't have to subsidize my living expenses while I take off from work to do this project. I was the only one who worked on it so there are no assistants or anyone I need to pay with the funds raised with this campaign. The goal is simple; to raise money to cover the printing and shipping costs.

Printing: The book is pretty long (170 pages) and it has a nice perfect binding and a glossy finish. This obviously had an impact on the printing cost but I didn't want to go overboard. Luckily I found a printer that was economical without sacrificing quality. I've worked out the details and with the number of copies I'm planning to print out, the cost will be about $600.

Shipping: This is pretty self explanatory, I need to get the books to my house and then to stores. So the cost will be about $150.

What If The Funding Doesn't Reach The Goal? That's OK, I will gladly make up the difference. This is my passion project after all.

What If The Funding Exceeds The Goal? That just means I will be able to print more books. 

Depending on how much people contribute they will receive digital and physical copies of the book. I will also be giving away lots of original art. All of it will be pencilled and inked. The higher the contribution, the bigger and more elaborate the art pieces will be. And the people that really go all out with their contributions will receive an original completed page from the graphic novel itself. In the gallery you will see a few of the pieces that I will be giving away.  

Risks

I don't think anything is without risks but as far as crowd funding campaigns go, this is as close to risk free as it gets. The book is done and ready to get out there and it will definitely happen even if I don't meet the goal. But that doesn't mean your contributions don't make a difference. In fact it's the exact opposite. You don't need to worry about whether you're contributing your hard earned money to a project that will never see the light of day. And you will be able to hold the product of your contribution in your hand to read. No matter how much you contribute, you can rest assured that you're helping someone achieve his goal.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    But if you can't contribute with money, that's ok, you can still help. Simply put, just tell people about this campaign and share the link. 

    Thanks for your time and consideration.

story:
Myths Of Steam: Hel On Earth


What is it?

Myths of Steam: Hel on Earth is a 4 issue mini-series written by a freelance writer (Patricia Ash), illustrated by a freelance artist (Jennie Gyllblad), and published by an indie publisher (Antarctic Press). The drop date for the first issue will be in August 2014.

Who Are You?

You might know me as the Chief Editor of Gearhearts Steampunk Glamor Revue, or you might have no idea who I am. I'm an American abroad in England, an avid knitter, a Steampunk fashionista, a Heathen, a cat-owner, and a writer.

Why the Indigogo?

It takes money to make a comic. The publisher is small, and they barely have enough to cover the printing costs. There is no advance for me and no marketing budget. I've put this together to get a bit of cash to cover some advertising costs - attending conventions, printing up flyers, that sort of thing. 

I have a couple other means of financial support, but art is what pays Jennie's rent. She is going to get paid even if my family has to eat instant noodles for a month to cover her pay. I hate instant noodles, therefore I have set up this Indigogo.

Where Does My Money Go?

Conventions. It costs a lot to reserve a table at sci fi conventions, comic conventions, and/or Steampunk conventions. Not to mention what getting there costs...have you seen gas prices and airline tickets lately?

Any particular conventions, Patricia? 

Yes, actually! I'll be taking this title to the Steampunk Festival in Gavle, Sweden, to Akon in Dallas, Texas, to Nine Worlds, and to Loncon in London.

Advertising! Postcards, bookmarks, banners, anything to let people know about Myths of Steam. It's a brand new title, so people need a little convincing if they're going to buy it. I intend to convince them.

What Do I Get For My Money?

The warm, fuzzy feeling of a good deed and supporting indie comics. Also, stuff. We have everything from commemorative postcards to flash fiction, from a simple thank you to a commissioned portrait.

What Is This Comic About?

Steampunk Nordic Deities. The big three (Odin, Thor, and Loki) go missing, and their wives enlist Hel, Queen of the Underworld (and Loki's daughter), to find out where they've gone. She journeys to Midgard (Earth) with her stepmother Sigyn. They search every brothel, gambling den, music hall, opera, political arena, ballroom, pub, and sewer they can find. Then the Clockwork Men crawl out of the shady corners of London...

I'm Broke, But This Sounds Awesome!

That's cool, we're broke, too. Even if you can't give us money, you can give us exposure - no one can buy Myths of Steam if they've never heard of it! There are 2 things you can do, even if you are as broke as we are:

1. Share this link. With everybody. Everywhere.

2. Tell your local comic book shop how awesome Myths of Steam is going to be. Tell them to order copies of it. (Antarctic Press is distributed by Diamond Distributors, who serve most comic shops. Most shops should be able to order it for you.)

story:
WELCOME!!!

My name is Free Isabelo. I'm an artist based out of Las Vegas,NV. I've been in the comic industry for a few years now and have several comics produced and on the shelves. Some of my titles include Avenger Red by ONWARD! Comics, The Cule by Former Employee Comics, and a few independent creators.

I put together this book of pin-ups and pages because I have been asked so many times to showcase my work in a compilation. 

I also co-founded one of the biggest group of comic book creators in Las Vegas (Artists Comic Collective) we started in LV 2 years ago with 4 artists. Now we have over 60 artists in LV and over 120 artists in 7 states! This book will be a great way to branch out and get the ACC in more shops!

The BreakDown...

The reason I'm asking for $1000 is simple... it cost a lot of money to produce, distribute, and pay for the incentives. 

- only 200 (numbered) copies will be made

- shipping individual packages across the country (and international)

- other incentive swag!

- Indygogo fees

YOUR impact...

Because of your pledge, I will be able to produce this book for everyone to enjoy. I've been drawing for so long and have done artwork for so many people that I decided that I want to give my fans and friends what they have been asking for. Because of YOU, I can continue my dream...THANK YOU!!!

Other Ways You Can Help..

Hopefully, you can be apart of this awesome project...If you can't pledge money to this project you can always share this page on your networking sites!

story:
What is Project B.A.?

 

There's a genre called 'Splatter film' in movies
Films in this genre usually refers to films containing graphic violence mixed with stimulating scenes for purpose of 'killing time'


Groups of people prefer this straight-forward and stimulating genre over complicated and well-constructed media form.
This is a project dedicated to that group of people

To sum it all up, this project aims to create a graphic novel version of the splatter film genre


'Sexy & Violence' being the slogan, Project B.A. would like to create contents for those people who are interested in seeing this genre in graphic novel form.
Since this project will be targeted towards adults, there will be violence and gore along with sexual expressions
Therefore, viewer discretion is HIGHLY advised for people who are uncomfortable with these themes for the following contents.

 

------------------------------------

Reason for the funding

Although there are few who knows and enjoys these type of work in comic and animation, there are definitely groups of people who demands these type of work.
However the demand far exceeds the supplies in this case.
This limits the number of organizations or companies funding this type of work to be produced.


Although there are authors and artists who produces these type of work irregularly without any compensation, the lack of support and profit tends to force them into unscheduled hiatus without promise of continuing.

So I would like to create the contents with the help of the people who enjoys this type of work

 

------------------------------------

Project B.A issue #1

[Information]

Title: Prey Ship -part.1

 

[synopsis]

-A spaceship filled with the most dangerous creatures from different planets

 

-A fatal mistake by the cell manager allows a creature to escape, causing the ship's fate in jeopardy.

 

 

-The hungry creature seeks food(crews) to fill its need

-A struggle of life and death between the creature and the crews who resist against the horrible being.

 


[Note]

-Pages: 22 pages
-This particular project will be the first half of the series. The second project will follow if this project is successful
-This work is fully colored (see sample image for reference)
-No dialogues in order to eliminate language barrier

 

------------------------------------
If the project is successfully funded,

then the comic will be completed to be sold online.
There will be rewards for the pledges

 

 

reward?

 

 

 

Since project B.A's main target audience is the people who enjoys this type of work, I would like to share it as much as possible with those people around the world
Successful funding will lead to completed version of the comic with quality equal to the samples provided and it will be sold online.

The Final version of the comic will be in three versions.
public version(Web upload), The B.A edition and the Premium B.A edition.
(The Premium version will be in higher quality for the readers to enjoy every single little detail and the way it is drawn)

 

The premium will also be provided as reward for people who pledges certain amount.
story_txt: What is Project B.A.? There's a genre called 'Splatter film' in moviesFilms in this genre usually refers to films containing graphic violence mixed with stimulating scenes for purpose of 'killing time'Groups of people prefer this straight-forward and stimulating genre over complicated and well-constructed media form.This is a project dedicated to that group of peopleTo sum it all up, this project aims to create a graphic novel version of the splatter film genre'Sexy & Violence' being the slogan, Project B.A. would like to create contents for those people who are interested in seeing this genre in graphic novel form.Since this project will be targeted towards adults, there will be violence and gore along with sexual expressionsTherefore, viewer discretion is HIGHLY advised for people who are uncomfortable with these themes for the following contents. ------------------------------------Reason for the fundingAlthough there are few who knows and enjoys these type of work in comic and animation, there are definitely groups of people who demands these type of work.However the demand far exceeds the supplies in this case.This limits the number of organizations or companies funding this type of work to be produced.Although there are authors and artists who produces these type of work irregularly without any compensation, the lack of support and profit tends to force them into unscheduled hiatus without promise of continuing.So I would like to create the contents with the help of the people who enjoys this type of work ------------------------------------Project B.A issue #1[Information]Title: Prey Ship -part.1 [synopsis]-A spaceship filled with the most dangerous creatures from different planets -A fatal mistake by the cell manager allows a creature to escape, causing the ship's fate in jeopardy.   -The hungry creature seeks food(crews) to fill its need-A struggle of life and death between the creature and the crews who resist against the horrible being. [Note]-Pages: 22 pages-This particular project will be the first half of the series. The second project will follow if this project is successful-This work is fully colored (see sample image for reference)-No dialogues in order to eliminate language barrier ------------------------------------If the project is successfully funded,then the comic will be completed to be sold online.There will be rewards for the pledges  reward?   Since project B.A's main target audience is the people who enjoys this type of work, I would like to share it as much as possible with those people around the world Successful funding will lead to completed version of the comic with quality equal to the samples provided and it will be sold online.The Final version of the comic will be in three versions.public version(Web upload), The B.A edition and the Premium B.A edition.(The Premium version will be in higher quality for the readers to enjoy every single little detail and the way it is drawn) The premium will also be provided as reward for people who pledges certain amount.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Eddie Avila, I am a Parson's School of Design graduate.  I have been in the sales industry for the past decade but never lost my love for art, illustration and martial arts.  I began this project 3 years ago and am proud of where it's gotten so far and hope to be able to provide my fellow comic book lovers with an innovative and collectible new comic to fall in love with.

What We Need & What You Get

 At this time we are hoping to raise $2000 in order to get issues 1, 2, and 3 colored, bubbled and printed.  We are hoping to be able to have this all done and ready for April in order to ship and start selling! 

For pledging we are offering very limited and collectible prints and one of a kind, interactive artwork for specific levels.

Whether we are unable to reach our goal or exceed our goal all funds will be used to finish production on Issues 1, 2, and 3 of "Day One", and all pledgers will receive their specific perks.

The Impact

I believe in this project with all my heart and know once it gets out there for readers they will believe in it also, the story and the world it is set in are relatable to everyone, comic book lover or not.  The 20 years of martial arts experience I have, have allowed me to bring unprecedented scenes to this book that are not found in any other comic out there.

This is not our first campaign, but it's even more important this time around, we have raised over $6600 on Kickstarter making us 130% funded!  What we are hoping for now is to reach even further and be able to print more issues than originally planned to really get us out there!

Risks & Challenges

In order to minimize risks and challenges that we may face when publishing, we have started our own publishing company, Velocity comics.  We have also copyright and trademarked all materials.  This process started 3 years ago and we felt that tackling these hurdles prior to launching would give us the most efficient outcome.  However, this will be our first time ever printing a comic, that brings some possible issues in itself.  Because we have never printed before we have to do some serious work to ensure proper coloring and quality work to all our pledges and potential fans and we will work tirelessly to do so.  Further questions feel free to contact me at ed@dayonethecomic.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand you may love our project but may not be able to contribute financially, that's not all it's about anyway!  We would love for you to share with friends and family on social media! Indiegogo makes this easy with easy to use share tools!  So love us?  Please share and help us reach our goal!

story:
Short Summary

    Thanks for looking into Project: Reclamation! We are a small group of independent writers and artists who have a story to tell. It's inspired by the ways that we all as people are faced with challenging circumstances and how there is always something pulling us one way or the other in those times. If you have ever seen the old Looney Tunes cartoons where there's an angel on one shoulder, trying to help the character to do the right thing as well as a demon on the other trying to pull them away from the right thing - that was the initial inspiration for our story. 

    Lucidus is an angel who decides to leave Heaven to return to Earth to help one man in his time of need. David has lost everything he has ever held dear. His wife and daughter were killed in a drunk driving accident right after he returned from the war. But because if his pain and self-destructive ways, he can't see that there is something much larger and far more sinister afoot.

    Legion has returned to Earth with the goal of possessing all of mankind and opening the gateway between Hell and Earth, and David is one of the few who can help to stop him. Throughout the series David will come to terms with his own pain. He will  learn that the road to redemption is rarely an easy one and that there are many others just like him who need to find that same path.

     So David and his group of 'degenerates' partner up with a small group of angels who have all left the confines of Heaven to assist mankind in its hour of need. Lucidus and her angelic friends will aid David and his group to stop an evil of Biblical proportions from achieving its sinister goals.

    But as much as we have enjoyed working on this project so far, we have taken it as far as we can on our own. We need your help to continue Lucidus and David's story. Because of the generosity and faith of our core group of friends and fans, we were able to not only release the origins issue, but SELL OUT of the first print run.

     In addition to what their generosity allowed us to do, it also gave us the opportunity to work with a legend in the Comic Book industry, Bart Sears. Bart and his team at Ominous Studios in Florida created an amazing cover for the origin issue as well as an alternate version for promotional posters. The folks at Ominous were instrumental in getting us started down the right path and we are forever grateful to them for all their help.

     But now we turn to you. If you are reading this then you obviously have an affinity for comics and the stories they are able to tell. We would love to see our characters grow and continue to tell their story to an audience that we already have, as well as to any new friends we might make along the way. Thank you so much for giving us the chance to tell you about our passion. 

    Now on to the details....


What We Need & What You Get

- We want to raise $5000 to core the costs of the next two issues of Reclamation, in the hopes that we will be able to make enough profit off of them to continue the series and make it self-sustaining. Here's the breakdown of cost: 

          - Covers range from $500 to $750 for professional quality, eye-catching art that will stand out against the complicated background of the comic book store shelf.

          - Sequential art ranges from $75 to $100 per page, depending on the skill and expertise of the artist contracted. We have already started out with some of the best and would love to be able to continue the trend. We are currently reaching out to up-and-coming artists in the local area and abroad to try and maintain our sequential art budget at $1500 or less per issue.

          - Currently all of our printing goes through www.ka-blam.com They have been an excellent source of printing for us and have been dry helpful in the past and we would like to continue our business relationship with them. 

          - Any other funding that we raise will be used for promotional items such as stickers, posters, T-shirts and the like for convention appearances and events.

- If we do not reach our goal of $5000 dollars by July 4th, we will not tie up. We will use what he have been given by you to continue the project and will not stop in our efforts to get our story out there. We began this project in June of 2011 and we were finally able to release the origin issue on May 3rd, 2014 at a Free Comic Book Day event near our home base. As before stated, we SOLD OUT of the first print run and are currently getting another run printed to have for some upcoming promotional events as well.

- All donations, no matter the amount, will be returned with thanks in print in our first issue. There will be a tired system of benefits for donations above certain levels. Here's what you can get by helping us out.

          - Over $20: Thanks in print in the first issue, as well as a signed copy of the issue sent to you.

          - Over $50: Thanks in print in the first issue, a signed copy of the first issue sent to you and a signed and numbered poster print.

          - Over $100: Thanks in print in the first issue, a signed copy of the issue sent to you, a signed and numbered poster print as well as a limited edition fundraising campaign t-shirt.

          - Over $1000: Thanks in print in the first issue, a signed copy of the first issue sent to you, a signed and numbered poster print, a limited edition fundraising campaign t-shirt, AND you will be WRITTEN IN AS A CHARACTER IN RECLAMATION that will be involved in the story until the very end. All you'll need to do is send us a close-up of your face and a full-body photo and you will become a character in the Reclamation universe who will help David and his crew fight the forces of Legion.

The Impact

We are all of different religious backgrounds but we all believe that there is a higher power guiding us along our path in life. This story gives us a chance to show that these forces work with us and against us in our everyday lives. It is more about how David and his human counterparts deal with the guidance given to them by both angelic and demonic forces throughout their struggle. It will tell viewers a story that will hopefully make them see that no matter how far they have fallen away, there is always hope for redemption within their lives and they they do in fact have a purpose and meaning.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with a monetary gift, we can still use your help! We would love for you to help us spread the word about Reclamation. You can help us our by simply posting the links we will give you to your Facebook pages and Twitter pages and whatever other social media outlets you favor. Send these links out in emails to anyone you think might be interested in the project. It's not just money that we need. Getting people to see the project is every bit as important as the funding of it, so thank you in advance for all your help! So welcome to our street team! It's a pleasure to have you on board! Here are the links:

Facebook Page:

www.facebook.com/AngelsHaveCome

Origin Issue on Kindle:

http://www.amazon.com/Reclamation-The-Decision-Travis-Huber-ebook/dp/B00JH4C10M/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1399741983&sr=8-1&keywords=Reclamation+The+Decision+on+Kindle

Big Bad Comix Imprint:

www.bigbadcomix.com

story:
Our Story

My name is Amy Staats and I am the writer/creator of "Here's What I Like...And Now I'll Tell You Why".  We are thrilled to be shooting "Here's What I Like...Russian Literature" on February 27th, and are looking to raise $300 towards period costume rental, equipment rental, transportation, and lunch for the amazing cast and crew.


The Impact

The impact of your donation will be huge. These videos are all self produced, and $300 makes a big difference in our ability to keep going. There are many, many episodes coming including, "Here's What I Like...Salad", "Here's What I Like...Our Forefathers...Tiger beat Style", "Here's What I Like...This Song", and "Here's What I Like...Cheap Cocoa". We want to bring all these ideas to life.


What We Need & What You Get

$100: equipment
$100: costume/set budget
$50 transportation
$50 lunch

(You may notice that although we are saying $300, the graphics above say $500. We found out after making the video the minimum amount we could ask for is $500, so that is why it says we are trying to raise $500.  Anything above $300 we receive will go to paying the cast crew/ and or put in the kitty for the next episode.

Other ways you can help:

Spread the word! If you like this series, pass it on. Any little bit helps

story:
Our Story

Kelfi & Fikel are going to the Melbourne International Comedy Festival in March & April 2012 and we'd love your support. We have secured an awesome venue called The Butterfly Club. Kelfi & Fikel are Fiona Della Ca and Kellie Higgins, a two woman, musical comedy cabaret duo. We have been friends since 1992 and have always laughed together. We write quirky, irreverent songs and sketches and have been working hard to get as much experience as possible, trying out our material at Arthur B's Fringe Affair, Comedy on the Edge, Ha Ha Comedy, Slide Cabaret Bar, Mic in Hand, Happy Endings Comedy Club and the Roxbury Hotel. These experiences have given us other opportunities, having being invited to perform at the Sydney Food & Wine Fair, Slide Cabaret Festival, and the Glebe St. Fair. We will be running preview shows in early March 2012. We have also submitted our show for the Sydney Comedy Festival and we have confidence in the longevity of our partnership. 


The Impact

This festival, the third-largest international comedy festival in the world and the largest cultural event in Australia, will give us an amazing opportunity to network, meet like-minded comedians and to learn from the best, as well as get a chance to reach out to as many audiences as possible, to learn and become stronger performers and comedians. 


What We Need & What You Get

We have calculated that we will need $5000 for marketing, flights and accommodation- if we stay part of the time on couches! What will you get? A lovely warm fuzzy feeling that you have supported the arts, and in particular, women in the arts. Plus, if we know you, a big hug and a grateful smile. Even $10, or the price of one daily coffee will help us, every little bit counts. If 500 people donate $10, we're there. Wow, smart.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell other people about Kelfi & Fikel, refer them to our website, www.kelfiandfikel.com, and come and watch our shows, which are always on our website and facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kelfi-Fikel/222199737791580.

story:
Wait, what?

Sex. Love. Comedy. Magic. Murder. Improv. Opera.  La Donna Improvvisata has it all and is bringing it to FringeNYC!

Combining her experience as an opera singer and improviser, Lisa Flanagan joined forces with Maestro Frank Spitznagel, the greatest improvisational musician in NYC, to create a solo improvised show delivering classical archetypes with a modern twist!

“She's a really good example of not only a great singer but a very curious and knowledgeable, well informed performer. She knows just a ton about the history of opera and the history of music. She knows exactly where she's coming from and what she wants it to be." 
 - Louis Kornfeld, Artistic Director of Megawatt, Magnet Theater

Every night a new opera is born on-stage, never to be seen again, composed and performed on the spot based upon the audience's choices. The audience picks a character from a display of operatic archetypes, like the King or Maiden, Witch or Soldier, Servant or Mother, etc. From that character, Lisa and Frank create a new hour-long opera for one-night-only!

Sometimes funny.  Sometimes sad. Always sung.


Brass Tacks 

Putting up a show in NYC is no small undertaking. The incredible staff and brigade of volunteers at FringeNYC makes it possible without even selling a kidney.  And you're probably wondering what your money will do that my kidney won't:

  • Help pay for rehearsals and space rentals leading up to the Fringe
  • Marketing costs.   Good heavens, the marketing, people.
  • Pay performers, venue and tech staff

Why donate to La Donna?

Only a handful of improvised projects are accepted into the New York International Fringe Festival each year and we're absolutely honored to be a part of it.

  • After debuting at the 2013 New York Musical Improv Festival, La Donna is committed to playing on a variety of stages from comedy to classical theater to educational settings
  • La Donna Improvvisata believes that opera is a vital, living form that defies the stodgy, boring stereotypes! 
  • You're not just blindly hurling money at us.*  There are countless perks available for your valuable contributions that range from recognition, museum visits, photography services, tickets and ICE CREAM!

More than Money

Sometimes it's not a good time to contribute but there are other ways you can help La Donna:

  • Follow us on Twitter (@LiSur) and Facebook  
  • Do you know someone who likes opera or improv? Share our campaign and upcoming shows with just one person helps us!

Thank you for your time and consideration!  Hope to see you at the Fringe!



*Unless you want that as a perk.  We can, y'know, talk.

night a new opera is born on-stage, never to be seen again, composed and performed on the spot based upon the audience's choices.
 The audience picks a character from a display of operatic
archetypes, like the King or Maiden, Witch or Soldier, Servant or
Mother, etc.  From that character, Lisa and Frank create a new
hour-long opera for one-night-only!
Sometimes funny.  Sometimes sad. Always sung.   


Brass Tacks  Putting up a show in NYC is no small undertaking. The incredible staff and brigade of volunteers at FringeNYC makes it possible without even selling a kidney.  And you're probably wondering what your money will do that my kidney won't: 
Help pay for rehearsals and space rentals leading up to the Fringe
Marketing costs.   Good heavens, the marketing, people. Pay performers, venue and tech staff 
  Why donate to La Donna?

Only a handful of improvised projects are accepted into the New York International Fringe Festival each year and we're absolutely honored to be a part of it.
 
After debuting at the 2013 New York Musical Improv Festival, La Donna is committed to playing on a variety of stages from comedy to classical theater to educational settings
La Donna Improvvisata believes that opera is a vital, living form that defies the stodgy, boring stereotypes!  You're not just blindly hurling money at us.*  There are countless perks available for your valuable contributions that range from recognition, museum visits, photography services, tickets and ICE CREAM! 
  

More than Money
Sometimes it's not a good time to contribute but there are other ways you can help La Donna:

Follow us on Twitter (@LiSur) and Facebook  
Do you know someone who likes opera or improv? Share our campaign and upcoming shows with just one person helps us!


Thank you for your time and consideration!  Hope to see you at the Fringe!



*Unless you want that as a perk.  We can, y'know, talk.

story:
UPDATE: After 3/7/2020 Unlocked Stretch Goals are no longer available

Hello! My name is Cara Nicole and I am known for my cosplay as AZ Powergirl. I have also been involved in numerous comic book projects such as Lady Death, Vampirella, along with many other homegrown indie projects as a model, artist, writer and editor. This is my first big leap into the fiery world of crowdfunding comics! I have over 30 cosplay covers with other creators and a good handful of art covers, along with numerous crowdfunding campaigns under my utility belt.Back in 2012 I co-created the character of Firebitch with Alfred Trujillo and after deciding enough time had passed, I spent all of 2019 working to bring her to life! Now I am bringing her to you in this irreverent maiden foray into the world of reluctant insta-heroine #firebitch.

Indiegogo campaign will feature the NEW retailer copy SKY BLAZING! This will be auto included to the original Kickstarter campaign VIP and producers <3 It will not be campaign exclusive though this is the first time its being offered. Also scroll down for STAR BLAZING, a NEW holofoil on this campaign <3 Reminder: All backers with a physical reward will receive all met stretch goals from this and the previous campaign until March 6th.  After March 6, 2020,  backers will have the books available but stretch goals will be sent out while supplies last.

NEW!

NEW!

RECENTLY UNLOCKED! (Last two days of old campaign)

 

Insensitive internet model Chastity Chase, basically the last person you'd ever want as a hero, is pulled into a violent intergalactic genocide conflict on the other side of the galaxy. To make matters worse, she must deal with mysterious and dangerous new powers while trying to avoid getting cancelled online! No way home, nowhere to run, and with the impending doom of imminent death or having to return to Earth only to have to get--a day job...Chas must break all the rules. She must go all the way. She must become Firebitch.

As her social media presence dwindles and her online fan base fades, Chastity Chase must choose between taking her next selfie and saving a planet of unknown aliens from destruction by the mighty Meehos . With impending doom inevitable, and her battery running low, Chastity must become the hero she was never meant to be. 

Join us for a sexy adventure through the cosmos to a world of  beauty and splendor that is sure to be disrupted by our saucy social media diva, FIREBITCH!

It is my pleasure to bring you this 28 page full color book created, written and illustrated by me, Cara Nicole and Alfred Trujillo. For this kickoff of my book, I got some really amazing artists contributing art to variant covers, cards, stickers, magnets and more!  Get ready for some sexy cosplay covers as well. You know you want them. You know you need them.

 

COVERS:

Crazy Hawt by Cara Nicole and Alfred Trujillo Photography 

This fiery full body cover is the first cosplay cover for Firebitch. It only seems fitting that we show this character full body surrounded by flames. This costume was hand made by Cara Nicole herself. Cara's experience with cosplay covers makes her a natural choice for this series. Find her on other books like Vampirella, Naughty Faeries Stripper Assassins, Changeling, Patriotika, and more. Cara Nicole currently leads the way when it comes to cosplay covers.

Smolder by Cara Nicole and Alfred Trujillo Photography. This cosplay variant comes in beautiful rainbow holofoil and is sure to shine in any collection. 

Steamy Adventure by Cara Nicole and Alfred Trujillo Photography. 

A sexy scene from the first issue, Chastity Chase washes up. Get this steamy cover and conserve water by showering with Firebitch everyday :)

Baby, One More Time by Cara Nicole and Alfred Trujillo Photography. 

Star Blazing No logos, all holofoil!

 

Bitch'n Holofoil by Alfred Trujillo & Cara Nicole

Alfred Trujillo really saw the light with this BITCH'N digital painting. Cara Nicole added the colors that really make this piece pop. This piece comes in holofoil and will be a fiery addition to any comic book collection. Team Trujillo Has multiple covers and even a tier dedicate dto their work together. Find them on other books as well including Lady Death Universe, Changeling, and more.

 

Through Flames Regular by Alfred Trujillo & Cara Nicole

Another painted piece by Alfred Trujillo with Cara Nicole colors. This modest double sided cover brings you all of the busty jua de vivre that we love about Firebitch while keeping it clean for the kiddos ;)

Through The Flames Naughty STAC'R (Semi-Transparent Animation Cell Reveal) by Alfred Trujillo and Cara Nicole 

This cover is near and dear to my heart. I have been wanting to make this happen for a few years now and decided after much deliberation that this was the piece to make it happen. The outer cover is a clear PVC to discretely hide our heroines lady bits beneath a wall of flames. As you open the outer cover, Chastity's supple breasts become fully exposed for a naughty secret we all can enjoy.

NOTE: STAC'R cover is PVC and folds nicely in a comic book bag; when out of bag it sits slightly open.

Too Hot to Handle Nice  edition - by David Harrigan 

David Harrigan really knows his way around a woman. His experience with Lady Death, Danger Doll, Zombie Tramp and more, making this a wonderful addition to round out your Firebitch  Comic Book Collection. 

Too Hot to Handle  Naughty Battle Damage variant - by David Harrigan:

OH NO! She broke her phone! All proceeds from this tier level will go towards a replacement/upgrade to keep Chastity on top of her insta-game!

School of Hard Knockers by Mike Debalfo & Cara Nicole

Debalfo is a comic collectors dream. His work with Zenescope and Lady Death guarantee a superior art piece that titillates the mind and warms your insides down below. This cover tells a story with the story and is a necessary addition to your Firebitch collection.

 Rock and Roll Get Nervous Pat Benatar Homage - by Anthony Delaney

Anthony is a superstar when it comes to Rock and Roll covers and one of my best friends. I chose him specifically for his passion for combining music and art. 80's music is an integral part of this story and I can see no better album to represent Firebitch than Pat Benetar's Get Nervous. 

#Instagram Post - by Stef Wilson and Kerry Anne

Stef and Kerry are an up and coming dream team setting the comic world on fire with their covers for Naughty Faeries Stripper Assassins while Stef himself is bringing his best pencil game forward with covers for Patriotika, Big Dog Ink, and many many more.

Beach on Fire by Dennis Willman 

Willman is a master when it comes to gorgeous backgrounds and putting people onto art covers. I love this piece and feels that it represents not only Cara but the Roj'R planet. Check out his work with Iron Dead Comics for more!!

 Sore Bottom Blues John Wayne McClintock Homage - by Mike Decarlo and Cara Nicole

I can't thank Mike Decarlo enough for this amazing cover. He is always super busy and an icon in the comic book world. Working on Batman: A Death in the Family, Ghost Rider, The Fantastic Four, Iron Man, and so much more, this homage piece is  a blast from the past in a brand new world.

 Girl's Night Out by Sam Sawyer

Color Me Sexy - This black and white virgin cover was penciled by the fabulous Mike Debalfo! Printed on high quality artist grade bristol board. Have your favorite colorist stay between the lines or  have a night of adult coloring fun. This is a new available tier as well as an available add-on.

Color Me Sassy - This black and white virgin cover was penciled by the Amazing Stef Wilson! Printed on high quality artist grade bristol board. Have your favorite colorist stay between the lines or  have a night of adult coloring fun. This is a new available tier as well as an available add-on.

PRINTS: 

 11x17 Art Print: BYE FELICIA! By Alfred Trujillo And Cara Nicole

 11x17 Cosplay Print Cosplay and Chill by Cara Nicole and Alfred Trujillo Photography

11x17 Cosplay Print Roleplay Cosplay Cara Nicole and Alfred Trujillo Photography

11x17 Cosplay Print Cleanliness Cara Nicole and Alfred Trujillo Photography

11x17 Cosplay Print Godliness Cara Nicole and Alfred Trujillo Photography

OMG!! Over $9000 on the first day!! As a thanks, everyone gets this as a comic book size mini-print in every tier. LOVE YOU! *MWAH!* <3 

4x6 SELFIES by Cara Nicole 

===STRETCH GOALS=== AVAILABLE UNTIL 3/6/2020 If your pledge comes after, your rewards will not include them.

Stretch goals are fun and easy. It works as follows: if the campaign reaches any of these goals, everyone with a physical reward gets a little somethin somethin! Look below to see what you get at each level of current funding on the campaign! You VIPs and above, look for those bottom goals~ Remember, when it comes to stretch goals, you're writing the story, pledge accordingly ;)

UNLOCKED!! $27,832 Topless Mini Print This is one is for the high rollers! When we beat the total for my last Kickstarter, the 2020 Cosplay Calendar, I'm giving my biggest supporters ($30 and over) a little something extra as a thank you <3 If you overpledged from a lower tier, this still applies to you ;)

This will be optional so you will need to opt into it in the survey, just like last time.

UNLOCKED! 450 Backer Goal - Sky Blazing Mini Print

UNLOCKED! 30,000 PVC Double sided Cosplay/Art Badge This is a great addition to any convention attendance ;)

UNLOCKED!! $32500 Valentine Card Back The back of the valentines card gets a glam treatment! 

UNLOCKED!! $35,000 - Lanyard

 

UNLOCKED $40,000 - Four Additional Pages The book goes to 32 pages with some extra story and some extra cosplay!

UNLOCKED: 600 Backers - Mystery Mini Print

LOCKED:  $45,000 - Cosplay Digital Wallpaper

LOCKED: $50,000 - Risque Digital Wallpaper

 

===STRETCH EXPANSION GOALS=== 

UPDATED 2/5

These covers are limited to 150 each. They are similar to stretch goals as they unlock throughout the campaign based upon its success, but differ as they are not automatically added to all rewards. ALL Producer tiers will contain these exclusive covers even if the goals are not reached. All other backers can change their tier levels to get these covers or add them on after the campaign ends.

UNLOCKED $30,000 - Spider Man 300 Swipe becomes available as limited reward tier and add on after the campaign ends.  Auto-included to VIP, Executive Producer and Associate Producer Tiers when unlocked.

ADD $20 to your current pledge and send me a message to add the 300 swipe!

PARTIALLY UNLOCKED $30,000 - Topless Cosplay Cover UNCOVERED Auto-included to VIP, Executive Producer and Associate Producer Tiers

$50,000 - Topless Cosplay Cover UNCOVERED this becomes available as a $60 Add On. 

Lend a hand and get #firebitch flying off the ground! Pledge to this campaign and light my fire!!

Some product pics!

story:
Ends Meet

A tragic story of courageous heroes, shameless villains, and everything in between. Follow the comedic misadventures of the Soto family, Azazel, Adam, and Alesana. Endure the struggles Daggers will face on her path to self discovery. Tolerate what you can of Hunter's inferno crew and the rest of their superpowered world.

(Ends meet is an action-packed comedy/drama for fans of The Boys, Dragonball, and Rick & Morty)

 

Chapter 0

Owen faces an old friend with a new look as he travels through Eden. The two battle it out as the city gets destroyed and certain forces are disturbed. A 25 page prologue to an epic series to kick off the comix coven universe.

Ends Meet starts here!

This project has been in the works for years and I've finally gathered enough stories, characters, and most of all time to really sit down and give you all an awesome new take on the classic superhero genre. My goal is to create a realistic take on the dynamics of a world filled with people that have some special ability. Heroes organizations are spread thin as civilization slowly falls into darkness.

 

PERKS

Support Scout - $5 

  • Ends Meet 0 PDF
  • Special thanks on back page (small)

Peace Scout - $10

  • Ends Meet 0 physical copy & PDF
  • Hunter sticker
  • Special thanks on back page (small)

Assault Scout - $25

  • Ends Meet 0 Nagasusumi exclusive variant, regular physical cover, and PDF.
  • Hunter sticker
  • Special thanks on back page (medium) 

Alpha Scout - $50 (Limited to 5)

  • Be drawn into the next chapter 
  • Ends Meet 0 physical copy & PDF
  • Hunter Sticker 
  • Special thanks on back page (medium)

Omega Scout - $70 (Limited to 10)

  • Be drawn into the next chapter 
  • Ends Meet 0 Nagasusumi exclusive variant, regular physical cover, and PDF.
  • Hunter sticker & Dagger sticker
  • Special thanks on back page (medium) ​

Titan3 - $100 (Limited to 3)

  • Ends Meet character sketch
  • Exclusive Ends Meet print
  • Be drawn into the next chapter 
  • Ends Meet 0 Nagasusumi exclusive variant, regular physical cover, and PDF.
  • Hunter sticker & Dagger sticker

Special thanks on back page (Large) 
​

Titan2 - $150 (Limited to 2)

  • Personal Hero Corp ID (FUTURE PERKS TBA)
  • Your last name on the front cover
  • Ends Meet character sketch
  • Exclusive Ends Meet print
  • Be drawn into the next chapter 
  • Ends Meet 0 Nagasusumi exclusive variant, regular physical cover, and PDF.
  • Hunter sticker & Dagger sticker
  • Special thanks on back page (Large) 

Titan1 - $200 (Limited to 1)

  • First look into the completed storyboard for the next chapter!!
  • Double the copies of each cover, stickers, and sketches!!
  • Personal Hero Corp ID (FUTURE PERKS TBA)
  • Your last name on the front cover
  • x2 Ends Meet character sketch
  • Exclusive Ends Meet print
  • Be drawn into the next chapter 
  • x2 Ends Meet 0 Nagasusumi exclusive variant, x2 regular physical cover, and PDF.
  • x2 Hunter sticker & Dagger sticker
  • Special thanks on back page (Large) 

What will your support will help us achieve?

Your support will allow us to purchase the best quality copies and merch available including shipping supplies to guarantee your merch will arrive safely. Any amount will help us get closer to our overall goal to bring in a new era of creativity and visual arts. If this campaign does not manage to reach its goal, I will still find a way to get it out for you guys.

We aim to print by the end of December and ship out mid February! With the COVID-19 pandemic, this can introduce unpredictable issues or delays. We will ensure transparency and update our backers should any problems arise.

 

Stretch Goals

  • $500 - Daggers sticker for Peace Scouts and up.
  • $1k - Daggers Discovery print for Assault Scouts and up.
  • $1.5k - Metallic S-337 sticker for Peace Scouts and up.
  • $2k - Azazel Enamel pins

 

Thank you so much!

 

-Marquez

 

Cant donate?

We understand that some of you are not able to support this new comic book by contributing money. That's OK! One of the most important ways you can support this project is by sharing this campaign with your friends and other passionate comic book fans! Show your support by sharing on Twitter, Instagram, Reddit, Facebook, or any other social media platforms that can help us get the word out!!

x2 Hunter sticker & Dagger sticker
Special thanks on back page (Large) 
What will your support will help us achieve?Your support will allow us to purchase the best quality copies and merch available including shipping supplies to guarantee your merch will arrive safely. Any amount will help us get closer to our overall goal to bring in a new era of creativity and visual arts. If this campaign does not manage to reach its goal, I will still find a way to get it out for you guys.We aim to print by the end of December and ship out mid February! With the COVID-19 pandemic, this can introduce unpredictable issues or delays. We will ensure transparency and update our backers should any problems arise. Stretch Goals

$500 - Daggers sticker for Peace Scouts and up.

$1k - Daggers Discovery print for Assault Scouts and up.

$1.5k - Metallic S-337 sticker for Peace Scouts and up.

$2k - Azazel Enamel pins
 Thank you so much! -Marquez Cant donate?We understand that some of you are not able to support this new comic book by contributing money. That's OK! One of the most important ways you can support this project is by sharing this campaign with your friends and other passionate comic book fans! Show your support by sharing on Twitter, Instagram, Reddit, Facebook, or any other social media platforms that can help us get the word out!!

story:
“There is a lot to like here” – Dwayne McDuffie (founder of Milestone Media and legendary comic book and animation writer)

“One of the very best online comics” – Ren Hayes (Genxorcist, Cain and various other webcomics)

A dark city in need of a hero…

…a young man with the power to be that hero!

Stealth is a new hero for a new millennium, a throwback to the days when every kid had a favorite superhero but with the right flavor to appeal to a new generation of readers! Published online as a webcomic since 2001, this funding project aims to expand the reach of the character through a small trading card set and an original graphic novel.

Written by 2012 Glyph Comics Award nominee Robert Jeffrey, the Stealth graphic novel will present the full official Stealth origin story and will be a treat for both old comic fans as well as new ones!

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise at least $5000 to cover artist fees for the trading card set, payment for the graphic novel's creative team, basic printing costs for both projects and other related supplies. Any additional funds raised will go towards additional printings. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute any money, the best way you can help out is by spreading the word about this campaign. Tweet about it, post about it on Facebook, mention it to your comic loving friends or at the local comic shop. Every little bit helps!

story:
REPLICATOR is 56 pages over two glorious full-colour issues where Human experimentation, super-soldiers, mutants, and mechanical robots collide in a disease-ravaged England. 

When a virus kills millions one scientist who is on the verge of the cure goes missing, forcing her husband to ask How far is he willing to go to save her? What is he prepared to do and What is he willing to become?

 SHIPPING NOW!

ALL BACKERS WILL RECEIVE THE FOLLOWING STRETCH GOALS!

 

  • WAX SEALED PACKAGING
  • 2 A5 COVER MINI PRINTS
  • GHOST COLOUR PRINT
  • GOLIATH COLOUR PRINT
  • ROB WILLIS REPLICATOR 3 COVER PRINT
  • MYSTERY PRINT

 

Replicator 1 - Limited Edition Virgin Cover (No Text)

 

Replicator 1.

Written by Robert Arnold, Art by Armin Ozdic, Colours by Ross. A Campbell, Letters by Marshall Dillon.

Replicator 2.

Written by Robert Arnold, Art by Aaron Alfeche, Colours by DC Alonso, Letters by Marshall Dillon.

Risks & Challenges

This will be the second Indiegogo I have run, The first campaign was successfully funded and shipped to all backers.

The only risk is delays, however, they will be minimal as all the artwork is done, we only need to do the letters and print.

 SHIPPING NOW!

WAX SEALED PACKAGING
2 A5 COVER MINI PRINTS
GHOST COLOUR PRINT
GOLIATH COLOUR PRINT
ROB WILLIS REPLICATOR 3 COVER PRINT
MYSTERY PRINT

 







Replicator 1 - Limited Edition Virgin Cover (No Text)

Replicator 2.
Written by Robert Arnold, Art by Aaron Alfeche, Colours by DC Alonso, Letters by Marshall Dillon.

This will be the second Indiegogo I have run, The first campaign was successfully funded and shipped to all backers.
The only risk is delays, however, they will be minimal as all the artwork is done, we only need to do the letters and print.

story:
Near the French/German border, the dawn of WW1 brings horrors and heartache that stretch far across the landscape...

 

Most folks are trying to just make sense of it all, find meaning if that's even possible...

 

Some find it for themselves...

...a rare few craft it for others...

 

EUDAIMONIA #2 continues the WW1 saga about soldiers on the frontlines confronting the horrors of mechanized warfare and struggling to pull meaning from the jaws of madness, as well as those at home watching the world they knew disintegrate.

EUDAIMONIA is a war/slice of life graphic miniseries and is highly recommended for fans of All Quiet on the Western Front, the Forbidden Zone, and the Stranger, as well as those who enjoy tales exploring history, philosophy, & war.

 

 

Characters

The Old Man Once a Boy - The American soldier, plucked up and shipped out at just 15. Thrown into the trenches where he is wildly out of his depth in the madness of the fight. He's the protagonist of EUDAIMONIA #1, so his story has already been told, his tale of anguish and personal redemption laid to rest, or has it? There is more to what you saw than you think.

 

The Woman Who Plays the Cello - We have seen her play and the effect her song has on the hearts of men fresh from battle, but who is she? Where did her song come from? From what life could something so hauntingly sublime emerge?

 

The Son Not So Prodigal - A fresh-faced German soldier who, like his American counterpart, was simply not ready for the chattering guns and the falling of brothers. We have already seen his end in EUDAIMONIA #1, but his beginning will change everything.

Mary & the Priest - The eccentric librarian and the wise old priest who once walked hand in hand towards bliss until fate drove them from each other's arms. The years have made them diametrically opposed forces, just blocks apart, until the song of war song brings them back together.

 

EUDAIMONIA is not politicial, nor is it about the lenses of identity which divide us. It is about people struggling to find purpose and meaning in the face of unimaginable horrors. The quest which rests inside all like an ember nestled in the belly of man where it slowly braises us from the inside out.

EUDAIMONIA is a story told using breathtaking art and composed entirely in metered verse. This is a deliberate homage to writing styles popular among the soldiers of WW1 who struggled to understand themselves amidst the unfathomable misery that surrounded them. It is also done as a nod to classical stories of Western tradition, which often grappled with the grand philosophical questions of mankind.

story:
One Wacky Idea! 

So was playing Worms Armageddon with my brothers, and couple of shows were awfully popular at the time: Attack on Titan (which is still awesome), and The Walking Dead (I sure do love that first season). And while my wormy minion, in his dapper hat grappled from his ninja rope, and flung dynamite at his enemies, I though, "What if they fought giant zombies?"

Or you know, regular sized zombies, but giant to them on account of their being small.

Years Later, on a very Pooch Screwing Job...

It was 2019, and I was working in the Oil Field... but not hard working. The nature of my profession was to sit around in a truck, waiting. I had many a 12 hour shift with nothing to do but watch Netflix... I did I? 

With my art supplies I could get a lot of drawing done, and drawing done I DID!

Then My Favorite Beer Turned Into a Plague!

I'd been up north so long, I forgot what the place I was renting looked like! And I thought, boy if work slows down, I need to fly somewhere and see more of this world. Sure enough, it slowed down-but sure not enough! I came back to a world that wouldn't let me go anywhere! Even the bars shut down. Welp. I can entertain myself while isolated in a truck, so it's business as usual. The comic was already drawn up, and just needed a cover and some letters. I live-streamed the cover, made some internet friends, did the lettering myself too and got it printed. How's my spelling at 2AM? Only the ones who buy the FIRST EDITION will find out! 

It's just the beginning...

This is what I've always wanted to do, and I'd like to make it my day job. If I can entertain ya'll with a short and sweet 8 pager, then maybe I can make a 24 page cat-spanker like those big super hero publishers do, or a 50 page manga book, like, oh, I don't know... the one I'm making for Shonen Jump's International Competition! 

PLUG! Watch the progress here:

  • https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCm5fzJ6hxSXpMb...
  • twitch.tv/thegoldenquill

And like I say in the video, I do plan on giving a bunch of these comics away free at conventions, but they'll only be free AT the conventions (and expos and trade shows, etc.), because they those things will need all the help they can get after this age of house-mouseyness!

Thank you for your support, and I'll see you in my streams!

story:
My name is Patrick Shelly and I am the creator of Hillbilly Chicken. Hillbilly Chicken is a cartoon / comic strip about Booper & Radar that live in a farm in Landis, Pennsylvania.

I currently own a small town restaurant in a seasonal area. The economy has been tough on our business. I have decided to pursue this dream with the hope of turning into a cartoon that can be sold to a network one day so the world could enjoy.

I am the copyright owner. Hillbilly Chicken is registered with The Library of Congress.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise funds to take Hillbilly Chicken to the next level. 

We have developed over 30 comic strips and different artwork  to pitch to different companies. We want to license Hillbilly Chicken to a variety of companies. 

We also have a website www.hillbillychicken.com and a Facebook page.

Currently we have over 4000 likes on Facebook from 200 a year ago. I write and rough draw all the layouts with an assistant that turns it into the final format.

To grow the popularity of Booper we want to have a mascot uniform made up with Bib overalls, the hankie , and straw hat. This cost on average about $4,000. With the plans to take it to Country fairs, ballparks and any public event booked. With this we will set up a stand to have pictures taken and sell T-shirts. We feel this will only grow more people to like our Facebook page also driving more traffic to our website.

We are giving away great perks for your donation such as T-shirts, drawings and you could even book Booper (mascot) for your private event.

Running the website and creating content cost money. Now that we have enough content to introduce more to the public and create shirts we need to advertise online and promote Hillbilly Chicken. Also we want to create some short animated You Tube videos to get more impact.



Animation is a 50 billion dollar a year business.

Spongebob sold over 8 billion dollars in merchandise in 12 years.

There is always a need for good family content. Also as the audience never ends as kids are born each year. 

Like to put a program together for schools about anti bullying. Booper is different just like you and me but we need to show our kids we love one another , no matter how different.


Other Ways You Can Help


Just added for my local customers. Get a $27.00 Gift Certificate to Shelly's Family Restaurant for only $20.00. Savings of 26% . Good for 4 months .Ships within two days. 

Limited to 100.

Even if you can only give $5.00 it would be greatly appreciated. Having some say in what you kids watch or read is rewarding. If you could share our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/HillbillyChicken?ref=hl. More traffic the better.

Some Shirts planned as picture ! 

Color Shirts - Got to Love Farming.

Acceptance - White T- shirt 

Donate $15.00 and get 10 Christmas Cards.

We will have 2 new designs for 2014 Christmas. This was artwork we had done for 2013.


Share this page with your friends. If you are a company and would like to license or chat about future plans please email me at chickenradar@aol.com. 

Thank you for your time. 

P.Shelly
