story:
"...I think these stories have more in common with the kind of dark whimsical books for kids they don’t make anymore. Roland Dahl (Charlie and the Chocolate factory, The Witches and James and the Giant Peach) comes to mind..."  

-Comicvine.com-Review of Princess Lucinda issue 0 

"We all know the world of Disney Princesses….sunshine, rainbows, unicorns and all that crap. Now, imagine a world that turns that on its head – the very antithesis of the Disney Princesses…and you’ve found Princess Lucinda..." 

Comicosity.com

 

Snow White, Sleeping Beauty, The Little Mermaid, Rapunzel…I’m sure you recognize those Princesses , you know their stories and  you know how those stories end, or at least how they ended according to their modern retelling. They lived happily ever after or something like that. 

Our Princess however isn’t that kind of Princess and her stories are not those kind of story.  The Princess Lucinda short film tells the story of our precocious, bratty and magical princess as she visits a park and runs into a little girl in need of her special kind of help. But our Princess isn't the helpful sort, so what happens next is wicked good fun and  a wicked good short film.

Our film’s screenplay is written by Malcolm Harris, an award winning graphic novelist  and the writer of the Princess Lucinda graphic novel.  Malcolm will  also direct the project and will bring the same style and uniqueness of the book to the screen as only someone who understands the world and character on such a personal level can. 

The film itself will be shot in Dallas ,Texas and will do its best to support the local and growing film industry by using the best production and post-production crew that city has to offer.   

Once done, the film will not only be shown at various fandom conventions, but  at film festivals.  Our goal is not only to entertain and bring a unique character to a wider audience,  but to inspire  other independent comic company like Princess Lucinda’s Channel M Publishing,  to do the same and bring their characters to life on film and show the world that there is more too graphic novels and films based on them than testosterone driven costumed superheroes like those found in the Avengers and Dark Knight. 

So why do we need your help?  Simply put, Princess Lucinda is the story of a magical Princess, with the emphasis being, “magic”.  Funds gained via this crowdfunding will go towards Production and post production.  We want a movie that is more than just a glorified “Fan Film”, we wants something that  will look just as good as the other “comic book films.”. 

 

 
To make that happen we’ve found a great actress to play Princess Lucinda.  We’ve gotten award winning camera people and production folk ready to go once we have the finances to get them all together and get this film moving towards its summer 2013 premier.  

 To put it plainly you’ll be helping out with:

  • The providing a professional film crew and look to the film
  • Effects and video post production
  • Local permits
  • Bringing talent from across the country to Texas to film.
  • Costumes by Firefly path
  • And if we go over the budget with pledges  the funds will go towards improving the production. Not a dime will be wasted as we do our very best to produce the very best. 

 After talking to all involved we've come to the current minimum budget, thanks to many of the people involved taking on this project as a labor of love.

Most films have a separate promotion budget.  We don’t have that.That means it’s really up to you and existing Channel M websites, Princess Lucinda graphic novel fans and social-networking pages to help get the word out.

 So please,  tell your family and friends, tweet about us , Hand out our special "Obey the Princess Flyers" and show the world the most valuable resource for a project like this are people who care about and who are willing to take a few minutes out of their day to help promote it.

Also, please  take the time to subscribe to us  on Facebook and  join us onTwitter  Those are the best way to not only keep updated on this project but to a great way to ask questions about it.   And if you have questions not covered there or you want to help or have ideas drop us a line at   princesslucinda.movie@channelmlive.com

For those that pledge, we're offering some great insensitive ranging from the digital versions of the production, graphic novels and parts in the film.   Also available will be a DVD copy of the film (If we get extra funds that will change into a Blu-Ray)  that includes.

  • The Film
  • Behind the scene featurettes.
  • Digital copies of the comics.
  • Gallery. And more.

All autographed by Princess Lucinda herself. 

STRAIGHT TALK

The film Industry is full of projects plagued by rewrites, set backs and budget issues.

We are well aware of that and our talented staff has the background and experience to see this project through with minimal problems. Malcolm Harris our writer and director has produced and directed two films and created and optioned three scripts.

Our experience in the comic book industry has made us adaptive and we have on our side talented and experience filmmakers to help us through any crisis.

Yes, problems may occur, but if they do will send you updates explaining what’s going on. We offer full disclosure so if you want a detail budget and you pledge we will give it too you, if you have questions, we will answer them.

All we ask is your help and trust.

Most films have a separate promotion budget.  We don’t have that.That means it’s really up to you and existing Channel M websites, Princess Lucinda graphic novel fans and social-networking pages to help get the word out.
 So please,  tell your family and friends, tweet about us , Hand out our special "Obey the Princess Flyers" and show the world the most valuable resource for a project like this are people who care about and who are willing to take a few minutes out of their day to help promote it.
Also, please  take the time to subscribe to us  on Facebook and  join us onTwitter  Those are the best way to not only keep updated on this project but to a great way to ask questions about it.   And if you have questions not covered there or you want to help or have ideas drop us a line at   princesslucinda.movie@channelmlive.com

For those that pledge, we're offering some great insensitive ranging from the digital versions of the production, graphic novels and parts in the film.   Also available will be a DVD copy of the film (If we get extra funds that will change into a Blu-Ray)  that includes.


The Film
Behind the scene featurettes.
Digital copies of the comics.
Gallery. And more.

All autographed by Princess Lucinda herself. 

STRAIGHT TALK
The film Industry is full of projects plagued by rewrites, set backs and budget issues.
We are well aware of that and our talented staff has the background and experience to see this project through with minimal problems. Malcolm Harris our writer and director has produced and directed two films and created and optioned three scripts.
Our experience in the comic book industry has made us adaptive and we have on our side talented and experience filmmakers to help us through any crisis.
Yes, problems may occur, but if they do will send you updates explaining what’s going on. We offer full disclosure so if you want a detail budget and you pledge we will give it too you, if you have questions, we will answer them.
All we ask is your help and trust.

story:
Lylith & Mara: Sisters of the Dark is now available Only on IndieGoGo!

“LYLITH & MARA” are twin sisters and the original Vampire and Succubus from who all other vampire races were evolved from. Born and raised in “The Dark”, their destiny seemed clear cut until on the age of their “becoming” when something within them stirs. A conflict between power and desires struggles with a morality of a soul they didn’t realized existed.

The Creative Team: Written by Jason Dube with Artwork & Colors by Frederick Allison Jr.  with Cover Art by Summer Dale

This is a 32-page , 1-shot storyline about the origins of the Vampire & Succubus sisters from our "Shadow Hunters" comic book series. This is also a more "Mature Readers" comic as we delve deep into the dark and forbidden underworld. A great read for fans of horror and the supernatural. Includes bonus concept art pages, and Cover creation processes.

This new offering to you.

After the success of our last campaign we wanted to add a few more items this round to have something for everyone. Let's take a look at the different cover variants available to you.

NOEL SERRATO Variant Covers!

Tame Variant

Nude Variant and a (Limited Edition) Virgin Nude  Variant

Summer Dale's Mother's Day Variant (Virgin) Cover Available as ADD-ON at check out.

2nd Chance to get GENISIS #1

With so many requests to get a copy of Genisis #1 after the campaign ended, we decided to offer a 2nd Chance Edition for this campaign only! If you didn't get it last time, now's your chance. With a new variant "Cold Virgin" cover (All titles and logos removed from cover) featuring Summer Dale's artwork.

 

Shadow Hunters Comic Book Tie-In

Offered with this campaign only is the tie-in comic book "Shadow Hunters". This 28 page comic book offering will feature cover art by Benny Jordan as well as some interior art pages. You don't necessarily need this comic book to understand "Lylith & Mara", but its fun to see how the 2 books tie-in together. (**This book is filled with sexy monster girls. Purchase at your own risk). A additional bonus gift with this book is a sexy "Jessika" mini print by Noel Serrato.

Cover Art:

Noel Serrato's Original Cover Artwork on 8.33" x 11.5" was done in Pencil, Inks, Markers and Acrylic paint.
This Lylith original piece was hand drawn on very thick acid free cardstock. It is the original cover art for the "Blood Quicher" Add On Cover variant.

 

ORIGINAL ARTWORK By Noel Serrato:

This Original Artwork featuring Mara on 8.33" x 11.5" was done in Pencil, Inks, Markers and Acrylic paint by Noel Serrato. This original piece was hand drawn on very thick acid free cardstock.

 

Original Artwork drawn during "Midday This Afternoon With Tank Ferret" show. 

 

Jason Dube's Original Cover art

 

Noel Serrato's Original Premlim Cover Art

 

Noel Serrato's Original Inks to Cover Art

 

The Goal

The goal with this campaign is to provide you with fun and entertaining high quality comics. We need enough for the printing, distribution, and fees to bring these comic books to life and in your hands. Noel Serrato and myself will be packing and shipping the comic books with Gemini Comic Flash Mailers. (The choosen way to get comic books safely to you.)

ADD ON Extras!

When you check out with your comic book pledge you will be given some cool Add Ons to apply to your comics. Watch for these extras to make your purchase a one of a kind.

 

STRETCH GOALS:

WE HIT $1000, NOW All Physical Pledge Perks will get the Lylith & Mara Backboard Print. (Image by Jason Dube) included in their package.

WE HIT $2000, NOW All Physical Pledge Perks will get this smiling Lylith head Sticker. (Image by Summer Dale) included in their package.

WE HIT $2500, NOW A very special Add-On "Blood Quincher" Variant cover edition is unlocked! (Cover Art by Noel Serrato). 

WE HIT $3000, NOW All Physical Pledge Perks will get this cute chibi HADES Bookmark with a quote from her from the comic. (Image by Bex Kurasai) included in their package.

If we hit $4000, All Physical Pledge Perks will get this 16-page Comic Book Ashcan of Lylith & Mara's first appearance. (Written & Drawn by Jason Dube) included in their package. (Also A Digital Copy will be sent to Everyone including Digital Pledgers)

Risks & Challenges

The comic books are all completed. Everything is done, we just need to get it to the printers and ship it to you. Of course this is life and I suppose anything can happen, but I really don't foresee any kind of delay in getting these into your hands.

 

Please Help Us Spread the Word Please!

We would appreciate any help you can provide by Sharing this page to your friends and family by just hitting the Indiegogo share buttons at the top!

Thank you for taking the time to look things over here.

Jason Dube

Follow Jason Dube on his YOUTUBE Channel:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCznTnvuBBzPttS3630BsJNg

story:
Short Summary

In a nutshell, PunchLine is like Jessica Jones training Buffy Summers.

PunchLine starts when Mel, a costumed hero, is forced into retirement and to pass her responsibilities along to a young girl named Jessie. To add insult to injury, Mel is ordered to stick around to train her replacement. During training, Jessie starts to question Mel's drive and instincts.

PunchLine has been shopped to a few publishers, but we have never found a deal that was just right. We're still talking to publishers, and in the mean time, we'd like to deliver our little comic to the people that don't read comics online or on their phone.

Industry veteran Bill Williams has written for DC Comics, IDW and more. More recently, he inked a chapter of the Batman '66 Meets Wonder Woman '77 comic.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for comic book fans.

We are shipping signed hard covers and signed trade paperback editions of the first long story arc, Blood Sisters. That story runs 124 pages. This edition will also have a cover gallery and a few pages of sketch book material for a page count of 140+.

We're also shipping out T-shirts.

UPDATE- Matthew has created a couple of PUNCHLINE wallpapers thanks to contributor requests. They're on his Deviant Art page. You can find them HERE (#1) and HERE (#2). While you're there, poke around and get a look at the rest of his awesome art. 

The Impact

Matthew Weldon (artist) and Bill Williams (writer) are long time comic book creators. This is our first project together.

Risks & Challenges

We are past the half-way point on the story. Of the 124 pages scripted, only 30 remain to be penciled and inked.

We are committed to doing a print run of the book. Any dollars we can't crowdsource will come right from us. While we can buck it ourselves, we'd rather deliver the comics to the fans on a direct basis.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the cash to buy a book, there are ways you can help us fund our project. Sharing via social media is free and appreciated.

It won't hurt our feelings a bit if you go check out the comics on a digital distribution site like comiXology or Drive Thru Comics.

And Finally For Our Fans Outside of the US...

We have not decided on a printer yet, so we don't have the weight of the books calculated. It would be hard for us to guess the costs of air mail accurately without that data. You can find me on twitter @Bill_Williams. We'll overprint a few books (and T-Shirts) and make sure to take care of you after the campaign concludes.

story:
The Jawbreakers are a group of ex-superheroes turned mercenaries. After burning bridges with the CIA while operating in the Middle East and losing their lucrative security contracts in Europe, they find themselves in Africa working as monster hunters. 

 

 

LOST SOULS (main story)

Written by Richard C. Meyer (IRON SIGHTS) 

Drawn by Jon Malin (GRAVEYARD SHIFT, CABLE, NEW WARRIORS, THUNDERBOLTS)

Colored by Brett Smith (GI.JOE, WOLVERINE, BATMAN, JUSTICE LEAGUE, HARLEY QUINN)

 

The graphic novel also includes GØD-K1NG Book One and GØD-K1NG Book Two as well as an Art Gallery.

 

THIS IS THE LAST CHANCE TO GET THIS VERSION OF THE BOOK!

story:
Drakaina's story and why she needs your help today

Drakaina was the first of her kind in France, if not Europe ..

A Model raised to the rank of Modern Muse, inspiring artists, painters, writers and poets around the world since 2001 as well as influencing a whole new generation of models attracted by the potential of this ancestral form of artistic expression.

Today Drakaina lives in Canada, where she continues her modeling career.(you can view Drakaina's work on her official website http://drakaina.com )

In 2008 she released her first art book in Europe “Drakaina Fantasy of Desire” published by Spootnik Editions, followed in 2009 by the worldwide release of a second book “Drakaina, a Fantasy Art Muse,” published by SQP Editions. Late 2010, she released her first comic book "Drakaina Untamed", which sold out at Hal-con, Eastern Canada's largest  Fantasy and Science Fiction convention as well as a third art book " Drakaina Masters".

Just a little over a month ago she attended San Diego comic con, where she celebrated her 10 years career anniversary,  and has now been invited to appear as one of 2011 Montreal Comic con's guests, joining the likes of Stan Lee, James Marsters and many more.


Problem is the travel costs of several conventions back to back can get a little out of hand and Drakaina needs your help to make it happen!! It gets even more expensive when you have a camera crew traveling along (a TV documentary is currently being filmed, following Drakaina in her conventions adventures).


The TV Documentary

In her 10  years career, Drakaina has always been keen on sharing her experiences as a living Muse with her fans, through books and on her website, when she was meeting them at conventions or simply by chatting with them on her social media pages. Yet a part of the puzzle was missing: it's different to hear about a convention or a modeling experience  and  living it, with the work and stress it involves as well as the  behind the scenes work, the joys, the doubts, the frustrations it takes to actually get to that point, the final result that the fans get to see. So when the opportunity of making a TV documentary based on her Journey, Drakaina didn't think twice and dove into it. What better way for Drakaina to share the experience with her fans than to take them with her on the -sometimes bumpy- road to success? A production company jumped on board and gave her a HD camera for her to capture her appearance at the San Diego comic con on film. But it's hard to both film yourself and what's going on around you when you are on your own, both actor and film maker (the angles, the lights etc ... not necessarily the best for what she is trying to achieve). Now the opportunity to get more convention footage arises and this time Drakaina would like to take a small 2 men camera crew with her to help her out and get a better quality footage. Problem is the convention is in 17 days, which doesn't leave her lots of time to raise money for the trip... Yet this is a very good opportunity to get  an even better look at what really goes on in a comic book convention..


What We Need & What You Get

*Update: we got most of the funding on our own, now we only need $500 to make it happen!!*

The flight from Halifax to Montreal and back ($750) , and accommodations for the convention ($750) ) is a bit of a strain on a freelancer Muse's budget. The whole endeavor is going to run us a total of a little over $1,500, including the shipping and handling of the perks


This is why we've decided to turn to IndiGoGo (and you guys!) in hopes of raising the funds to keep this documentary project going. In return for your support Drakaina will reward you with  perks, such as shout-outs in the TV documentary, prints,calendars and for the biggest donors a dinner date with the Muse herself (please see perks on right side of the screen for more details ;)) All perks will be shipped within 2 weeks after the end of the campaign.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you prefer not to donate or simply you can still help us reach our goal by sharing this page with as many people as possible!! The share buttons on the website will make it an easy task ;) Thanks for your undying support!! Xoxs Drakaina

story:
Here's the Deal-i-o...

  • UPDATE:  Quinn has officially been confirmed by Dragon Con as an 'assistant' (under the age of 18) Panelist!  How cool is that!  He will be sitting alonside Dave Lee and Matt Silva (Face Off on SYFY channel) for the Panel '

    Gear Goggles and Brass: Basic Building '    But we need your help to get there!  Consider this just like a marching band member who needs to get to Disneyland for the Thanksgiving Parade!  This is our superbowl!  Anything and everything is so appreciated!

  • All year, Quinn has been trying to earn money to go to Dragon Con
  • Quinn is typical of a lot of kids at his age, and has a history of being bullied, fairly badly, which has caused us to begin to homeschool him this past year.
  • One of Quinn's passions is cosplay.  As his mom, i can tell you that i have never EVER seen him interact with people in the way that he does at Cons.  He is a different child, and when we can afford it, we like to see him be able to go to Cons and enjoy these types of experiences.  His smile, the way he speaks to people, and how unafraid he is to jump right in and pose for photos...it does not happen anywhere else like at a Con.
  • We'd like to take Quinn to Dragon Con this year, but funds are tight and i'm afraid, with a recent 'donated ticket' snafu, that we will not be able to go. He's earned $100 of his own money this year, but it's just not enough, of course, for the ticket for either of us (since i need to chaperone) or a hotel room, or gas, or food, etc.  

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We will need a minimum of $500 to go for three days, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.  This includes travel on thursday and Friday.  I do have some money saved up for this trip, so $500 will cover what is left, as far as tickets and hotel.
  • Since I (the mom) am a photographer, I will be creating custom art and ordering postcards, using Quinn's cosplays as the subject.  So his Assassin's Creed, his Half Life, and his (new) StarLord Cosplays will be featured, and donations will receive one or more of them, signed on the back by Quinn!  I will also be creating props for higher donations, as well as some posters.
  • All funds will go towards going to the Con.  Even if we don't meet our goal, i'm prepared to take money out of our 401k to fund the rest.  Still, if i don't have to do this, it would be peaches!
  • We will adding a video to this page with each $100, of Quinn talking about his costumes and showing you different things he's learning as we go along!  SO FUN!

The Impact

As the mother of an exceptional child, i can tell you that the pain that comes from your child not exactly 'fitting in' is excruciating!

  • Quinn is learning, through his experiences at these conventions, how to socialize and interact with all kinds of people.  The self esteem it gives him to walk through a Con in costume and pose with both adults and kids alike makes him feel like a rock star.
  • Quinn spends a lot of time helping with costumes, from cutting out Pepakura patterns to learning skillsl like soldering, Resin Casting, and working with Worbla.  Getting him away from the video games and letting him work with his hands has also been a huge form of therapy for him.
  • We are hoping to begin a Vlog this year, so that Quinn can begin to share his experiences with other kids who are similarly inclined.  I really believe that giving a child the tools they need to thrive and move forward is essential.

Risks & Challenges

We have 3 weeks to raise enough to get to the Con.  It is short notice, and we are determined, but we understand if you cannot help.  It is what it is.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you cannot donate does not mean you cannot help!  

  • Please share our link, so that your friends and their friends can at least know about Quinn and his campaign!
  • Drop us a line of encouragement, let Quinn know that you are rooting for him to make it to Dragon Con.  It will mean the world to him!

And that's all there is to it.

Here's the Deal-i-o... 
UPDATE:  Quinn has officially been confirmed by Dragon Con as an 'assistant' (under the age of 18) Panelist!  How cool is that!  He will be sitting alonside Dave Lee and Matt Silva (Face Off on SYFY channel) for the Panel '
Gear Goggles and Brass: Basic Building '    But we need your help to get there!  Consider this just like a marching band member who needs to get to Disneyland for the Thanksgiving Parade!  This is our superbowl!  Anything and everything is so appreciated!

All year, Quinn has been trying to earn money to go to Dragon Con Quinn is typical of a lot of kids at his age, and has a history of being bullied, fairly badly, which has caused us to begin to homeschool him this past year. One of Quinn's passions is cosplay.  As his mom, i can tell you that i have never EVER seen him interact with people in the way that he does at Cons.  He is a different child, and when we can afford it, we like to see him be able to go to Cons and enjoy these types of experiences.  His smile, the way he speaks to people, and how unafraid he is to jump right in and pose for photos...it does not happen anywhere else like at a Con.
We'd like to take Quinn to Dragon Con this year, but funds are tight and i'm afraid, with a recent 'donated ticket' snafu, that we will not be able to go. He's earned $100 of his own money this year, but it's just not enough, of course, for the ticket for either of us (since i need to chaperone) or a hotel room, or gas, or food, etc.   
What We Need & What You Get
 Break it down for folks in more detail: 
We will need a minimum of $500 to go for three days, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.  This includes travel on thursday and Friday.  I do have some money saved up for this trip, so $500 will cover what is left, as far as tickets and hotel. Since I (the mom) am a photographer, I will be creating custom art and ordering postcards, using Quinn's cosplays as the subject.  So his Assassin's Creed, his Half Life, and his (new) StarLord Cosplays will be featured, and donations will receive one or more of them, signed on the back by Quinn!  I will also be creating props for higher donations, as well as some posters. All funds will go towards going to the Con.  Even if we don't meet our goal, i'm prepared to take money out of our 401k to fund the rest.  Still, if i don't have to do this, it would be peaches!
We will adding a video to this page with each $100, of Quinn talking about his costumes and showing you different things he's learning as we go along!  SO FUN! 
  The Impact As the mother of an exceptional child, i can tell you that the pain that comes from your child not exactly 'fitting in' is excruciating! 
Quinn is learning, through his experiences at these conventions, how to socialize and interact with all kinds of people.  The self esteem it gives him to walk through a Con in costume and pose with both adults and kids alike makes him feel like a rock star. Quinn spends a lot of time helping with costumes, from cutting out Pepakura patterns to learning skillsl like soldering, Resin Casting, and working with Worbla.  Getting him away from the video games and letting him work with his hands has also been a huge form of therapy for him. We are hoping to begin a Vlog this year, so that Quinn can begin to share his experiences with other kids who are similarly inclined.  I really believe that giving a child the tools they need to thrive and move forward is essential. 
  Risks & Challenges  We have 3 weeks to raise enough to get to the Con.  It is short notice, and we are determined, but we understand if you cannot help.  It is what it is.
  Other Ways You Can Help Just because you cannot donate does not mean you cannot help!   
Please share our link, so that your friends and their friends can at least know about Quinn and his campaign!
Drop us a line of encouragement, let Quinn know that you are rooting for him to make it to Dragon Con.  It will mean the world to him! 
 And that's all there is to it.

story:
Here's The News

What once was a theraputic outlet for two geeks named May and Xan, has turned into 6 years of informative, entertaining and insane review podcasts about Manga, Anime, Video Games, Conventions and novels of unique quality. With no funding from Big Corporations or government assistant, Alexander "Xan" Villanueva, host of the Various Review Podcasts found at www.spiraken.com has kept the podcast going with a twinkle in his eye and a computer that is still running Windows XP and malfunctioning microphones.

However due to the high cost of replacement equipment, This entertaining podcast may come to an end due to a dying computer and constantly failing microphones. While Xan has been able to keep up with the costs of the web hosting, he will be unable to keep this podcast going once the podcasting computer fails.

But you can help

  • I've hosted the Spiraken Manga Review and Spiraken Movie Review Podcasts since 2008, providing over 400 episodes and over 240,000 minutes of entertaining audio reviews, delivered free of charge .
  • By Funding this project, you'll allow me to produce at least another 5 years worth of content with higher quality and more frequency than before. That means more insanity, more informative reviews and more Wheel of Manga.

Be it a new Microphone, a replacement computer or a new Wheel of Manga, anything to help will be appreciated.

Promises Promises Promises

This is where I promise not to spend your contributions and donations on Jet Skis and other frivolous purchases:

  • In order to keep Our Podcast going, we need to purchase a replacement computer (around $325), 2 replacement microphones ($125 after taxes) and an updated sound mixer  (about $100). The goal of this project ($600) will cover the cost of the needed items as well as the IndieGoGo commission fee.
  • In the unlikely event of an overage, All remaining funds will be used to pay for  more manga and movies of amazing and terrible quality to put on the Wheel of manga and Dodecahydron of movies to potentially review in a future episode of the podcast. 
  • In the likely event of incomplete funding, I'll still use whatever money that has been raised to assist in purchasing the things needed to keep this podcast afloat. I'm not looking to make a profit, but rather trying to keep this podcast going and be able to keep providing fun content for fans new and old.

The Impact

Over the past six years, The Spiraken Manga Review and the various other podcasts released at www.spiraken.com have become a cherished and special part of my life. I would hate to see all the memories and experiences i have shared with the fans be lost due to a lack of funds:

  • Through this podcast I've helped manga fans discover a whole new world of weird, awesome, sad and intriguing graphics, movie fans discover cult classics and helped fans steer away from the truly terrible things that man has unleashed upon the movie, game, and manga fan .
  • Fans of the podcasts have thanked me over the years for things which have touched their heart, as educating them on the things which influence us in our pop culture society.
  • I've been doing this for over six years and hopefully I will still be doing this for another ten years.

Other Ways You Can Help

I can understand that times are tough out there for everyone. If you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help out:

  • Direct Potential donors to this project through Facebook, Twitter and other Social Media Sites.
  • Continue listening to The Spiraken Manga Review, Movie Review, Game Review and Convention Review Podcasts on iTunes, Stitchr or your favorite podcatching software. If it wasn't for you the fans, I would have stopped doing this a long time ago, so thank you.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Some Background...

Mac and Trouble are real-life house cats, my best friends actually.
They're very comical, and have hysterical personalities, so it wasn't hard to imagine them with human characteristics and mannerisms... and eventually, their own comic book.
Mac was born with an ailment called "Cerebellar Hypoplasia" (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerebellar_hypoplasia)which causes him to have problems with his movements and he becomes very uncoordinated. He often has a problem walking, and at times falls down. He really can't jump or run, due to these problems as well.

Trouble was a kitten that came right after Mac. He's larger than most cats, a little clumsy, but an all-around best friend to the others... whether they want it or not LOL
Trouble and Mac got along famously right from the start, giving Mac the only playmate he's ever really known. They eat and often sleep together, and, you really can't think of one without the other.

AND THEY BOTH LOVE CHEESE !
Mac (left) and Trouble - press shots LOL

For years, I had been working in the comic book industry as a writer and artist... but over time I developed a nerve problem with my back and hip that causes me a lot of pain. As such, I had to stop attending comic shows and eventually stayed in my bed or chair. The idea to re-enter comics hit me last year. Since then, I've worked on some really nice comic and art jobs for others, but nothing for myself.

This time, it's for me... for something I care about :)

The Adventures Of Mac And Trouble

Mac and Trouble are average house cats who fall through a wormhole in their litterbox and land in the middle of the Nexus of realities. But... was it an accident, or were they meant to be there ? Only the evil Professor Wormhole knows for sure.
The 'Nexus' is a place outside of space-time, where a mysterious group known as the 'Collectors' base their operations. For all intent and purpose, it appears that they're operating out of a Movie Studio filled with all sorts of amazing characters and props, that interact with reality.
During their adventures, you will meet all sorts of characters on their comedic travel through the universe... some familiar, some not. Among them, long lost heroes, movie monsters, and historical figures to name a few, on a wild journey of the absurd.


The earliest design - art by Michael Mayne.

The best way to describe their story is to look back to the Bob Hope/Bing Crosby 'road pictures' (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Road_to_%E2%80%A6)... the Marx Bros... and a little "Family Guy". We're looking at great fun and high adventure much like the "Disney Afternoon", "Duck Tales", and "Tale Spin".
Comics such as "Cerebus the Aardvark", "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles", and "Howard the Duck" are major influences to the style of the book. The mix of 'funny animals' into 'real world' situations is key to the development... but in this case, we're utilizing time-travel and alternate reality hopping to set the scene.

To start, this is not intended to be a 'normal' comic book property. Mac and Trouble are intended to be shown in a few different different formats.
In their anthropomorphic forms, Mac and Trouble are seen in their own sci-fi comic adventures... and work has already begun on showing the cats as normal cats in newspaper comic strips.

One of the first strips Michael Mayne and I created, displaying Mac and Trouble in their 'house cat' form.

In the future, a special issue is planned collecting the comic mis-adventures of the cats in 'funny animal' style shorts, and, companion ashcan books, called 'Litterboxes' will provide extra adventures and behind-the-scenes content.

Some of these Litterbox Editions will contain cross-overs with other publishers, often showing lighter sides and unique version of their characters. As such, a few publishers are welcoming the crossovers and have already agreed to the new 'tails'.

Added to the fun of the book - a special website address will be hidden among the art in issue #1, which will direct the reader to a page of special art, games, and assorted fun. There will be more hidden features like this as time goes on as well.

Names Connected With This Project

Michael Mayne (series artist)... Terry Pavlet (series colorist/artist)... Larry Jarrell & WTF Comics (publisher/artist)... Russ Leach (guest cover #3 artist)... Arthur Gibson (guest writer)


Cover #1 (left) Michael Mayne (pencils), myself (inks), and Terry Pavlet (colors).
Cover #3 (right) Russ Leach (pencils), soon to be inked by myself.

Soon to come is a wrap-around full-color 'jam' cover that blends the stylings of 10 artists in the industry including: Jeff Austin, Austin Janowsky, Larry Jarrell, Russ Leach, Joe Martino, Michael Mayne, Mat Nastos, Terry Pavlet, Makoto Prime, and myself.
(This list of participating artists may change due to scheduling. It is accurate as of this writing)

Our Story, Their Story, Etc

At this time, Rusty Ink! (my new studio name) is looking to fund Mac and Trouble in it's various presences... the comic book, the ashcan supplement, and news strip formats. I'm hoping to one day take this property to a higher level and extend it into other forms of entertainment as well.

Mac and Trouble have already appeared on two signed promotional convention posters for the Pheonix Comicon and the Southwest Toy and Comic show.
They've been featured in 4 trading card sets so far: The March of Dimes card set (5Finity), the CBLDF set (Cryptozoic), the Island Dreams card set (Holylands.com), and the Red Angel promo set (WTF Comics).

A sampling of their recent trading card appearances.
(From top left) A 2-card puzzle in the CBLDF set, a Mac card from the March of Dimes set, another 2-card puzzle from the Island Dreams set, and Red Angel crosses over with the cats for the Red Angel promo set.
Card credits: Michael Mayne, Russ Leach, Andrea Celestini, and myself.

In addition, they have their own promotional set which features 3 base cards, and, 1 original art sketch card per set. These sketch cards include works by some of the hottest stars in the sketch card industry, as well as special cards to include: Paw-print cards from the actual cats, signature cards from the artists & writers, Instant Win cards for personal sketches, and more ! (This item is being offered as a reward at right)

The 3-card Mac and Trouble promo set - each set comes with an original art sketch card.

For more information and additional imagery, please visit 
macandtrouble.com - and keep up-to-date with Mac, Trouble, and myself at rustygilligan.blogspot.com


The Impact

Achieving this goal would mean the world to me - and will allow funding for our first 3-issue story arc. Whatever funds are collected will go towards payments to the artists and the overall production of the book.
Once in print, we intend to donate a portion of the profits to various animal charities throughout the United States. My intent is share whatever good fortune that comes our way.


Rewards For Investment

All of the rewards will be listed to the right of this area. I've spent many hours devising a unique set of plans to give some nice rewards to people... I hope that you enjoy them.
BUT - for every $500 of investments collected, I will UNLOCK some new plans with additional items and some exciting new rewards !

IF our goal is met, EVERY contributor will receive an additional bonus item !
This is done as a way of thanking people, and showing appreciation, for their time and efforts.


Please note these special terms for rewards...


**As a special bonus, every contributor will receive a special Mac and Trouble desktop pattern emailed directly to you. This pattern is exclusive to this campaign, and will include your first name, business name, and/or a funny personal message. It may also be used as a gift for someone.

**Also, every contributor will be thanked in the pdf copy of issue #1, as well as appear on the website.

**All prints offered as rewards (on the right) are exclusive to this campaign.

**All rewards are signed by 1 or more of the artists/writers mentioned here (where applicable).


SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 25 IS MAC'S BIRTHDAY !!

ALL INVESTMENTS MADE ON THIS DAY WILL RECEIVE A BONUS 'BIRTHDAY' ITEM !!


                    

A mini-gallery of images. Please click each to see a larger size.


Other Ways That You Can Help

Please mention this project and link this page to others. We can use all the help that we can get ('we' of course, meaning the cats, the artists, and myself).


Some Final Thoughts To Share

Every investment made to this project goes solely to the production of the Mac and Trouble comic series. Our progress will be charted on both my personal page and the Mac and Trouble page on Facebook, as well as on our professional blog. To research these, please look up "Rusty Gilligan" and "Mac and Trouble" on Facebook, or go to rustygilligan.blogspot.com

Once in print, "The Adventures Of Mac And Trouble" will feature public service ads for various animal charities and help with animal fundraising events as well. We encourage you to help do your part for those lovely creatures, of all kinds, that brighten our day with unconditional love and loyalty.

"I plan on continuing with this project for as long as I can, in the best way I know how. It means something to me. I would sincerely appreciate any investments that I can get, no matter how small, to help me bring this project to reality... and in the end, it will further help me with my health problems. Thank you for taking the time to learn about my comic project." - Rusty Gilligan

       "My best friend and I"

story:
Warmageddon is a fantasy land, but the citizens and their struggles are real. The economy of Warmageddon revolves around the gladitorial Warmageddon games. The age old monarchy that kept the peace amongst the 7 races has been overthrown and replaced by the Senior Council. THIS is a collection of the stories of the seven members of the Senior Council BEFORE they ruled on the Council.
 
Warmageddon is revealed through the lives of its citizen and this collection tells the stories behind the enigmatic rulers of Warmageddon. Mike Imboden and I have been working to finish these stories over the last 7 years and we noe have all the art together. all that is left is:
1) to ink and letter Tenacity (8 pages to ink, 10 to letter)
2) find an artist for the cover
3) print the book.
 
The goal is to fund the first printing of this 100 page collection and to have it ready for the Baltimorre Comicon in August. All funds raised with this campaign will be used towards these goals.

I have successfully self-published Warmageddon since 2005 after having 2 stories published in Digital Webbing Presents (DWP17 and DWP18) and publishing a retro Savage Sword of Conan style magazine, Warmageddon Illustrated #1.

 

All rewards except for the TPB are printed and ready to ship.

Warmageddon Illustrated #1 was published in 2005 by Digital Webbing. It's a 64-paged newsprint magazine featuring filled with Warmageddon stories and a Frank Cho art gallery and interview. Mile High Comics sells this comic at over $15. The cover price is $6. We're splitting the difference and making it available with a $10 contribution.

Check out all of our 14 prints in the Gallery. Any 2 prints of your choice will be yours for only a $15 contribution.

The TPB collection created by this campaign is a black and white, 100-paged soft cover. If features 7 stories about the Warmageddon Senior Council drawn by Senk Chhour, Stephen Molnar, Hannu Lipponen and Robert Rath. In addition to the stories there will be pin-up by Mike Hawthorne (Conan the Barbarian), Mahmud Asrar (Supergirl) and many more.

The Art Book is a 48-paged book featuring the development art from the first year of Warmageddon with character designs by Jason Shawn Alexander, Joseph Reynolds, Anthony Castrillo, and many more.

Debauchery is a story featuring the female elf, Lilith. Artist Stephen Molnar nevers sells his original art. L Jamal Walton owns the complete inked art for this story. These are blue line pages inked by Stacie Ponder and used to create the story that appears in the book. This story features 2 full page splashes and several 1/2 page panels. All originasl art pages from this story are available. First come, first choice. Only 10 pages are available.

Senk Chhour was commissioned to create the cover to Digital Webbing Presents #18. This is FIRST Warmageddon cover ever created.


For my International friends, please include $5 for Canadian and $10 elsewhere outside the US to cover the extra shipping costs.

 

Thank you for supporting my continuing efforts to create more Warmageddon stories. If you don't support my efforts by contributing to the campaign, please get the word out and make some noise about about this campaign by using the share tools above.
story_txt:
Warmageddon is a fantasy land, but the citizens and their struggles are real. The economy of Warmageddon revolves around the gladitorial Warmageddon games. The age old monarchy that kept the peace amongst the 7 races has been overthrown and replaced by the Senior Council. THIS is a collection of the stories of the seven members of the Senior Council BEFORE they ruled on the Council.
 
Warmageddon is revealed through the lives of its citizen and this collection tells the stories behind the enigmatic rulers of Warmageddon. Mike Imboden and I have been working to finish these stories over the last 7 years and we noe have all the art together. all that is left is:
1) to ink and letter Tenacity (8 pages to ink, 10 to letter)
2) find an artist for the cover
3) print the book.
 
The goal is to fund the first printing of this 100 page collection and to have it ready for the Baltimorre Comicon in August. All funds raised with this campaign will be used towards these goals.
I have successfully self-published Warmageddon since 2005 after having 2 stories published in Digital Webbing Presents (DWP17 and DWP18) and publishing a retro Savage Sword of Conan style magazine, Warmageddon Illustrated #1.
 
All rewards except for the TPB are printed and ready to ship.
Warmageddon Illustrated #1 was published in 2005 by Digital Webbing. It's a 64-paged newsprint magazine featuring filled with Warmageddon stories and a Frank Cho art gallery and interview. Mile High Comics sells this comic at over $15. The cover price is $6. We're splitting the difference and making it available with a $10 contribution.
Check out all of our 14 prints in the Gallery. Any 2 prints of your choice will be yours for only a $15 contribution.
The TPB collection created by this campaign is a black and white, 100-paged soft cover. If features 7 stories about the Warmageddon Senior Council drawn by Senk Chhour, Stephen Molnar, Hannu Lipponen and Robert Rath. In addition to the stories there will be pin-up by Mike Hawthorne (Conan the Barbarian), Mahmud Asrar (Supergirl) and many more.
The Art Book is a 48-paged book featuring the development art from the first year of Warmageddon with character designs by Jason Shawn Alexander, Joseph Reynolds, Anthony Castrillo, and many more.
Debauchery is a story featuring the female elf, Lilith. Artist Stephen Molnar nevers sells his original art. L Jamal Walton owns the complete inked art for this story. These are blue line pages inked by Stacie Ponder and used to create the story that appears in the book. This story features 2 full page splashes and several 1/2 page panels. All originasl art pages from this story are available. First come, first choice. Only 10 pages are available.
Senk Chhour was commissioned to create the cover to Digital Webbing Presents #18. This is FIRST Warmageddon cover ever created.
For my International friends, please include $5 for Canadian and $10 elsewhere outside the US to cover the extra shipping costs.
 
Thank you for supporting my continuing efforts to create more Warmageddon stories. If you don't support my efforts by contributing to the campaign, please get the word out and make some noise about about this campaign by using the share tools above.

story:
Short Summary

The Colchester Comedy Network was set up in 2012 (under the name Colchester Comedy Workshop) after a group of us felt that there was no alternative comedy scene in the town so set about changing that. In the last year we've recorded 3 podcasts and presented a showcase at a local festival, as well as hosting an alternative standup night.

After what's been a successful year, we're looking to expand our output next year. This will mean an increase on the number of sketches we film, the number of events we put on and also the equipment we will need - banners, programmes, merchandise and the like.

We can't stress enough how important your help will be to helping the Network to grow in 2014 - with so many plans afoot we can't necessarily do it all out of our own pockets and your generosity means that we are able to reach our aims.

What we Need and What you Get

We need funds of around £300 to help us put on shows, predominantly. We have 2 regular events - AltCom (a night of alternative standup), held once every three months and The NonConformist Comedy Club (an open mic) - which both require money for things like staging, paying performers and programmes, as well as banners for these events.

We also hope to stage a revue in 2014 and would need funds for costuming and venue hire. Furthermore, we would like to invest in some proper microphones for the cameras we are already using so that the quality of the videos we publish are top-notch

On top of that, we would like to branch out into merchandise - t-shirts, mugs and the like.

What do you get from this? A number of professionally run, enjoyable events that will be able to be sustained across 2014 and hopefully further. The events will still be free to attend and with this funding we can keep it free but make progress at the same time!

The Impact

This is something worth contributing to because we all believe that Colchester needs an alternative comedy scene and we want to be at the forefront in terms of making it grow and become successful - really putting Colchester on the comedy map. We've gone part of the way to making this a tangible reality in the last year and want to continue this work, working with other groups and expanding.

By becoming as proactive as we can it not only benefits the members of the group in terms of their writing and output, it also brings our work to a range of different audiences that would otherwise not be given the chance. And who knows, they might like it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways you can help include turning up to our monthly meetings, which are held on the first Tuesday of the month at St Botolph's Waiting Room, Colchester, and then the third Thursday of the month at Slack Space, both starting at 7.30pm.

You can also like us on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/colchestercomedynetwork?ref=hl

and follow us on Twitter @colcomnetwork

Other than that, just help spread the word about the Network if you're a passionate comedy fan.

story:
CLICK HERE TO VISIT MY GALLERY WITH MORE IMAGES

JANUARY 5, 2013 - ORIGINALS FOR SALE. CHECK THEM OUT IN OUR PERKS.  THEY ARE UNIQUE. WHEN ORDERED ASK FOR NUMER OR ORIGINAL. FIRST ORDERED FIRST SERVED.

 

 

 

UPDATE - NOV 28 - SHIPPING - All perks are plus shipping. We reduced the shipping as low as possible. Thanks for the support.

WHO AM I?

My name is Rene Cordova. I’m a Mexican artist from Guadalajara. My whole life has been dedicated to my drawings (wife gotta hate!!!), comics and animation in my home country, and the past five years have been working for a Mexican animation studio (Metacube).

I have been published in titles like “The Darksiders Tribute” from Udon, "Republika Lucha" from Chidoware, the Mexican blockbuster “Soulkeepers” from Fixia Studio, the compendium “Un Mexicano en cada hijo te dió” and others. I have worked for Televisa Press, as well as Metacube Animation studios designing characters and directing for soon-to-be-released animated movies such as “Noche de Muertos” and “Republika Lucha”.

 

WHAT I´M DOING?

I have always drawn, everywhere, every hour, and I´m blessed to be surrounded by super hyper mega talented artists from Mexico and the Americas. Now, I found myself with enough material to share it with you all. So, I am preparing an amazing book with all-original artwork, full of beautiful ladies, zombies and lots cool stuff. Because with great drawings come a great art book, right?

I’m a Facebook/Deviant junkie. Truly, can´t help myself. Some of work in progress has been posted only as cameo of finished work for my art book. Check my Facebook and Deviant sites for a quick preview of art to come, as well as illustrations I have done for work and fun.  Don´t you worry, there is still plenty of original work inside the Book, I am on top of it. :)

WHAT WE NEED?

We need $3,500 USD to make a small print run of my artbook. I have sensational perks for people that contribute to the project. From time to time, I will post some updates that will help you check my progress.

If you like what you see, please share this link to all your friends … IT´S GOING TO BE AWESOME.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • Share this campaign to all comic lovers and all art lovers. Allow us to have a second artbook. Please :)
  • Share this campaign with all your friends and frienemies, even your ex´s could be interested. LOL!!!
  • Visit this campaign from time to time to see the updates.

 

THE BOOK SPECS + SHIPPING COSTS

Hard cover, 8 3/4x12 3/8 inches, 48 pages, full-color, full bleed, sewn pages.

Please consider shipping when purchasing perks, as all books are charged with shipping, unless indicated otherwise. Here is the table of shipping and packaging costs:

MEXICO - $6 USD - 3 to 5 labor days.

USA & CANADA - $10 USD - 10 to 15 labor days.

SOUTHAMERICA - $20 USD - 10 to 15 labor days.

REST OF THE WORLD - $20 USD - 10 to 15 labor days.

Combined shipping is allowed. You may get some friends to share shipping. Release date is first week of August 2013, and shipping will start as soon a possible.

CLICK HERE TO VISIT MY GALLERY WITH MORE IMAGES

story:
The next chapter in the Beasts of the Black Hand saga is here!

 

 

 

Visit the campaign for Beasts of the Black Hand Volume 1

In Volume 1 of the horror/espionage tale, we met British secret agent Oswald Rayner, who was called into action to stop the evil cabal of sorcerers known as the Black Hand from spreading its malign influence across post-World War I Europe. Rayner, along with his compatriots Biffy Dunderdale, Oleda  Marchand, and American war hero Henry Johnson, thwarted Maria Rasputin and the Black Hand’s plans. 

The Black Hand disappeared into the shadows… and regrouped.

Now, in the spring of 1920, in a world rife with black magic, horrific monsters, and dieselpunk technology, creatures commanded by the Black Hand are rampaging across Eastern Europe, moving ever westward. Maria Rasputin still seeks vengeance for Rayner’s assassination of her father. Black Hand sorcerers Lihko and Koschei have allied themselves with the fascists of the Viking League, spreading terror. A mysterious Teutonic Knight has appeared, his goals and alliances unknown. 

And the great beast known only as The Baubus waits to be unleashed.

The acclaimed creative team of creator/sculptor Paul Harding, writer Ron Marz, and artist Matthew Dow Smith are reuniting for Beasts of the Black Hand Volume 2. They are joined by colorist Nanjan Jamberi and letterer Troy Peteri as they bring to life the next chapter of this thrilling tale. As with the first volume, the sequel is presented in a deluxe, oversize hardcover package, featuring 64 pages of story and art. 

Expect more monsters, more magic, and more mayhem as the Beasts are unleashed once again!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 Best known for his work as a sculptor of statues and action figures for clients including DC Collectibles, Gentle Giant, and Sideshow, Paul Harding is giving full vent to his imagination as the creator and concept artist of Beasts of the Black Hand.

 

 

 

 A veteran of the comics industry, writer Ron Marz has worked for every major publisher, including Marvel, DC, Dark Horse, IDW, and Image. He's penned acclaimed runs on Green Lantern, Silver Surfer, and Witchblade, among others.

 

 

 

Dual threat Mathew Dow Smith is known as both an artist and writer. As an artist, he has amassed credits at Marvel, DC, IDW and Dark Horse, including Batman and Wonder Woman tales, and lengthy runs on Doctor Who and X-Files.

 

 

 

 

 Mr. J. Nanjan is the head of NS Studios in Chennai, India and has been working as a comic colorist since 2006. For the past few years, he has worked with DC Comics and other publishers on Injustice: Gods Among Us, Injustice 2 and Bombshells. He lives in Chennai, India with his family.

 

 

 

Ominous Press/Creation.Ink
Sean HusVar (CEO, Publisher)
Bart Sears (Chief Creative Officer)
Ron Marz (Editor-in-Chief)
Andy Smith (Art Director)
Keith Champagne (Project Manager)
Chris Scioli (International gigolo)

 Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/beastsoftheblackhand
Web: www.beastsoftheblackhand.com
 Twitter: @beastsblackhand

Add-Ons: We are happy to assist with any add-ons through an over-pledge. Email us to let us know what you would like to add, and we will accommodate your request as best as possible.

SHIPPING WILL BE CHARGED THROUGH OUR PLEDGE MANAGER AFTER THE KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN HAS SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED.We will charge backers a shipping fee based on the cost for our fulfillment partners to ship from their hubs to you. We will ship your rewards to the hubs of our fulfillment partners. From there, our partners will ship out packages to you as soon as they are received. Please review the shipping chart below for estimates of what we expect shipping to cost. PLEASE NOTE: shipping costs may increase due to circumstances beyond our control, or via the addition of extra copies and items. The totals provided below are estimates and not final quotes. Below are approximate shipping amounts you should expect to receive from our pledge manager upon completion of the campaign:

USA: approximately $15

Canada: $17 - $22

EU: €14 - €20

Aus & NZ: $30

Asia: $45

RotW: $60

 

 

Risks and challenges

The experienced creative and production teams behind Beasts Of The Black Hand volume 2 have worked in the comic book, collectibles, and sculpting industries for more than 75 years collectively. A portion of this project's production is pre-funded and Matt has finished approximately a third of the artwork. We want to make sure the presentation and product match the first volume of Beasts and have scheduled the remaining production of the book to allow the creators to produce top notch work while also delivering the final product to our backers in a very reasonable amount of time.

 

Paul Harding, Sean HusVar, and everyone on the team understand the trust that it takes for you to back our work. We will do everything we can to complete and ship the project on time. However, there is always a risk that unforeseen circumstances, specifically related to the Covid-19 pandemic, could delay the shipping date for a short time. We will always strive to be transparent and keep our backers updated throughout production.

story:
Malevolent Rising is a dark, superhero story set is the near future on a cyberpunk style Earth. It follows the adventures of an alien whose entire race has been conqured and enslaved by an intergalactic empire known as The Soveriegnty who fights his way free of his captors and flees to Earth. Now, with new allies he faces new threats and may have set events into motion that would lead The Sovereignty here to Earth.

Issue 3 marks the halfway point of this mini series. The events of this issue will change the direction of the story and lay the ground work for what comes next! 

Covers and Interiors

 

 

Wh have worked tirelessly to bring you a fast paced story featuring super hero action, fleshed out and relateable characters, with compelling artwork and billiant colors that is equal if not better than any triple A comics on the market.

This comic is already finished. All that's left to do is get the order to the printers and get these books into your hands. Please consider backing this book. It really has been a labor of love brought to you by people who are just passionate about comics.

story:
Help us bring the first (and only) successful ongoing comic book featuring an all-female team of super heroines BACK to FULL COLOR (digital, on glossy paper) in December of 2019, as series creator BILL BLACK returns to write and be a part of the art team!!

 

My name is Mark G. Heike, and I have been working in the comic book profession ( in one role or another) since 1980.  I've freelanced (as a penciler) on titles like Aliens vs. Predator, X-men, Mantra; inked on Star Wars:Tales of the Jedi, TMNT, Magneto, She-Hulk, Man Against Time and others. I started contributing (as a penciler) to Bill Black's Paragon Publications  in 1980, continued when Bill launched Americomics (soon changed to AC Comics) in 1983, and became Associate Editor at AC in 1990. When Bill decided to step away from day-to-day involvement with the publishing end of AC Comics ( to pursue making films full-time) in 2014, he named me Editor In Chief at AC.  I also collaborated with Bill (as penciler) on the historic Femforce Special #1 in 1984, as well as the launch of the ongoing series, Femforce  in 1985. 
  We realize that  some of you may not be familiar with FEMFORCE or AC COMICS. Because of that , some explanation (and history) may be in order.


  AC Comics is the brainchild of dynamic artist/writer/editor/publisher/producer/director Bill Black. A lifelong comics and film fanatic, Bill began producing his legendary PARAGON PUBLICATIONS line of "ground level" periodicals in 1969 as a spare-time project as he advanced in his career in advertising and educational film production.  Titles like PARAGON PRESENTS, PARAGON SUPERHEROES, FEM FANTASTIQUE, BIZARRE THRILLS and others  featured  comic-style stories of his own original characters like The SHADE, SCARLET SCORPION, CAPTAIN PARAGON, SYNN- The Girl From LSD and others, written and drawn by Bill  and a number of his enthusiastic and talented friends.  Long before comic shops existed, Bill sold these books via mail order from ads placed in contemporary fanzines of the day, with several of the titles boasting circulations well into the thousands  by the end of the line's historic run. Despite the high number of PARAGON  books circulated, they are now hard to find, highly-priced collector's items. Many of Bill's PARAGON heroes and heroines eventually became important characters in the AC COMICS line, appearing as part of FEMFORCE and in other titles to this day.


   When the burgeoning direct-sales comic book market began to take off in the early 1980's, Bill decided to "take the plunge" and debuted a full-color comic book line he dubbed "AMERICOMICS" (soon shortened to AC COMICS) in January of 1983, as one of the first four color comic book lines to pioneer the then-new comic book store distribution system. His flagship AMERICOMICS title, along with FUN COMICS, BLACK DIAMOND and others made a pretty big splash among  comic book readers of the day, but a tidal wave of hastily-produced comics rushed out by dozens of "fly-by-night" publishers soon created a glut of independent comics on the market that drove a number of distributors and retailers out of business and required a re-thinking of the AC line by late 1984. 


   With much-cheaper-to-produce black and white comic books suddenly a bit of a fad, Bill decided to re-edit some unpublished material he had on hand into a black and white special that would allow him to try out a comic book concept he'd had in mind for years: an ALL-FEMALE team of costumed super-types- and FEMFORCE was born. When the intended "one shot" FEMFORCE SPECIAL of 1984 proved to be the biggest AC COMICS success since BLACK DIAMOND #1, a color, ongoing FEMFORCE title immediately went into production, with the #1 issue hitting comic shop shelves in late Spring, 1985. That FEMFORCE ongoing series has been running ever since, though changes in the comic book marketplace have over the years dictated  a return to black and white status ( between issues #16-#56), then a return to color (from #57-87), and BACK to black and white since #88- with an increase in page count up to 80 pages of all-new material since FEMFORCE #150. FEMFORCE is still the ONLY successful, ongoing comic book series that features a team of costumed and super-powered women, still running continuously for 33 years.


   When business conditions and technology indicated that it was time to try out color comics at AC  once again in 2019, it was a "no brainer" that the perennially-popular FEMFORCE characters  should be the stars of the first title, so we developed a new comic book, titled  SUPERBABES, as we wanted to lauch a color FEMFORCE comic book WITHOUT initially interfering with the regular ongoing FEMFORCE quarterly title which would continue on that schedule. SUPERBABES is a supplimentary publication, a companion book to the regular FEMFORCE series. We solicited for Superbabes #1 as a product that will be available in comic book shops in August of this year.


   The enthusiastic response we got to SUPERBABES #1 led us to think that it could be a MISTAKE to maintain FF as a black and white book  any longer than we had to, so we decided to fast-track our plan to go full color on FEMFORCE ASAP; which would mean FEMFORCE #188, scheduled for December of this year. When we told Bill about this plan, he was so excited he immediately volunteered to jump an board to be the WRITER and INKER on the new all-color FEMFORCE!! What could possibly be better than having the book's ORIGINAL CREATOR back at the helm!! In addition, Bill is bringing long-time FEMFORCE penciler Eric Coile on board to draw the book. Eric has worked on FEMFORCE on and off since the early 1990's, and his redition of the FEMFORCE cast has long been an AC fan-favorite. The lead story for FEMFORCE #188 would be by the creative team of Black and Coile ( Which will feature the return of long-time nemesis ALIZARIN CRIMSON, and clear up the long-running mystery of NIGHTVEIL's missing Cloak of Darkness), but that's not all! The book would ALSO feature a a back-up NIGHTVEIL story co-starring The SENTINELS of JUSTICE, written AND drawn by Bill Black himself!!


   The only thing that stood in the way of proceeding full speed ahead was production costs on a second color book.  Cautiously optomistic as we were with the sales numbers on Superbabes #1 (AC's first all-digital color comic book) we had used up all of our available capital getting THAT book into production. If we had to wait to accumulate enough funding out of the sales of additional issues of SUPERBABES to put out a color FEMFORCE, it might take us several YEARS to do that, even if SUPERBABES continues as self-supporting. By that time, conditions in the comic book industry might no longer be favorable  for a color FF. So, we've decided to look to YOU, the fans and readers for financing. If you can help us get this historic back-to-color issue off the ground, we feel confident that the response to it in the direct-sales market will allow the title to support itself , hopefully for another 30-plus years (at least!) as a full-color, state-of-the art publication, and turn this already historic and important independent comic book title into something chromatically spectacular!!

   Please note that although we have marked our perks as "shipping November 2019" (when our campaign officially ends), we will NOT be waiting that long to fulfill them. As soon as anyone cares to contribute, we will try to ship (or in the case of video downloads, email a link to same) the appropriate items to whatever perk was selected within 48 hours of that payment. Feel free to contribute at any time and rest assured that you'll likely receive your items within just a few days of that contribution!!
story_txt:
Help us bring the first (and only) successful ongoing comic book featuring an all-female team of super heroines BACK to FULL COLOR (digital, on glossy paper) in December of 2019, as series creator BILL BLACK returns to write and be a part of the art team!!
 

My name is Mark G. Heike, and I have been working in the comic book profession ( in one role or another) since 1980.  I've freelanced (as a penciler) on titles like Aliens vs. Predator, X-men, Mantra; inked on Star Wars:Tales of the Jedi, TMNT, Magneto, She-Hulk, Man Against Time and others. I started contributing (as a penciler) to Bill Black's Paragon Publications  in 1980, continued when Bill launched Americomics (soon changed to AC Comics) in 1983, and became Associate Editor at AC in 1990. When Bill decided to step away from day-to-day involvement with the publishing end of AC Comics ( to pursue making films full-time) in 2014, he named me Editor In Chief at AC.  I also collaborated with Bill (as penciler) on the historic Femforce Special #1 in 1984, as well as the launch of the ongoing series, Femforce  in 1985.   We realize that  some of you may not be familiar with FEMFORCE or AC COMICS. Because of that , some explanation (and history) may be in order.
  AC Comics is the brainchild of dynamic artist/writer/editor/publisher/producer/director Bill Black. A lifelong comics and film fanatic, Bill began producing his legendary PARAGON PUBLICATIONS line of "ground level" periodicals in 1969 as a spare-time project as he advanced in his career in advertising and educational film production.  Titles like PARAGON PRESENTS, PARAGON SUPERHEROES, FEM FANTASTIQUE, BIZARRE THRILLS and others  featured  comic-style stories of his own original characters like The SHADE, SCARLET SCORPION, CAPTAIN PARAGON, SYNN- The Girl From LSD and others, written and drawn by Bill  and a number of his enthusiastic and talented friends.  Long before comic shops existed, Bill sold these books via mail order from ads placed in contemporary fanzines of the day, with several of the titles boasting circulations well into the thousands  by the end of the line's historic run. Despite the high number of PARAGON  books circulated, they are now hard to find, highly-priced collector's items. Many of Bill's PARAGON heroes and heroines eventually became important characters in the AC COMICS line, appearing as part of FEMFORCE and in other titles to this day.

When we told Bill about this plan, he was so excited he immediately volunteered to jump an board to be the WRITER and INKER on the new all-color FEMFORCE!! story:
Seven years ago, before developing her powers, Nyobi was the breakout star of the Geisha Dolls, an all-girl J-pop group that was quickly gaining in popularity. While being mobbed by a sea of die-hard fans during a meet-and-greet at Tokyo's Mega Plex Mall, 16-year-old Nyobi's powers manifested. A ring of bright purple light flashed throughout the mall, blinding the spectators. In a split second, Nyobi was gone.

Reappearing at the back of the building, safe from the mob dying to just touch her, young Nyobi realized that this singular moment would change her life for the better. As the media ran nuts with the story, people throughout the globe had their own theories as to what had happened. ICON Entertainment - Nyobi's record label - tried to explain it as a special effect; a stunt to surprise audiences everywhere. Much to their chagrin, when Nyobi finally made her return to the public spotlight a week later on MyTube, she revealed her newly-discovered abilities to the world!

NYOBI #1 is approximately 33 pages of story and 11 pages of bonus content, including pinups! The book is standard comic dimension, 6.25" x 10.5". 

Original Cover by Andre Boulard 

 

IGG Exclusive Cover by Josh Spencer 

 

NYOBI CHIBI T-SHIRT 

Want clothes on your back? Why not deck yourself in style with the Nyobi Chibi T-shirt!! 

 

 

 

Stretch Goals:

$5000 - TO BE UNLOCKED

 

I have written and successfully funded four installments of Nyobi, as well as its spin-off Avani: Origins #1 

I have a track record for success and have establish myself in the indie comic scene.

With a strong Indiegogo campaign, I will be able to focus on the creative process of continuing the series with improved, full color art. I hope that you will enjoy this first issue of Nyobi, and will allow me to continue providing you, the reader, with more stories in the future!

Design Team

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Nyobi #1 is already completed and ready to go to the printer. All we need are the costs of printing and shipping!
  • All funds go towards the completion of the next installment of Nyobi, which will be offered to our Indiegogo backers first! 
  • Our goal is to get Nyobi #1 into your hands and get the next issue into production before summer!

 

I don't foresee any issues with our production or shipping. Should there be any issues, I will come on here and provide updates and answer any questions you may have.

story: Based on the journal of the late Maj. Gen. David Sawyer, Tiger on the Storm is a comic book miniseries honoring the 23rd Tactical Fighter Wing and their service in Operation: Desert Storm. Two of the creators involved in Untold Stories from Iraq and Afghanistan reunited to collaborate on this project- Valerie Finnigan (Korean War, vol. 2, Why Not? Presents....) and penciller/inker Richard O'Hara (Second Dawn, Futurians Return). Just in time for the 25th anniversary of Desert Storm, you can also join in, help cover the expenses of creating and printing these books, and see that this part of history is never forgotten. Funds raised beyond what will cover those costs will go to Heroes Fallen Studios, a non-profit dedicated to providing a safe, nonjudgmental forum for veterans and their families to share their stories and educate the general public.

story:
Who we are..

Illustrator Patrick Cornelis is the owner of Pangolin Comics and has been terrorizing his audience with downright horrifying imagery for several years now. As a frequently asked guest at European cons, he has managed to stand out with his macabre style and eye for detail. Soon he will be completing his Virus-anthology of zombie-comics, alongside other projects, finding his way to an ever growing fan base.

Tom Thys has published three collections of short stories so far. He is praised for his bizarre imagination and the ability to blend genres such as horror, dark fantasy and humor into compelling tales about the decay of both body and mind. At a very young age, he got mesmerized by the magic of horror movies, dreaming that someday he would be a screenwriter. Building nightmares for this chilling anthology series, comes pretty close.

 

Are you a fan of horror?

Well, then this might be what you are looking for.Here are some samples of what you can expect.

Budget

Making comics is al lot of work and printing the different versions of the book with add-ons cost a lot af money. In order to do this correctly we still need money to work on the book and pay for the differenet costs at hand. With your help we might be able to pull it off :-)

 

EXTRA'S

Romano Molenaar, superstar artist from the X-Men, The Darkness and Storm made us an alternate wraparound cover. Pledge 30 euros or more to be eligible for this wraparound!! And I tell you, it looks AWESOME!!!! Check it out here :-)
