story:
Who is ZOMBIE-SAMA?!?

I

Imagine the horror when sushi delivery boy Jim Okami realizes the citizens of his small town are literally being eaten alive by pus-spewing, irradiated, nuclear-contaminated Zombies! 

As all Hell breaks loose around him, the desperate former slacker grabs the lone katana from above the restaurant's cash register and is heroically reborn as teen sensation ZOMBIE-SAMA!

Now armed with sword and chainmail armor (conveniently appropriated from a local scuba shop), our hero sets out to save his friends from the irradiated flood of rancorous fallout freaks! 

Co-creators Billy Tucci (Shi: The Way of the Warrior) and John Broglia (God Complex) are joined by digital colorist Paul Little and letterer/designer Mindy Lopkin for a full-color, 58-page graphic novel. Goriously-good variant covers are offered by Billy, John and European rising star Asha Kishna.  

All 64 pages (Yes, we just said 58 pages a moment ago. Read on!) of artwork is complete, and we just have to finalize our coloring and lettering. In addition, we have the art and swag you desire, with offerings of prints, T-shirts, and more!  

As an added BONUS we’re offering a very, very special reward… an Indiegogo variant preview ashcan comic for the upcoming Shi: Return of the Warrior! This ashcan will ONLY be available to those who pledge for this Indiegogo. You will not be able to get it anywhere else.  

This project, near and dear to all our hearts, was successfully crowdfunded on Kickstarter, so our basic costs were met.  We were able to expand Zombie-Sama! to include a 6-page preview of Billy’s next (and probably last) zombie story, Company Z.  We are now launching on Indiegogo to reach the largest possible audience with our “little comic that could,” while providing something special for dedicated Indiegogo patrons.  Our team has worked hard for the past two years to bring this comic to fruition, and with all your help, they will be rewarded for their efforts.

So please PLEDGE, SHARE, and help our team continue to grow our little zombie comic... it could save your life some day!

On a personal note, I want to thank you all from the bottom of my heart for 25 wonderful years in comics. You have all literally changed my life.

So, thank you, please pledge, share and remember… 

#peacelovezombiesama

 - Billy Tucci

 

***ALL COMICS/BOOKS/PRINTS come AUTOGRAPHED BY Billy Tucci and John Broglia unless otherwise requested in pledge message.***

 

 

Here’s a peek at a few pages...

 

AND CONTINUE TO CHECK BACK FOR MORE ADDED PLEDGE REWARD LEVELS TOO!

 

MEET TEAM ZOMBIE-SAMA! 

Billy Tucci - Writer 

 Billy Tucci is an award-winning cartoonist best known for his modern-day samurai fable, Shi.  Through Billy’s Crusade Fine Arts, the multi-Eisner Award-nominated Shi has been printed in five languages and sold more than 3 million comic books.  He has also worked on a litany of projects for DC Comics’ including Sgt. Rock: The Lost Battalion, and Harley's Little Black Book (featuring Harley Quinn), as well as stories featuring Flash vs. Superman and Batman. 

His earnest retelling of the Christmas story, A Child Is Born has quietly turned into a international blockbuster after winning the Christian Small Publisher Book of the Year Award. 

In 2019, Billy marks the 25th anniversary of his best known character with the release of two graphic novels, Shi: Return of the Warrior and Shi: Hotaru, as well as new Shi action figures, statues and archive editions. He'll also bring back the Golden Age Icon Miss Fury for Dynamite Entertainment, illustrate a Wonder Woman tale for DC Comics. Cave Pictures Publishing is presently releasing his Appalachian Apocalypse. 

John Broglia - Artist

Zombie-Sama! co-creator John Broglia is a New York based cartoonist who's love for comics dates back to his early childhood. He attended the School of Visual Arts in Manhattan, where he studied animation. Early on in his career he worked on several creator owned projects, including Image Comics' God Complex with Michael Avon Oeming. He has also supplied art for anthology series such as Atomic Robo: Real Science Adventures and Image Comics Where We Live. 

John has been a part of several successful Kickstarter campaigns. His most prominent success prior to Zombie-Sama in this arena came with writer Michael Sarrao on Unmasked volumes 1 and 2. He is currently working on Harriet Tubman: Demon Slayer and other creator-owned projects.

Paul Little - Colorist

Paul Little is a colorist who has worked on a number of licensed properties like Darkwing Duck and Sons of Anarchy, as well as Eisner and Harvey Award-nominated titles like Morning Glories and Little Nemo: Dream Another Dream. He lives in Niagara Falls.

Mindy Lopkin - Letterer/Designer

Mindy Lopkin works as a freelance comic book letter and she enjoys a good challenge. She has worked extensively with Amrit Birdi & Co one of which was youtube sensation, Joe Sugg’s Username series (the first book of the trilogy, Username: Evie, was the fastest-selling graphic novel in UK history). 

She has worked on multiple projects for Markosia Enterprises and Horizon Line Comics, as well as working on many indie comics including Unmasked: Volume 2 with Michael Sarrao, John Broglia and Paul Little. She was also part of an all-female creative team behind Advent Comics one-shot, titled Sunshine.

 

J.C. Vaughn - Editor

J.C. Vaughn is the Vice-President of Publishing at Gemstone Publishing, home of The Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide, among other books. He is the writer-creator of Bedtime Stories for Impressionable Children, The Flight, Zombie-Proof, and Vampire, PA (for which Billy Tucci contributed a cover). He has co-written 24, Stargate Atlantis, and Stargate Universe with Mark L. Haynes, Mighty Samson with Jim Shooter, and Shi with Billy on more than one occasion. J.C. is also presently editing Stoker & Wells: Order of the Golden Dawn. 

Asha Kishna - Featured Variant Cover Illustrator 

Break-out cover artist, Asha KIshna met Billy Tucci at a convention appearance in the Netherlands and he was blown away by her dynamic pencils and striking inking and storytelling. Her "Jane Defiant" cover for this project captures the millennial generations sentiments that no matter how horrible things are going, there's always time to "strike a pose." She has several upcoming projects from a variety of publishers (including Crusade) and we are excited about her amazing future in comics!

 

Risks and challenges

Zombie-Sama! Is complete, with the exception of a few details as indicated in the Pledge Reward Levels. Once the Campaign is complete, we are ready to go to print. Delivery is expected to be timely, but should anything arise, we be sure advise all of you in the comments. USE MESSAGING WHILE PLEDGING IN ORDER TO CONFIRM SIZING, ADD-ONS AND TO MAKE REQUESTS. PLEASE BE SURE TO LOOK FOR AND COMPLETE THE SURVEY ONCE THE CAMPAIGN ENDS - THAT IS THE ONLY WAY OF ATTAINING YOUR SHIPPING ADDRESS. WITHOUT A COMPLETED SURVEY, WE CANNOT GET YOUR REWARDS.

In addition, we have the art and swag you desire, with offerings of prints, T-shirts, and more!  As an added BONUS we’re offering a very, very special reward… an Indiegogo variant preview ashcan comic for the upcoming Shi: Return of the Warrior! This ashcan will ONLY be available to those who pledge for this Indiegogo. You will not be able to get it anywhere else.  This project, near and dear to all our hearts, was successfully crowdfunded on Kickstarter, so our basic costs were met.  We were able to expand Zombie-Sama! to include a 6-page preview of Billy’s next (and probably last) zombie story, Company Z.  We are now launching on Indiegogo to reach the largest possible audience with our “little comic that could,” while providing something special for dedicated Indiegogo patrons.  Our team has worked hard for the past two years to bring this comic to fruition, and with all your help, they will be rewarded for their efforts.So please PLEDGE, SHARE, and help our team continue to grow our little zombie comic... it could save your life some day!On a personal note, I want to thank you all from the bottom of my heart for 25 wonderful years in comics. You have all literally changed my life.So, thank you, please pledge, share and remember… #peacelovezombiesama - Billy Tucci ***ALL COMICS/BOOKS/PRINTS come AUTOGRAPHED BY Billy Tucci and John Broglia unless otherwise requested in pledge message.***  Here’s a peek at a few pages... AND CONTINUE TO CHECK BACK FOR MORE ADDED PLEDGE REWARD LEVELS TOO! MEET TEAM ZOMBIE-SAMA! Billy Tucci - Writer  Billy Tucci is an award-winning cartoonist best known for his modern-day samurai fable, Shi.  Through Billy’s Crusade Fine Arts, the multi-Eisner Award-nominated Shi has been printed in five languages and sold more than 3 million comic books.  He has also worked on a litany of projects for DC Comics’ including Sgt. Rock: The Lost Battalion, and Harley's Little Black Book (featuring Harley Quinn), as well as stories featuring Flash vs. Superman and Batman. His earnest retelling of the Christmas story, A Child Is Born has quietly turned into a international blockbuster after winning the Christian Small Publisher Book of the Year Award. In 2019, Billy marks the 25th anniversary of his best known character with the release of two graphic novels, Shi: Return of the Warrior and Shi: Hotaru, as well as new Shi action figures, statues and archive editions. He'll also bring back the Golden Age Icon Miss Fury for Dynamite Entertainment, illustrate a Wonder Woman tale for DC Comics. Cave Pictures Publishing is presently releasing his Appalachian Apocalypse. John Broglia - ArtistZombie-Sama! co-creator John Broglia is a New York based cartoonist who's love for comics dates back to his early childhood. He attended the School of Visual Arts in Manhattan, where he studied animation. Early on in his career he worked on several creator owned projects, including Image Comics' God Complex with Michael Avon Oeming. He has also supplied art for anthology series such as Atomic Robo: Real Science Adventures and Image Comics Where We Live. John has been a part of several successful Kickstarter campaigns. His most prominent success prior to Zombie-Sama in this arena came with writer Michael Sarrao on Unmasked volumes 1 and 2. He is currently working on Harriet Tubman: Demon Slayer and other creator-owned projects.Paul Little - ColoristPaul Little is a colorist who has worked on a number of licensed properties like Darkwing Duck and Sons of Anarchy, as well as Eisner and Harvey Award-nominated titles like Morning Glories and Little Nemo: Dream Another Dream. He lives in Niagara Falls.Mindy Lopkin - Letterer/DesignerMindy Lopkin works as a freelance comic book letter and she enjoys a good challenge. She has worked extensively with Amrit Birdi & Co one of which was youtube sensation, Joe Sugg’s Username series (the first book of the trilogy, Username: Evie, was the fastest-selling graphic novel in UK history). She has worked on multiple projects for Markosia Enterprises and Horizon Line Comics, as well as working on many indie comics including Unmasked: Volume 2 with Michael Sarrao, John Broglia and Paul Little. She was also part of an all-female creative team behind Advent Comics one-shot, titled Sunshine. J.C. Vaughn - EditorJ.C. Vaughn is the Vice-President of Publishing at Gemstone Publishing, home of The Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide, among other books. He is the writer-creator of Bedtime Stories for Impressionable Children, The Flight, Zombie-Proof, and Vampire, PA (for which Billy Tucci contributed a cover). He has co-written 24, Stargate Atlantis, and Stargate Universe with Mark L. Haynes, Mighty Samson with Jim Shooter, and Shi with Billy on more than one occasion. J.C. is also presently editing Stoker & Wells: Order of the Golden Dawn. Asha Kishna - Featured Variant Cover Illustrator Break-out cover artist, Asha KIshna met Billy Tucci at a convention appearance in the Netherlands and he was blown away by her dynamic pencils and striking inking and storytelling. Her "Jane Defiant" cover for this project captures the millennial generations sentiments that no matter how horrible things are going, there's always time to "strike a pose." She has several upcoming projects from a variety of publishers (including Crusade) and we are excited about her amazing future in comics! Risks and challengesZombie-Sama! Is complete, with the exception of a few details as indicated in the Pledge Reward Levels. Once the Campaign is complete, we are ready to go to print. Delivery is expected to be timely, but should anything arise, we be sure advise all of you in the comments. USE MESSAGING WHILE PLEDGING IN ORDER TO CONFIRM SIZING, ADD-ONS AND TO MAKE REQUESTS. PLEASE BE SURE TO LOOK FOR AND COMPLETE THE SURVEY ONCE THE CAMPAIGN ENDS - THAT IS THE ONLY WAY OF ATTAINING YOUR SHIPPING ADDRESS. WITHOUT A COMPLETED SURVEY, WE CANNOT GET YOUR REWARDS.

story:
Hello IndieGoGo

Our team is very happy to bring Greed to IndieGoGo after a successful run in July. Our books are either ready to ship or print-ready for quick fulfillment so you do not have to worry about waiting months to get your order.  

* Exclusive IndieGoGo Gremlins homage cover designed by Jennifer Leonard will be in color. Final image pending. 

• • •

Greed

    Greed expands the world as we know it with stories and events from the alternate world that are filled with macabre yet comical tales, and heart-wrenching moments. 

    Greed is a world of gods and demons, tales of theology, and campfire stories. It takes place in a small town that has a lot going on below the surface.

    Everything you've heard about religion is true except it's a realm where Hades and Lucifer share Hell; a place where Christ, Odin, and Zeus debate your fate, and lesser gods and demons traverse a landscape that is identical to our own.

    Oh, my friends... Only a thin veil separates us from them. 

    Meet Oz, a 10-year old suburban youth who meets Kayde, the monster under his bed. With increasing levels of terror that visit them in the night, their adventures begin with a SMASH!

    Be very afraid of the dark.

    • • •

    • • •

    The Listener 1 - 3 (PDF)

    We are making The Listener 1-3 available on PDF for those who wish to know more about the genesis of this world.

    From the cracked lips of a man, who has seen both physical and psychological horrors, comes a tale... 

    The Listener series follows Aditsan (Adi), a Native American soldier in World War II, who inherits the abilities of 'The Listener' when his father dies, allowing him to interact with the dead, as well as other supernatural beings. 

    'When Winds Weep' dives heavily into spirituality and shows you how far our heroes are willing to go for one another. It is a story of brotherhood.  

    How did the original Listener come to be? 'Beginnings' is the story of how Adi's grandfather became the Listener and we learn more about the demon from When Winds Weep.    

    • The Listener
    • When Winds Weep
    • Beginnings

    • • •

    • • •

    Original Art - 11x17 pencils & inks

    What you get...

    When you select this tier, you will also receive the IGG Exclusive Gremlins homage cover edition for GREED #1, the sticker and bookmark. 

    There is only one! 

    • • •

     

    Risks & Challenges

    The books are complete and have already had their first print run. Once funds are released, we can begin fulfillment immediately. The only exception is if we have to print more copies of variant covers and orders with t-shirts will ship upon arrival. We will provide timely updates to keep you informed. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please take a moment to share our campaign with your friends, and tag us when you do!

    Twitter:

    • Dustin Brunell
    • RAGIN' AvC
    • Nita Lanning
    • Meredith Loughran

story:
Micro Mob a unique Twitter event

Over the last month we've come together to do something very special. We created a Mob of people expressing their support to everybody coping with cancer. The Mob is an A3 drawing comprising over 1,400 tiny individual, unique, toon characters holding up the Twitter name of each Mobster. Stephen Fry, Ricky Gervais, Jonathan Ross, plus over 30 other well known people are in there too.

The Mob was a spur of the moment thing that ran away with itself because hundreds of wonderful people made it happen. We aimed to raise awareness and raise cash. We've done the awareness now it's time to make a real difference. 

Here is our story: http://davekirkwoodstudio.wordpress.com/2013/07/30/micro-flash-mob/

We hit our £7,000 target in less than 24 hours. The drawing has been shot by an archival photographer. His work is amazing, you can see every tiny pencil stroke. The artwork goes to the printer on Monday and I expect prints back sometime next week.

I should be starting to send prints out next weekend.

When we sell ALL the prints we could raise over £25,000 for our 3 charities, that's over £7,000 each. So that's our real target. 


The Impact

Every penny of profit will be shared between 3hundredand65's three charities: Teenage Cancer Trust, Cyclists Fighting Cancer and When you Wish Upon a Star

During the making of the mob I lost someone very special to me and the world lost Jon Brookes. I dedicate Micro Mob to Cath and Jon, you can dedicate your print to anyone you choose - the mob is for everybody coping with cancer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Mobsters: Amazing prize from @derwentpencils worth * £196 * for the best coloured in Mob print. Responding to your comments on here that some of you will be colouring in your print I asked Derwent Pencils to offer an amazing prize to the best one. They said yes and are offering this incredible box of pencils to the winner. These are artists' pencils (the real deal) used by professionals.

Derwent Pencils will judge the prize. More details to follow but instead of ruining your print we will include in EVERY one of the 2,000 prints a beautifully designed leaflet on The Story of The Mob in that will be a pull-out section of the mob for you to colour in and send to Derwent. Good luck - more later. Like they always say though, you've got to be in it to win it.


Leave a donation 

You've already bought a print but want to support us some more or you don't want to buy a print but want to donate a small amount - easy! Just hit the contribute button and don't claim a 'Perk' that way you can leave anything from £1.

If a million people left a £1 donation...

Spread the word. The Mob was a very special, unique and original Twitter event - a tiny piece of history. Even if you're not in the mob it's a fascinating item to own and can only go up in value. Plus there's over 1,400 people on there to spot.

story:
Our Indiegogo campaign is the kick off to our press release and advertising campaign as well. When funded we plan on using the capital to grow our fan base by advertising in cannabis based magazines, pop culture magazines, radio, billboard, and internet. We will be attending the Cannabis Cup  and Comic con events. We will add to our existing product line ie; pothead bobble heads, t-shirts, plush dolls, hats, etc... We have several apps available and are currently developing more. Our goal is to build our fan base while selling our merchandise to raise funds for the production of an animated cartoon series. When the production of the cartoon is complete we will have the fan base to support it. Thank you very much for checking us out. We hope you enjoy the products from your donation.

Risks and challenges

We currently have an awesome team comprised of a webmaster, an app designer, social media director, the original artist, an internet advertising agent, a 3-D animation graphic designer and ourselves. We have been involved in the industry for many years and our affiliates in the cannabis industry are there for the advertising.The main stream media is portraying cannabis to be more excepted in the medical community as well as for recreational. We don't think about if our cartoon will be liked or excepted. We are more concerned about getting the right voices for the cartoons and details of the project. At this point we have over came many obstacles and delays. Once we have funds for proper advertising, its all on us to push the product, and we know we can...

  • Hey supporters and fans of The Potheadz! Thank you very much for taking the time to check out our  Indiegogo page. We are Potsie and Jamie the creators of The funniest, coolest, adult cartoon The Pot Headz. You have never seen a cartoon like this in your life and you never will again. We are very close to fulfilling an eighteen year long journey and dream. With your support, together we can make our dream a reality in 2015 by bringing our characters to life.

    The cartoon first started as a way for us to make money while having fun writing jokes with our friends. We had no idea idea what we were doing but we learned as we went and have been educated by trial and error rather than a college education. Not only did we need to create the characters and material, we had to learn the laws and business side of the industry step by step. We had to protect ourselves from sharks a few times that were attempting to copy and steal our cartoon, but for the most part we have been greeted with open arms every step of the way. The library of congress put us on hold several times during a phone conversation so several people in the office could tell us how much they love the cartoon and they are rooting for us.

    As time went on and the cartoon progressed so did the motivation behind the production of the cartoon. The next phase or motivational drive was we wanted to put our stamp on the marijuana entertainment industry. We love Cheech and Chong. They are the pioneers of pot entertainment that paved the way for future marijuana themed entertainment. We want our characters to continue caring the torch of edgy adult subculture entertainment to the main stream public. We respect everyone in the industry for embarking in a business that has been deemed dangerous and evil in the name of politics and big business. We feel that our cartoon is the next best product in the cannabis and animation industry.

    The third phase and motivation is where were at now. We want to bring our characters to full progression by bringing them to life in an animated cartoon series. We plan on using the popularity of the books as well as our new social media standing to bring this 20 yr project to your living room.


  •                                                                Thanks to You...

story:
Blind Mirth Improv Comedy!

We are Blind Mirth, St Andrews' oldest, best and only improv comedy group and we will be performing in the Edinburgh Fringe at SPACE on the Mile, Venue 39, 11-23th (not 17th) August 10:00-11.00pm!

We have performed in the Fringe for three years in a row, and were rated a five star show for the Fringe 2012 and 2013 (http://www.broadwaybaby.com/listing.php?id=16783, http://edfringereview.com/r/UfF4jexMTfaXgD-7XDx6yg ) and came within an inch of a sell-out show in 2013. It is very important to us that we can build upon last year's successes through building relationships with other improvisers, professional comedians and our audience outside of St Andrews. However, as we are all students, funding is difficult to come by and this is where you come in!

What We Need:

Building off of our profits from last year, we only need to raise £500 to complete this venture.
The money made from indiegogo will go primarily towards paying for venue fees (the most expensive element of the Fringe for an improv group) and publicity for the show (poster, flyers, press packs and stickers for you!).

What you get in return

It's your Mirth Day! As a group of creative-type people, we have a number of different goodies to give you on your Mirth Day (the day you donate!). All of the presents are detailed on the right. And, of course, no matter what present you choose, you will receive a Blind Mirth 2014 sticker sheet!

All our items will be delivered by the end of the Fringe (if not earlier). If you do not receive them by the end of August, feel free to contact us at blindmirth@gmail.com. 

A little about the group

Blind Mirth perform every week in St Andrews during term time entirely for free in the Barron Theatre, North Street, St Andrews. During our shows, we donate a large proportion of our time to various styles of long form comedy, improving that requires more stamina. At the Fringe, we drew inspiration from audience members' wallets and iPods to create longer scenes with more character development (we usually give the iPods and wallet back). The other part of the show is dedicated to short form improv games like those you may see on "Whose Line".

We have performed with the likes of Craig Campbell, WitTank, The Scat Pack, the Noise Next Door and the Amateur Transplants, have worked with a lot of schools and societies in St Andrews through gigs and hosting jobs, and headlined Glasgow's Student Union Fresher's Week 2012.

If you are unable to donate, we would love to see you in Edinburgh at the show! We will be there from the 11-23th August (not 17th) in SPACE on the Mile, Venue 39 at 10:00pm!
Or hit us up on twitter @blindmirth, at blindmirth@gmail.com or check out our website ww.blindmirth.co.uk!

Blind Mirth are in association with Mermaids, St Andrews Performing Arts Fund.

story:
La Passenger Press è nata nel 2007 con la sua prima pubblicazione The Passenger #0, un antologia di storie scritte da registi internazionali e disegnate da artisti italiani e stranieri, e da quell'anno è stata sempre presente con il suo stand alla fiera dei fumetti Lucca Comics and Games e per quattro anni anche alla fiera francese di Angouleme.

Passenger Press non è una casa editrice tradizionale, ma piuttosto un collettivo multiculturale di artisti da tutto il mondo la cui finalità è promuovere il fumetto come media, stimolando la vostra curiosità al di fuori di tutto ciò che è mainstream.

Personalmente il business non mi è mai interessato e tutto è sempre stato re-investito in nuove pubblicazioni. Il mio scopo primario sin dall'inizio è stato quello di fare fumetti nuovi e di promuovere i giovani artisti e quelli indie meno conosciuti grazie anche alla collaborazioni di professionisti noti e affermati. 

Ed è quello che faccio tutt'ora.

Oggi sono qui a chiederVi di sostenere questa campagna di finanziamento per aiutare me e i miei compagni Passeggeri in vista della prossima Lucca Comics and Games 2015. Con i fondi raccolti grazie a questa speciale "svendita" estiva, finanzieremo l'affitto dello stand per la fiera e l'affitto del furgone con cui muoverci durante la manifestazione. Finalità pratiche per sostenerci in un ambiente dove la maggior parte dei lettori continua a seguire l'editoria mainstream e la distribuzione non aiuta i piccoli editori indie. A prezzi davvero scontatissimi potrete conoscere i nostri volumi d'esordio e alcune gemme ingiustamente poco conosciute. 

Inoltre sono disponibili tre succose novità:

In prevendita Amazzoni, il nuovo progetto collettivo sempre in formato pocket con una storia completa di oltre 250 pagine;

Delicatessen, la prima raccolta dei cinici disegni di Antonio Proietto con in regalo solo per le prime 100 copie la serie PINK delle Delicartoline;

L'albero della vita, una serigrafia (27x38 cm su carta cotone 60% Fabriano Rosaspina Avorio) di Riccardo Federici in soli venti esemplari firmati e numerati a mano realizzata da quei matti di Perpetua!

Per tutte queste ragioni la campagna è flessibile, perché veramente ogni singolo euro raccolto ci serve e verrà utilizzato e non sprecato. Aiutateci sostenendoci anche tramite la diffusione di questa campagna. Vi aspettiamo per un saluto e quattro chiacchiere al nostro stand, vi aspettiamo a braccia aperte a Lucca Comics and Games 2015.

Seguiteci sulle nostre pagine Facebook!!!



NOVITA' Passenger Press 2015.

Seguiteci sulla pagina ufficiale facebook delle AMAZZONI.

Seguiteci sulla pagina ufficiale facebook di DELICATESSEN.


L'albero della vita

The tree of life

di Riccardo Federici.


Pubblicazioni Passenger Press disponibili.

A questo LINK potete trovare maggiori informazioni e le preview dei singoli volumi.

Lista degli artisti per le commission.

  • Flaviano Armentaro
  • Laura Farina
  • Luca Conca
  • Lazzaro Losurdo
  • Christian G. Marra
  • Simone Pace
  • Andy Ventura
  • Gaetano Matruglio
  • Francesco Iaquinta
  • Gabriela Piky Hamilton
  • Cecilia Lo Valvo
  • Giorgio Gualandris

Prima di effettuare il perk, segnalateci con un messaggio il nome dell'artista e il tipo di commission che vorreste e vi diremo la sua disponibilità. Ad ogni modo continueremo a tenervi sempre aggiornati sugli impegni degli artisti coinvolti. Grazie.


International shipping costs.

For all the readers outside Italy borders, please add 10 euro for Europe and 15 euro for Asia and USA. Thanx!

Per cosa serviranno i fondi raccolti?

Come detto in precedenza, tutti i soldi raccolti ci saranno davvero utili. Per questo, dato che abbiamo ancora copie disponibili delle passate pubblicazioni, abbiamo scelto una raccolta flessibile. Una sorta di FUORI TUTTO non solo per liberare il magazzino per far posto ai nuovi libri, ma anche per lavorare al meglio e con più fondi.
Nel caso riuscissimo a raggiungere il nostro target di 2200 euro ecco come saranno impiegati i soldi, tolta la parte di tasse e le spese di spedizione che sono in media per l'Italia 4 euro di raccomandata in piego di libri inclusi nei perk:
  • 1400 euro per lo stand 
  • e il restante per aiutarci a pagare l'affitto del furgone
E se dovessimo superare la soglia prefissata, gli ulteriori soldi raccolti serviranno a finanziare i nuovi progetti. Se mai dovesse capitare Vi aggiorneremo, nel massimo della trasparenza.
Grazie di cuore,
Christian G. Marra.
story_txt:
La Passenger Press è nata nel 2007 con la sua prima pubblicazione The Passenger #0, un antologia di storie scritte da registi internazionali e disegnate da artisti italiani e stranieri, e da quell'anno è stata sempre presente con il suo stand alla fiera dei fumetti Lucca Comics and Games e per quattro anni anche alla fiera francese di Angouleme.Passenger Press non è una casa editrice tradizionale, ma piuttosto un collettivo multiculturale di artisti da tutto il mondo la cui finalità è promuovere il fumetto come media, stimolando la vostra curiosità al di fuori di tutto ciò che è mainstream.Personalmente il business non mi è mai interessato e tutto è sempre stato re-investito in nuove pubblicazioni. Il mio scopo primario sin dall'inizio è stato quello di fare fumetti nuovi e di promuovere i giovani artisti e quelli indie meno conosciuti grazie anche alla collaborazioni di professionisti noti e affermati. Ed è quello che faccio tutt'ora.Oggi sono qui a chiederVi di sostenere questa campagna di finanziamento per aiutare me e i miei compagni Passeggeri in vista della prossima Lucca Comics and Games 2015. Con i fondi raccolti grazie a questa speciale "svendita" estiva, finanzieremo l'affitto dello stand per la fiera e l'affitto del furgone con cui muoverci durante la manifestazione. Finalità pratiche per sostenerci in un ambiente dove la maggior parte dei lettori continua a seguire l'editoria mainstream e la distribuzione non aiuta i piccoli editori indie. A prezzi davvero scontatissimi potrete conoscere i nostri volumi d'esordio e alcune gemme ingiustamente poco conosciute. Inoltre sono disponibili tre succose novità:In prevendita Amazzoni, il nuovo progetto collettivo sempre in formato pocket con una storia completa di oltre 250 pagine;Delicatessen, la prima raccolta dei cinici disegni di Antonio Proietto con in regalo solo per le prime 100 copie la serie PINK delle Delicartoline;L'albero della vita, una serigrafia (27x38 cm su carta cotone 60% Fabriano Rosaspina Avorio) di Riccardo Federici in soli venti esemplari firmati e numerati a mano realizzata da quei matti di Perpetua!Per tutte queste ragioni la campagna è flessibile, perché veramente ogni singolo euro raccolto ci serve e verrà utilizzato e non sprecato. Aiutateci sostenendoci anche tramite la diffusione di questa campagna. Vi aspettiamo per un saluto e quattro chiacchiere al nostro stand, vi aspettiamo a braccia aperte a Lucca Comics and Games 2015.Seguiteci sulle nostre pagine Facebook!!!NOVITA' Passenger Press 2015.

story:
*Only included on shipping perks

The Journey

Hey there! 

My name is Raquel Simoso, also known as Skailla. I’m a comic artist from Brazil who’s always been passionate about telling stories and drawing animals. 

Over 10 years ago I came up with two characters, a wolf and a fox, who despite their opposite nature, formed a strong bond of friendship and love. They are Dikon and Amy. 

Over the years, they have been featured in a few projects, such as the animatic, Blue Blood, available on my YouTube channel. 

After over 5 months of work, this adventure came to life in the form of our newest book: Beyond the Woods, a story told entirely through color and expression in 100 fully illustrated pages.

After the amazing success of the Up and Ahead campaign (a big thank you to everyone who supported it!) our next step is our first hard covered book!

Where We're Going

Here’s where we need you - With your support, we’ll be able to print 500 copies of Beyond the Woods!  After researching and hunting around printshops for the best quality, I present to you how the funds will be applied:

What's There for You

Besides the printed book and PDF, check out what else you can take home with you!

- Your name on the Thank You Page!

- Your name on the Thank You Page
- Beyond the Woods PDF

- Your name on the Thank You Page
- Beyond the Woods PDF
- The complete Skailla PDF collection (Cowdogs, The Art of No North, Up and Ahead)

- Your name on the Thank You Page
- Beyond the Woods PDF
- Bookmark
- Beyond the Woods Printed Book!

- Your name on the Thank You Page

- Bookmark
- Beyond the Woods Printed Book!
- 2 surprise buttons 
- 2 A5 Prints

- Your name on the Thank You Page

- Up and Ahead comic book!

- x4 buttons  
- x3 awesome stickers 
- x2 A5 Prints
- x5 A4 Illustration Prints

- Your name on the Thank You Page!
- Beyond the Woods PDF
- The complete Skailla PDF collection (Cowdogs, The Art of No North, Up and Ahead)
- Bookmark
- Beyond the Woods Printed Book!
- Up and Ahead comic book!
- Cowdogs illustrated book!
- Skailla's Artbook!
- x4 buttons  
- x3 awesome stickers 
- x2 A5 Prints
​- x5 A4 Illustration Prints
- x3 Postcards
- One transparent commission + simple background version (See example here)

Stretch Goals

If the campaign is successful and we surpass our initial goal, here are some awesome rewards every supporter* will get as we reach new milestones!  

* This only applies to shipping perks

 

What are the risks?

This is an all or nothing campaign, meaning there are absolutely no risks. If the funding is successful, we’ll be able to print the books, if not, you’ll be fully refunded! 

 

Other ways you can help!

Even if you can't contribute to this campaign, you can always help by sharing the word on social media! This would help tons!

I thank you for your time and support, and wish you the most wonderful adventures ahead!

story:
Help the Trestle Foote Faerie MAKE A MOVIE & Run For President & Re-Enchant The Planet!

The Trestle Foote Faerie (Portrayed by Popular Singer/Songwriter/Comedienne Celia) is a Little Pink Faerie Who's Time Has Come.  She is making the Ultimate Faerie Sacrifice to come to America to OUR “Dementia” to help save Humanity.  Trestle heard somewhere that she could be of the most service by becoming the President.  Her goal is to learn as much as she can about Humans so she can best serve them & raise the vibrational level of the planet.  And boy oh boy could we use THAT right now!

Trestle is excited.....

To raise money for Bumper Stickers, Lawn Signs, T-Shirts, Buttons, Flyers, Websites, Video & Travel Budget, A Presidential Worthy Pink Wardrobe, and all the STUFF needed to spread the word & Re-Enchant The Planet.  She's even making a movie “The Trestle For President Movie”!  And YOU can sign up to have your own copy signed & delivered to your door!  (See perks to the right)

 

Make History!:

Donate to help this Little Pink Faerie bring her message to the Be-Fuddled-Huddled Masses.  This is the FIRST time EVER where a White Man, a Black Man, and a Little Pink Faerie are ALL Running For President at the SAME time!  “Lets all get together and start The Neapolitan Party!”  Says The Trestle Foote Faerie.

 

By The Way:

Trestle already has a “Super-Pac” with Glitter & Sparkles & Not-So-Imaginary Friends in it…so no worries there.  She doesn’t even really believe in money.  She just needs a little sumthin’ sumthin’ to get started with her Poly-Tickle Party:  The Pink Party of Compassion.

 

This is Cool:

When you Donate You Know EXACTLY where your money is going because you Personally GET COOL STUFF Every time you Donate!  Check the list to the right to find out all the Fantastic Ways you can Help Trestle AND get GREAT Stuff delivered right to your DOOR!   Now how many candidates can tell you EXACTLY where your money is going?  Yup….Thought so.

 

Short On Cash?

No Problem!  You can STILL help Trestle Run For President by sharing this link & Video with your lists and social media.  Trestle just might be the breath of fresh air that your tribe could benefit from today.  She lives to make you smile.

 

Just THINK....

What we can accomplish with a FRESH new look at creating a "Trestle-Topia" where each Being on the Planet is offered the chance to THRIVE rather than merely survive.  Everything is possible if you BELIEVE!

It wouldn't be Make-Believe if you Believed in Faeries!

 

Stay Tuned to The Tres For Pres campaign as Trestle’s “Platforms” are revealed.

 

http://www.TrestleForPresident.com

 

Remember:  This is FAR too Important to Take SERIOUSLY!

 

THE $100 YOUR CHOICE PACKAGE:  (There wasn't enough room in the Perks Column for this)

A.) Get a Signed DVD of "Trestle For President: The Movie" delivered to your door PLUS Download Package of 8 of Celia's Albums. This includes: Fire in the Head, Breathe, Red, Alabaster, & Blue, Naughty In Pink (The Trestle Foote Faerie), The Bard of Armagh: A Tribute to Tommy Makem, Irish Tales (Storytelling) Carry Me Home, & For The Asking.

B.) Custom Trestle Message Mp3 For you or someone you love Trestle will create a 3 minute or less Special Birf-Day message (or it could be an Anniversary, Wedding Announcement, Newborn Baby, Graduation, or ANY special Occasion) in the form of an mp3 that you can share with your loved one...or keep for yourself as a memento.  You can write it yourself or give Trestle some interesting Tid-Bits that she can use to create a special one of a kind message you can cherish forever.

C.) Outgoing Voice Message:  Trestle Will Be the Voice on your Outgoing Message on your answering machine or phone. Get Creative!  How many people can say that a Presidential Candidate is THEIR Outgoing message?  For $100 YOU Can say that!

MAKE SURE YOU TELL US WHICH PACKAGE YOU WANT WHEN YOU SIGN UP FOR THIS ONE:)

story:
Help launch Dr Phantom and his brilliant work across the world

Hi, my name is Steve Skinner, a Leeds based writer, all round creative chap who needs your help. I've spent ten years developing the material for Almost Everything Explained, which I am told is a hilarious and highly original book. It is the Nearly Complete Guide to the Universe, where the totally fictitious but brilliant scientist - Dr Phantom - explains:

Life on earth, great civilisations, mad scientists,

How the world started and what to do when it ends

How traffic wardens evolved from dinosaurs and where to go on holiday in the Bronze Age

With funding I will be able to print a hard copy of Almost Everything Explained and finally realise my dream of my first illustrated book of self published fiction. To do this I have already invested in a website, branding, social media and created the art work for the 104 page full colour book, using a professional designer, but now need help to get the off set litho rolling!

To print 1000 copies, I need exactly £5994 and need to raise this by mid September 2013. For only £50 you'll receive a printed copy of the publication, personally signed by the brilliant Hungarian, world famous and slightly eccentric Dr Phantom...if you're in a generous mood, a donation of £200 or over will give you an exclusive signed, high quality framed copy of an original full colour illustration from the book. However, a third option is you can receive the epub version of the book in return for donating £20. The gifts will be sent out after the book production in early October. If I don't hit our target, all monies raised will be used purely to print the book.

I am a successful trainer, writer and musician, with many years of experience of delivering on projects like this nature; I am a former arts administrator and professional song writer, now also band leader for a world music band called Fusion...

OK enough about me, but if you need to know more about Dr Phantom, please watch the video or get in touch.

Your contribution could help to introduce Dr Phantom to the world as one of the greatest thinkers of the 21st century! Please don't forget to share this campaign with all your friends, family, neighbours, camping buddies, car mechanics, funeral directors etc.

So thanks for reading all this and I hope to hear from you.

Steve Skinner

story:
Contest: Win a Portrait, Hardcover Book, Softcover Books

For each of the remaining weeks of the campaign I'll be giving away some additional rewards to everyone that donated in during that week. Everyone that donates in the next week is in the running for 2 free signed hardcover books, and 3 free softcover books, and 5 art prints of diary strips of your choice. It doesn't matter how much you donate or if you've already donated. Everyone that donates between March 13 and March 23th, 12:00 pm EST will be in the running for those giveaways. 

Free Bookplate, Buttons

If the campaign reaches 80 contributions I will include a free bookplate with each book. At 90 contributions I will also send a pack of buttons with each reward shipment. 

Update: Half Off Caffeinated Toothpaste: Volume 1

You can get a copy of Caffeinated Toothpaste: Volume 1 (2011, 103 pgs, black & white) for half price by adding $6 to your contribution. Please include a note about the book when making your contribution. Shipping is free for all initial contributions $25 and over, otherwise make sure you include a total of $5 for shipping.

Hello

My name is Josh Bauman and I'm an American cartoonist based in Berlin. For the past two years I've been drawing Caffeinated Toothpaste, my daily diary comic. Drawing a daily comic began as an exercise to improve my storytelling, writing, and art, though most of all, it was a way for me to do more of what I love most, which is making comics! After a few months and lots of great encouragement I decided to share the strips as a web comic. 

What began as an exercise started becoming more exciting for me. With each milestone I reached with the diary comic the more I wanted to keep on working on it. As months went by I found myself looking more and more forward to the part of the day I spent drawing a strip. After one year I self-published the first compilation of my diary strips.

 

Having just reached the 700-strip mark I have no plans of slowing down. I am, however, preparing my second compilation of diary strips. Unlike my first book, which was produced using print-on-demand publication, this second volume will be offset printed in vibrant full color. It's not just the color that's the different in this volume. Caffeinated Toothpaste: Volume 2 will be printed with far superior materials. Best of all, I'm working with a local printer and graphic designer! My personal goal for this project is to create the best looking book possible. 

What I Need

Using print-on-demand for my first book allowed me to order a small quantity of books at a given time. However, for high quality offset printing the entire order must be produced at once. Unfortunately offset printing requires a great deal of technical preparation. The initial setup for the print run makes up a majority of the expense whereas the actual cost of the printing materials is rather low, which makes it financially necessary to order a single larger shipment of books. 

The Book

The details of the book are: 

 

  • Format: 297 x 210 mm (11.7 x 8.3 in)  
  • Pages: 96 
  • Copies: 250
  • Color: 4-color offset printing for cover and interior
  • Contents: approximately 150 comics 
  • Cover: softcover, 300 gr. matte chromo board
  • Paper: 135 gr. white matte
  • Binding: PUR perfect bound
  • Produced locally entirely in Berlin
  • The final cost of the book will be approximately $25 (€20)
 

What You Get

Everyone that helps will be given credit in the printed version of the book and will also receive a PDF copy of the book. The $25 reward level is a pre-order of the book (not including shipping). Each book will be signed to your specification and I'll also draw a little picture in there.

At the $100 reward level you will get a signed limited edition hardcover book, created specially for this campaign. As with the softcover version, I will also sketch a small picture inside. 

Rewards at $300 and up include limited edition prints and original art as well as both hard and softcover books.  

At the $2000 level is will draw a diary strip about you and your support. That strip will be published online, printed in the book, and you will receive the original framed hand-inked comic. In addition, you will also receive both hard and softcover books.

The ultimate reward level at $4000 is a tour of my Berlin studio (travel expenses not included). From there we'll venture to the best comic and coffee shops around. Sights will be seen, delicious foods will be eaten, and the day's activities will be turned into a diary strip and published. You'll receive the original framed hand-inked comic.  

You can see the full list of rewards on the right-hand side of this page.

Keep your eyes peeled for additional rewards as the campaign continues. 

 

Still Want To Do More?

Please help share this project with others. Think about sharing a link to a favorite diary strip and this page. 

 

 

Shipping

Shipping and handling costs have been included in the reward descriptions. If you require any special information about shipping to your address please do not hesitate to contact me.
 
The PDF copy of the book will be emailed at the conclusion of the campaign when the final layout is established. Stickers, postcards, softcover books, and art prints (including framed prints) will begin shipping in April, 2012. Hardcover books and hand-inked prints will ship by May, 2012. Portraits or personalized strips will be completed within two weeks of having received reference material.
story_txt:
Contest: Win a Portrait, Hardcover Book, Softcover Books
For each of the remaining weeks of the campaign I'll be giving away some additional rewards to everyone that donated in during that week. Everyone that donates in the next week is in the running for 2 free signed hardcover books, and 3 free softcover books, and 5 art prints of diary strips of your choice. It doesn't matter how much you donate or if you've already donated. Everyone that donates between March 13 and March 23th, 12:00 pm EST will be in the running for those giveaways. 

Free Bookplate, Buttons


If the campaign reaches 80 contributions I will include a free bookplate with each book. At 90 contributions I will also send a pack of buttons with each reward shipment. 
Update: Half Off Caffeinated Toothpaste: Volume 1

You can get a copy of Caffeinated Toothpaste: Volume 1 (2011, 103 pgs, black & white) for half price by adding $6 to your contribution. Please include a note about the book when making your contribution. Shipping is free for all initial contributions $25 and over, otherwise make sure you include a total of $5 for shipping.

story:
Legends of the Lone Wolf

This full color 80 page anthology was handcrafted by a series of different teams. As the character's creator, I joined with artists Marshall Lee and Jeremy Peerboom to tell two different tales from Wolf's past. I also enlisted the talents of Cal Jameson, J. Paul Schiek, Jameson McCrann and Joey Tremblay to join me in the storytelling.

Unlike other anthology books, Legends of the Lone Wolf also contains a 38 page feature length supernatural story designed by Matthew Merz and Mior Muneer. That's nearly twice the size of a regular comic book!

Go read Lone Wolf issue one in Black and White for free! https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fdggRvxGsJjDcq...

 

What We Need 

With your support, we will bring you a perfect bound 80 page book of the highest quality.  Everyone involved has donated their time and talent, and all money will go to printing and shipping before any of the creators turn a profit. 

Lone Wolf Issue 1 Variant Cover

This campaign is the only way to get the variant Aged Edition of Lone Wolf #1. This highly unique version of our first issue will be printed on a stunning aged newsprint - which gives the book an old-timey, historical feel - and will feature an all new cover by Muttman.

Stretch Goals!

We have added a bunch of extras for all orders!

2 11x17 pinups

4 trading cards

stickers

The Banjoman Ashcan

The book went from 80 pages to 120!
 

Cover Art by Bruce Patnaude

Page by J. Paul Schiek

Page by Jameson McCrann

 

Pages by Mior Muneer

 

Page by Marshall Lee

Art by Jameson McCrann

story:
From Eisner Award-nominee Brian Stelfreeze (artist of Marvel’s Black Panther) and writer Doug Wagner (Plastic, The Ride: Burning Desire) comes THOMAS RIVER #1, their all new 48-page creator owned comic book. 

And what may be the best news of all, THE COMIC IS ALREADY FINISHED and just waiting for this campaign to end so we can put the book directly into your hands. No, that's not a typo... THE ART, COLORS, & LETTERING ARE COMPLETE. We just need to know how many copies to print.

See, the decision to do this campaign wasn't made a few weeks ago to capitalize on a new trend; we've been planning this for a while, and hope you'll be excited about the opportunity to fund a project and quickly have a digital copy to read while the book goes to press.  

The Pitch

Thomas River is known as a world renowned engineer among his metropolitan friends. He jets around the globe as a consultant to the biggest engineering firms, but that is simply a cover. In reality, River is the quintessential secret agent—equivalent to Jason Bourne, Ethan Hunt, and James Bond in every manner but one… he is a Black man. Raised by his working class family in Baltimore, Thomas was an exceptionally gifted student. While he could have gone down the wrong path, and almost did, Thomas' mother simply wouldn't let it happen. After buckling down, Thomas  earned a full-ride to  Cornell, where he double-majored in Structural Engineering and Linguistics. Graduating with honors, the CIA saw his true potential and recruited him into their ranks. And he did not disappoint. 

Think John Wick meets James Bond in tone and attitude; basically, the most bad ass American secret agent ever.

The Story

In this debut book, a terrorist attack unlike anything seen since 9/11 hits the United States. Many lives are lost, and as one of the attacks is in Baltimore, it hits all too close to home for Thomas River. But before the day is over, River is called in by the President of the United States herself, and charged with tracking down the people who orchestrated and carried out this heinous act. As River chases leads across the globe in his effort to bring the guilty to justice, he will discover the plot goes deeper than he could have ever imagined.

The Team

The character and concept are from the mind of acclaimed comic creator, Brian Stelfreeze. Brian is best known for his career-defining work with Ta-Nehisi Coates on the reboot of Marvel's Black Panther, his record-setting 50 consecutive covers of Batman: Shadow of the Bat, and a 30+ year career that includes work at every major publisher. 

He is joined on this project by his partner in crime, writer Doug Wagner. Doug's work includes titles such as Batman: Arkham Origins, Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight, and comic book adaptions of both The Flash and Arrow TV shows, but he's best known for his smash-hit series, PLASTIC, the critically-acclaimed heist series, THE HARD PLACE, and most recently, THE RIDE: BURNING DESIRE. 

  • The Colors are by Michelle Poust, a talented newcomer who honed her skills under the tutelage of Stelfreeze himself.   
  • Letters are by Ed Dukeshire, the Harvey Award-nominated letterer of books such as Power Rangers, Day Men, and Grant Morrison's Klaus.
  • Book Design (as well as the design work for this campaign) is being handled by Sasha E. Head, whose work can be found in Jonathan Hickman's Decorum, and the award-winning comics magazine, Image+. 
  • THOMAS RIVER is being produced by 12-Gauge Comics, home of the critically-acclaimed titles, PLASTIC, THE RIDE, LOOSE  ENDS, & KILL WHITEY DONOVAN, among many others. 12-Gauge is now in it's 16th year of making great comics, and will make sure this campaign goes off as smoothly as possible.

story:
Short Summary

For those of you who don't know Steve, his career began in 1981 with his and co-creator Mike Baron’s groundbreaking “Nexus” comic series. This space saga catapulted Rude into the field of comics, where he became highly sought after by major publishers. During his first few years in the industry, Steve’s efforts led to numerous awards, such as the 1984 Russ Manning Newcomer Award, the Kirby Award for best artist in 1986, and numerous Eisner’s for artistic achievement. For over two decade Steve has drawn hundreds of comic’s greatest iconic heroes, and has galvanized the art world as a comic magazine artist and illustrator.

Steve would like to do a limited print run of 1,000 sketchbooks. Unlike previous years, this one will be in full color allowing Steve to feature color commissions and paintings.  It also includes pages directly from his much sought after sketchbooks.

Don't forget to click that Facebook "like" button above and help me spread the word about Steve's book. Thank you!

What We Need & What You Get

The cost of printing the sketchbook is $5,500 + $1,000 estimated on shipping/packing/insurance costs.  As a special bonus we are offering not 1, not 2, but 3 exclusive presale prints!

WE WILL SIGNING/NUMBERING THE SKETCHBOOK

Any funds exceeding the $6,500 needed for the book will go towards funding more new Nexus books and creating more fantastic art for the next annual sketchbook!

Specs on the book:

  • Scetchbook 68 + cover (Image shown on video is NOT real sketchbook, final will be more the thickness of a magazine)
  • cover 100# gloss cover- full color
  • inside 80# matte text - full color
  • size: 8.5x11
  • saddle stitched
  • limited printing of 500-1,000 based on presales
  • all books will be signed/numbered

International Orders – Please ad $10 to help cover shipping

Everyone who contributes - even $1 is entered into random drawings that we will be holding throughout the campaign period.  Items will be everything from original art and commission sketches to Nexus books and  other Steve Rude items!  Stay tuned for details!
 
 
Preview of the art:
 
LIMITED EDITION SHEENA PRINT (LIMITED TO 50)

story:
To our outstanding fans!

As most of you know, when Dane and I started Punisher: Body Count, it was mainly as an outlet for him and me to stay in touch with each other after he moved from the Indianapolis area.  And even though I knew our show would be extremely entertaining, I didn’t expect it to mean so much to so many people.

Dane and I have always seen this show as a hobby, not a career.  As such, we have always paid for things like equipment, hosting fees, advertising, guest appearances, etc. out of our own pockets.  

I record the show on the laptop that I bought shortly after starting the show.  75% of what I use my laptop for is work for the show.  Since that time, I have had to replace the screen, a charger, and numerous batteries.  On top of that, I have had to format and reinstall everything twice throughout the years.  It’s safe to say that my laptop is more used and worn out than a Dollar General employee!  Unfortunately due to major expenses accrued as a home owner, I don’t have any disposable income to replace it at this time.

To make sure the proverbial trains run on time, I am coming to you guys for help.  If you enjoy the great content we provide, and you want to make sure it keeps coming to you without interruption, then please make a gift to our fundraising effort!  All funds raised will be solely spent on replacing my computer.  If we  raise funds above and beyond the cost of a new computer, we plan on expanding our merchandise, getting more guests on the show, and creating more P:BC Prime Cuts.

We plan to keep the show 100% free and put out episodes as we always have.  A donation from you guys will help Dane and I get episodes out to you all faster than ever, and we have also lined up gifts so no good deed goes unrewarded. Thanks for listening!

Thanks for listening!

story:
Short Summary

Steve's career began in 1981 with his and co-creator Mike Baron’s groundbreaking “Nexus” comic series. This space saga catapulted Rude into the field of comics, where he became highly sought after by major publishers. During his first few years in the industry, Steve’s efforts led to numerous awards, such as the 1984 Russ Manning Newcomer Award, the Kirby Award for best artist in 1986, and numerous Eisner’s for artistic achievement. For over two decade Steve has drawn hundreds of comic’s greatest iconic heroes, and has galvanized the art world as a comic magazine artist and illustrator.


Thanks to your support we have 9 sketchbooks and are doing another for 2014!  Books include private commissions, paintings, and pages from his private sketchbook.  As a special bonus we are offering 3 exclusive presale prints, a special bookmark, postcard, and a Saturday Morning Memories book which is collection of characters from his favorite Saturday Morning cartoon shows

What We Need &
What You Get

The cost of printing the sketchbook, prints, and other incentives is $10,000 + $2,000 estimated on shipping/packing/insurance costs.  The book will go forward without full funding, but we will be forced to cut the page count to make this project possible.

Specs on the book:

  • Sketchbook 112 + cover
  • cover 100# gloss cover- full color
  • inside 80# matte text - full color
  • size: 8.5x11
  • perfect bound (has a spine)
  • limited printing based on presales
International Orders – Please ad funds noted in perk to help cover shipping

PERKS INCLUDE:

  • 2014 Sketchbook with Superman or Alternate Marilyn Cover & PDF
  • Exclusive bookmark & postcard
  • Random Steve Rude comic book & trading card
  • Saturday Morning Memories 20 page photo book
  • 2014 exclusive prints
  • Past year sketchbooks, PDFs, and prints
  • Custom Marker Sketch inside your book
  • Original Artwork
  • Weekend private lesson
  • GIRL SCOUT COOKIES FOR OUR TROOPS

The Impact

The 2014 sketchbook is our 9th annual and we look forward to making it the best sketchbook yet.  We started in 2003 with a black and white only book and we've come a long way since then!  2013 was our first FULL COLOR sketchbook and we're excited to expand the sketchbook to 112 pages!  Steve takes the time to inspect each image for quality control and unlike other "fan" sketchbook we take the time to make sure every step is done to perfection so we have a final product we can be proud of!

FOR EVERY DONATION OF $30 OR MORE WE WILL WILL DONATE A BOX OF COOKIES TO OUR MILITARY THROUGH THE GIRL SCOUTS!

Other Ways You Can Help

Click the Facebook "LIKE" button, tweet, shake down your buddies at your local comic book shop, THE DUDE is creating another masterpiece and you MUST be on board or lose out on an amazing package!

Stretch Goals

$10,000: Guarantees 112 pages!
CONTRIBUTIONS OF $25 OR MORE (EXCLUDES DIGITAL ONLY):
$15,000: Exclusive notepad mailed with all orders + 4th print
$20,000: Exclusive custom pen + 5th print
$30,000: Exclusive Custom USB Flash Drive
$40,000: Nexus Black TShirt any size

View GALLERY tab for full visuals on perks and comparison chart

shipping/packing/insurance costs.  The book will go forward without full funding, but we will be forced to cut the page count to make this project possible.Specs on the book:

Sketchbook 112 + cover 

cover 100# gloss cover- full color
inside 80# matte text - full color
size: 8.5x11
perfect bound (has a spine)

limited printing based on presales

International Orders – Please ad funds noted in perk to help cover shippingPERKS INCLUDE:

2014 Sketchbook with Superman or Alternate Marilyn Cover & PDF

Exclusive bookmark & postcard
Random Steve Rude comic book & trading card
Saturday Morning Memories 20 page photo book
2014 exclusive prints
Past year sketchbooks, PDFs, and prints
Custom Marker Sketch inside your book
Original Artwork
Weekend private lesson
GIRL SCOUT COOKIES FOR OUR TROOPS

The ImpactThe 2014 sketchbook is our 9th annual and we look forward to making it the best sketchbook yet.  We started in 2003 with a black and white only book and we've come a long way since then!  2013 was our first FULL COLOR sketchbook and we're excited to expand the sketchbook to 112 pages!  Steve takes the time to inspect each image for quality control and unlike other "fan" sketchbook we take the time to make sure every step is done to perfection so we have a final product we can be proud of!FOR EVERY DONATION OF $30 OR MORE WE WILL WILL DONATE A BOX OF COOKIES TO OUR MILITARY THROUGH THE GIRL SCOUTS!Other Ways You Can HelpClick the Facebook "LIKE" button, tweet, shake down your buddies at your local comic book shop, THE DUDE is creating another masterpiece and you MUST be on board or lose out on an amazing package!Stretch Goals
$10,000: Guarantees 112 pages!CONTRIBUTIONS OF $25 OR MORE (EXCLUDES DIGITAL ONLY):$15,000: Exclusive notepad mailed with all orders + 4th print$20,000: Exclusive custom pen + 5th print$30,000: Exclusive Custom USB Flash Drive$40,000: Nexus Black TShirt any size
View GALLERY tab for full visuals on perks and comparison chart

story:
The Book

Stefano Cardoselli's Walk

In the hellishly repressive 'utopia' of America's not-too-distant future, mindless televised violence is the last surviving art form. A dying society's final means of catharsis finds its ultimate expression in The Tower Of Justice, seventeen stories of carnage and cameras, where hundreds of condemned criminals fight to the death daily in glorious prime time. Enter Garrotte, a living mountain of muscle and angst, a man determined to take the 'long walk' to the top of the tower, where, it's just possible, the ultimate prize of freedom awaits...

“Walk is a mix of sci-fi and ultraviolence inspired by magazines like 2000AD and Lobo by Simon Bisley. I will be hand-coloring the book...” -Stefano Cardoselli, Story and Art

“Without a doubt the most over-the-top violent comic I have ever worked on.” -Stephen Nelson, Writer

"Stefano Cardoselli - I hate this guy! I've only published everything he's sent me! I think he can draw his ass off, and look forward to his next contribution." - Kevin Eastman, Heavy Metal Editor-in-Chief

Book Details - 32 pgs, FC, one-shot

What We Need & What You Get

We promise you, you have never seen anything like "Stefano Cardoselli's Walk" and we want to bring you this incredible epic of ultraviolence in the best possible format. To do that, we will be using a traditional off-set printer and we need your help to cover that cost.

In addition to the book itself, the artist, Stefano Cardoselli, has come up with some very unique items to offer our supporters including Ultra-Limited Edition Resin Figures, handpainted buttons, and original art! We are also offering an exclusive sketchbook, stickers, trading cards, limited edition T-Shirts, and a Limited Edition handsewn Garrotte Wrestling Mask!!!

All orders will be met even if we do not reach our goal here. If we do reach our goal, a surprise bonus perk will be given to ALL of our supporters! All funds raised will be used to bring you the highest quality products possible.

Shipping

Shipping for the US is included in the cost of the perk. For non-US Supporters please add 3.00US to your contribution to help cover the cost of shipping.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute any money (We all know what it's like to be broke), you can still help us out by spreading the word about this campaign. Tweet about it, post about it on Facebook, mention it to your local comic and book stores... Every little bit will help and it will be greatly appreciated!

Follow us at thirstyshadow.com

and on facebook www.facebook.com/thirstyshadow

The Perks

$1

Your name in print!

A $1 donation not only earns our eternal gratitude but we will print your name in the pdf and on a special thank you page of the book! We will also add your name to a thank you section on the ThirstyShadow website and facebook page! Every donation gets this perk!

 

$3

pdf of the book

A pdf of Walk when completed. Your chance to see this epic before anyone else!

 

$5

A copy, pdf, and Garrotte Thumbwrestling Mask!

A copy of the book when printed and a pdf of the book when completed and an Exclusive Garrotte Thumbwrestling Mask!

 

$10

Exclusive Cards and Stickers!

Exclusive Trading Card Set of 3 and an Exclusive Sticker Pack of 3 featuring images from Walk in addition to the Thumbwrestling Mask, a copy of the book when printed and a pdf of the book when completed.

 

$15

Exclusive Sketchbook!

An Indiegogo Exclusive Walk Sketchbook by Stefano Cardoselli! You get a printed and pdf copy of the Sketchbook in addition to the Card Set, Sticker Pack, Thumbwrestling Mask, a copy of Walk and a pdf of Walk when completed.

 

$25

Limited Walk T-shirt!

Your choice of Limited Edition Walk T-Shirts! T-shirt Style A features the cover image of Walk. T-Shirt Style B features the main character, Garrotte, with his chainsaw. You will also get the Exclusive Card Set, the Exclusive Sticker Set, a copy of the book when printed and a pdf of the book when completed. This perk will also get the added Sketchbook perk and the added Thumbwrestling Mask!

Shirts available in S, M, L, XL, XXL

Please Specify Style A or B and size when ordering.

 

$50

Handpainted Button Set!

Exclusive Walk Pin Button Set of 5 handmade and handpainted by the artist, Stefano Cardoselli!!! Only 3 sets will be made!!! You also get your choice of T-shirt, Style A -Walk cover or Style B- Garrotte, the Exclusive Card Set, the Exclusive Sticker Pack, the Thumbwrestling Mask, a copy of Walk and a copy of the Sketchbook in print and pdf formats!

Shirts available in S, M, L, XL, XXL

Please Specify Tee Style A or B and Shirt Size when ordering!

Only 3 available!

 

$75

Garrotte Handmade Wrestling Mask!

Own your own Limited Edition Garrotte Wrestling Mask! Handsewn Adult Size Wrestling Mask patterned after Garrotte's own!!! You also get your choice of T-shirt, Style A -Walk cover or Style B- Garrotte, the Exclusive Card Set, the Exclusive Sticker Pack, Thumbwrestling Mask, a copy of Walk and a copy of the Sketchbook in print and pdf formats!

Shirts available in S, M, L, XL, XXL

Only 5 Available!

 

$100

Original Sketch!

Original Sketch from Italian Artist, Stefano Cardoselli! You will also get your choice of T-shirt, Style A or Style B, The Exclusive Card Set, The Exclusive Sticker Set, the Thumbwrestling Mask, a copy of Walk and a copy of the Sketchbook in print and pdf formats!

Shirts available in S, M, L, XL, XXL

Please Specify Tee Style A or B and Shirt Size when ordering!

Only 5 available!

$100

Walk Resin Figure!

Made directly from the Master Sculpt sculpted by the extraordinary artist, Rita Gorgoni! Exclusive Ultra Ltd Ed of 10 handcrafted, handpainted resin figures of the main character, Garrotte, from Stefano Cardoselli's Walk!

You also get your choice of T-shirt, Style A or B, The Exclusive Card Set, The Exclusive Sticker Set, Thumbwrestling Mask, a copy of Walk and a copy of the Sketchbook in print and pdf formats!

Shirts available in S, M, L, XL, XXL

Specify Tee Style A or B and Shirt Size when ordering!

Only 10 available!

 

$200

Take the Walk with Garrotte!

Be a part of the ultraviolent saga of Garrotte!Stefano Cardoselli will add you as a character in the book! Act fast, only six of you will face Garrotte in the Tower! You will also get your choice of T-shirt, Style A or Style B, The Exclusive Card Set, The Exclusive Sticker Set, Thumbwrestling Mask, a copy of Walk and a copy of the Sketchbook in print and pdf formats!

Shirts available in S, M, L, XL, XXL

Please Specify Tee Style A or B and Shirt Size when ordering!

Only 3 available!

 

$300

Murdered by Garrotte Art!

You heard it right! Your chance to be murdered by the main character of Walk in a piece of original art by Stefano Cardoselli! You will also get your choice of T-shirt, Style A or Style B, The Exclusive Card Set, The Exclusive Sticker Set, Thumbwrestling Mask, a copy of Walk and a copy of the Sketchbook in print and pdf formats.

Shirts available in S, M, L, XL, XXL

Please Specify Tee Style A or B and Shirt Size when ordering!

Only 3 available!

 

$300

Masterpiece Figure!

The Master Sculpt of the Walk "Garrotte" Action figure! You will also get your choice of T-shirt, Style A or Style B, The Exclusive Card Set, The Exclusive Sticker Set, a copy of the book when printed, a pdf of the book when completed. This perk will also get the added Sketchbook perk and the Thumbwrestling Mask!

Shirts available in S, M, L, XL, XXL

Please Specify Tee Style A or B and Shirt Size when ordering!

Only 1 available - SOLD OUT!

story:
Short Summary

i make these terrible comics about social justice warriors on tumblr and thats literally akin to being hitler. i must be stopped.

    The Impact

    with my blog gone, you (as a social justice warrior) will have all the freedom in the world to whine, piss and moan about privilege and cultural appropriation and all that other good shit in situations where neither privilege or cultural appropriation or racism or sexism or transphobia is relevant! think of all the opportunities youll now have to bully other people who dont share the same opinions as you, now that a near 30 year old isnt there to shine a mirror in your stupid acne-riddled faces

    Risks & Challenges

    RISKS AND CHALLENGES TO THIS CHAMPAGNE INCLUDE:

    • i may not actually delete my tumblr
    • in fact i might just make a shitload more comics just to spite you
    • the money donated may actually help me in some way
    • extra funds will actually be contributed to a charity that ISN'T your private paypal account or amazon wishlist
    • i... might actually delete my tumblr?

      Other Ways You Can Help

      HELP THIS CAUSE by iunno w/e this shit dont matter to me

Silicon Heroes successfully launched! You can buy the book on Amazon!

 

Over $5,000 from this Indiegogo was donated to Girls Who Code and Code.org! Thank you to all the backers for your support.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Editor Mark Irwin and Illustrator Michael Penick 

 



     

 

Acknowledgements

Special thanks to many, many people that have helped bring this project to life:

  • Michael Penick for breathing life into Silicon Heroes with his art
  • Mark Irwin for managing the process and editing the script
  • Alexis Cox for her marketing prowess
  • Steve Norfleet and Collin McCormack at Silicon Valley Bank for filming
  • Bo Obradovic for editing the video
  • My Kauffman Fellows family for your support

That's it. Please pledge your support and together we can bring Silicon Heroes to life!

story:
NOTE: This campaign is over, but you can still buy books, read the comic, and get news of future print runs at seiyuucrush.net   (((o(*ﾟ▽ﾟ*)o)))

What is it all about?

 Beginning in February 2011 with a scene that was inspired by a few words from the lyrics of a sappy J-pop song, we quickly went from creating something that was just awesome fun, to something so amazingly important to us. As these guys stepped forward to reveal themselves and their stories, we began to love each one of them fiercely. Their world is our world now, and we need to tell their stories.

You can currently read over 620 pages in webcomic format at seiyuucrush.net.

  • CRUSH! is a story about falling in love when you thought you didn't want to... but maybe you actually did.
  • A story about finding your place in the past and the future.
  • A story about learning to trust, and realizing what you needed, wanted was there the whole time.
  • A sprinkling of humor, eccentricity, hidden secrets, and confessions - the first two volumes of CRUSH! are where all the magic begins, where the first strings are woven.

You can read 630+ pages of their stories right now at seiyuucrush.net

Help us print books!

Volumes 1 & 2 will cover Scenes 1-13 (drawn between 2011-2014) and some features are:

  • 240+ pages each
  • extra content including bonus endings to chapters
  • 7x10" - bigger than a standard manga!

Pages have been touched up from the originals and we're revealing the never-before-seen cover art.

The goal we've set is for printing a very short run of each book. We have a printer set up and ready to go - we just need the funds. Whether you're a long-time CRUSH! fan, or you just stumbled across this page and want to support gay folks in comics, your support means something!

Here's what you'll get

(All rewards include free USA shipping. $5 and $15 levels include free worldwide shipping.)

Risks & Challenges

Our campaign is all-or-nothing - meaning if we don't reach our goal, it won't happen.

The pages are drawn and print-ready, and we have quotes from a printer ready to print us books. We expect to have books ready within a month of the end of the campaign, around late January, 2017. Should any unforeseen delays come up with the printer, we will let all backers know of the new estimated delivery time right away.

We have experience in shipping both domestic and international, and are confident in our ability to get all packages out to you quickly.

Spread the Word

If you can't contribute a lot of money, you can help us out by spreading the word about our campaign. Please tell your friends, your groups, your social networks, strangers on the train - tell everyone! Go to our Twitter or Tumblr and give us a signal boost, and we will see and appreciate your awesomeness.

 

Ready to contribute? Scroll up and click on the "perk" package that you want, or click "Back it" to donate without a reward. ❤
